Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: VLye
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited Dubai in March2012 and stayed at Habtoor Grand. It was a wonderful experience as the facilities are very good and the staff were all very helpful and made our stay smooth as all our needs was well taken care of. I also had to use the business centre and it was manned by a very sweet and pleasant Filipina by the name of Yogz. She was truly professional and I managed to complete my tasks in the shortest possible time and could have more time to take in the sights, shopping, etc with my wife. Thank you Yogz, Habtoor and Dubai. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Resort”
Reviews.Author: SQgolfer
Reviews.Content: Excellent staff with a fast and easy check-in. The room was spacious and clean with beautiful views of the gulf. Spacious and clean bathroom with excellent amenities. Coffee maker in the room with adequate coffee and tea selection. Fridge also had enough space to put ones own drinks. Lots to do at the resort, with a beach, excellent swimming pool, tennis courts, gym and nightclub. A short walk to the JBR shops. Good food and plenty of restaurants on premises. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor Grand”
Reviews.Author: Martin S
Reviews.Content: Booked for the Habtoor Grand then read the reviews and was nervous about the hotel particularly the noise. I have to say i was pleasently surprised. Our room did not suffer from noise (other then the normal traffic noise you get in a city). The room was spacious, clean and well equiped. The staff were helpful and polite. The facilities were good especially the tennis courts and gym. Food was of the standard you expect. The location was excellent with shops and restaurants a short walk away. The main attractions of Dubai were a short cheap taxi drive from the hotel. The only down side to the hotel is breakfast time. Towards the end of the holiday we found we had to queue to get into breakfast which you don't expect for this standard hotel. However, this is a minor thing which shouldn't detract from a good holiday at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This is NO LONGER a luxury Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NijoleEngland
Reviews.Content: Costing 304 euro per night, you would expect high standards. I stayed here before 5 years ago and was very satisifed. Firstly, the staff now are not properly trained, and do not make you welcome.The place needs refurbishment, as it is now worn and tired. We had 6 bad nights out of 8, as the music bar blared crazily from 12pm until the people dispersed at 3.30am. Could not sleep. After complaining they moved us to another room, assuring us that it is a quiet room. I could not believe it, the noise was the same, they did not care. If you want loud music in the early hours, and want to pay a high price for a basic standard room, then book here !

Reviews.Title: “It' s a great experience!”
Reviews.Author: James A
Reviews.Content: Habtoor is a great experience for us. And if I will go back in Dubai I will choose Habtoor again. Receptionist like Tonette & Wendy are very courteous & very professional. They both & the other staffs made our stay in habtoor more enjoyable. The food is great!The best' of all we feel very secured while we stay here for almost 3 weeks. Thanks a lot for the security guards.Hope we can stay again soon. Also the housekeepers did a great jod! And pls give my warmest' greetings to Ms.Tonette & Ms.Wendy . Thank you & God bless..

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: BevC8Luton
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the habtoor for 3 nights as a stopover on route to Oz in Dec 2011. I had concerns as had read quite a few negative reviews after I had booked it but was pleasantly surprised. I had booked for bed and breakfast but when we checked in we were told that we had been upgraded to half board. We had a garden room overlooking the pool, the room was great, although the music from the pool area was quite loud at night, which only affected us on our first night as we were shattered from travelling and was in bed by 11, but the rest of our stay was not a problem as we were out until late. The restuarant in the hotel was excellent, plenty of choice and good food. The pool areas were spotless as was the whole complex the beach area was ideal. Staff friendly and helpful, plenty of bars to choose from, the hotel was ideally located. I would recommend this hotel. The only minus was the music was played too loud until 1am most evenings, therefor maybe not suitable for couples with young children or those who want an early night!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing”
Reviews.Author: holidaylady21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 1 week with my 21 yr old daughter, the service in the hotel ranges from really bad to really good, the staff on reception who never smile, are unfriendly, unhelpful, and downright rude, the staff at the pool and beach are fantastic. While we couldn't fault the food at breakfast, there was never a juice glass available for 7 mornings, we had to ask 2 to 3 times for coffee, and when we went to help ourselves to the buffet, our table was taken when we came back, embarrassing all round. Definately not worth the money paid to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: MrAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts about the hotel after reading some of the negative reviews. We stayed here for a week at the end of Feb. and had a great time in this resort. Our kids loved it! The first 3 nights we stayed in a Family Room on the 9th floor overlooking the Horizon Lounge pool deck bar on the 3rd floor. Sunday and Monday night to our satisfaction but on Tuesday night there was a pool party and I must say the music was very loud. Luckily our kids fell asleep but we didn't and the music lasted until 02.00 AM. We complained about the music the same night and the next morning the reception desk called us and offered us a room on the other side of the tower as the next pool party was scheduled on Thursday. This room on the 11th floor turned out to be a Club Suite overlooking the marina and the palm island. Excellent service and no more complaints from our side about the loud music! Other than that both the family room and the club suite are very spacious and the beds are big and comfortable. The staff is extremely friendly and their service is excellent. The food in the buffet restaurant is good; it's not exquisite but tasteful, fresh and the variety is great. Every night different dishes are being served. The price for a pint of Heineken or a glass of wine is EUR7,50. The location of the hotel is good: at the beach and around the corner from the Dubai Walk. A taxi to the Dubai mall/Burj Khalifa will cost approx. EUR10 one-way. Positive: spacious rooms, friendly staff, excellent service, good restaurant, kids club + playground, nice beach and pool, large variety of restaurants and bars Negative: loud music pool deck bar, water slide area needs renovation, fairly big number of Russian guests

Reviews.Title: “Excellent beach hotel”
Reviews.Author: Trevor H
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, try and opt for a room in one of the high levels in one of the two towers, some of the rooms in the area around the pool back on to the back of the hotel, with no views. The rooms are all well equipped and spacious. again tower rooms seem to be slightly better quality with more space and huge walk-in showers, the others are still very good. Nice pool area with restaurants and bar scattered nearby. There is a disco on the roof terrace that can be a little noisy, generally not an interference but I stayed hear once and it did go on till early hours, as my room backed on to the hotel directly by the disco this was a bit of an issue, although the other 5 nights I stayed there was no noise. Right on Jumeirah beach and close to close to the marina, local shops and restaurants to visit as well as the 12 restaurants in the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Fairly good hotel”
Reviews.Author: MagellanMilan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean, right on the beach, on the left side of the channel of the Jumeirah Marina sourrounded by new skyscrapres. Food is excellent, the room very wide with a partial view of the sea (12th floor) and a fantastic bed. Two limits in my assessment: First time not only in Dubai but also in the Gulf region. So I do not know what the local standands are. And the hotel was paid by the conference organizers as I was a speaker. Nevertheless, although it is an 'old' hotel compared with others in the brand-new Dubai. I think it is a pleasant place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean 5* Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Imran190579
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights and would recommend over other 5* which are overpriced in my view.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay.”
Reviews.Author: Husain A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this property with my friends for 1 night only but it was memorable. Got a spacious room with a good view. This place has a lot of hangouts. There a 2 clubs - one on the beach side & the other on the 3rd floor..... both were rocking! Good variety of restaurants to meet with different people's tastes. The pool side is amazing as well. Wish to have stayed for a few more days!!

Reviews.Title: “not a 5star hotel”
Reviews.Author: seska1
Reviews.Content: stayed here for our 50 birthday the location is nice on the beach, but hotel is more a 3/4 hotel, could do with a face lift, upgraded to a sea view high room which would have been great if not overlooking the nightclub, if you value a good quite nights sleep do not stay here! only had breakfast in resturant and it was a bit of a free for all cafiteria style and took to long to get tea/coffee. the swimming pool is big and nice and we always got loungers very easy, and access to beach is good. there is a nice quite child free infinity pool. i would not stay here again, there are much nicer and better value for money hotels in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: zunaira b
Reviews.Content: Me and my family stayed at the habtoor last year June/July for over a week and there were a number off issues at first. 1) we had to wait four hours for our room, we were hot, tired and wanted to rest as we just got off a flight and although we were told we could go to the spa to freshen up we just wanted to get to our rooms and sleep. We do understand that check in time wasnt till 3pm and we arrived in the morning however it was a bit off a let down that the house keeping team wasnt working fast enough and werent organised. 2) another issue was that the AC in one off our rooms wasnt working and maintanence had to come more the 4 times to fix it and they still didnt manage to resolve it. 3) too much noise from the clubs and shisha bar outside. However I didnt mind as it was entertaining to have music on, although some people may find it disturbing. Although there were 3 bad points, the mangement and the team made it a wonderful stay as they made it right for us. they gave us complementry breakfast in our room everyday!!! :) they arranged TWO cars to the airport complementry!!! they also served us breakfast early in the morning before breakfast was even being served!!! the hotel was BEAUTIFUL! right near the beach! EXCELLENT and NICE pool, VERY relaxing! good for couples, families and friends!! I WOULD DEFFENTLY STAY THERE AGAIN! IN FACT I WILL !! Thank you to the habtoor team for an excellent service, they really did take care off us!

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor 18-30 Club!”
Reviews.Author: MarbellaGordon
Reviews.Content: My wife and I along with my in-laws have just returned from a weeks "Hell" in the Habtoor Grand, Dubai. We like to have a good time on holiday but when you are expecting a refined stay in a 5 star resort and spar with great food and service and you have to put up with what we have just experienced, which we could have done in Benidorm or Ibiza then something has to be said. We booked to have a stress free holiday, but left this hotel feeling exhausted and sleep deprived! Booked half board but we were disgusted to find on arrival that we were only allowed a buffet breakfast and buffet dinner in the same overcrowded, dirty restaurant. At no time were we informed of that before we arrived. Seated at dirty used tables, having to beg for spoons and forks, and glasses for juice. We did manage four side plates one morning......we were amazed! The food was cold and lacked variety, not what was expected or paid for. It took four days for the staff to ask if we would like a drink with dinner, and that was because we had spoken to the manager before hand. That was just the food....now to sleep, or lack of. There are at least two OUTDOOR nightclubs that are raving away until 3.30 am at least five nights a week, hence the 18/30 notation. Again none of this was mentioned when taking the money which is not a small amount. I find it unfair and immoral to allow people to book in good faith for what they are hoping to be a holiday to remember. We will certainly never forget this one! Oh i nearly forgot to mention the air strip on the beach that had two small aircraft taking off and landing every twenty minutes or so with a full passenger load of skydivers. Staff look after the local ex-pat crowd that use the night clubs but seem to just take hotel guests for granted. If they want the 18/30 club holiday makers then thats fine PROVIDED that this is advertised and guests wishing for a quieter holiday can book elsewhere........THIS IS NOT A FIVE STAR RESORT AND SPAR!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel for the lowest tier of tourists”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Snova
Reviews.Content: We've organised a business meeting in this hotel - what a mistake! They cater to the lowest level of tourism - people who can only afford the last-minute, heavy discounted tour and expect to pay for nothing extra while on premises. Accordingly, the service is dreadful (long wait at check-in, very slow process, you are suppose to prepay for everything - not just leave a credit card slip, but actually prepay). Breakfast buffet has a great variety but very low food quality and service (no one around to timely clean the tables, bring out dishes and cutlery, serve coffee, etc). We ordered immigration and limo service, but no one was at the airport to meet us, and once I cleared immigration and found the welcome kiosk from the hotel at the arrivals hall, they asked me to wait as they were trying to sell the hotel package to a walk-in client, temptng him to agree and get a "free" limo ride by joining me in the limo pre-paid by me!!! Staff responds to all complaints by brushing them off and showing zero desire to improve. Don't stay in this hotel unless absolutely desperate!

Reviews.Title: “Just ask to be moved...”
Reviews.Author: CityMel
Reviews.Content: A lot of people on here have written a bad review for this hotel based on the noise. These are very valid complaints, however, we were in a room that was terribly loud and we rang the front desk who assured us they would move us first thing in the morning. Even offered to move us straight away if we so desired. We were then moved to a wonderful, quiet suite with fantastic views. It's important to remember that this is a business that is carefully trying to balance between accommodation and entertainment. As long as you make your concerns known, in my experience they do everything to rectify any problems. The conceirge was extremly helpful and booked all our tours and restaurant visits for us. We were very comfortable and had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Do not go here for a relaxing break over Christmas and New Year!”
Reviews.Author: Caroline W
Reviews.Content: My mother and I arrived on Christmas Eve at 9AM. The receptionist was very helpful and told us we could have breakfast on this day instead of our last day. We later got billed DHR200 for our 'extra' breakfast, despite not having breakfast on boxing day due to an unfortunate Hot Air Balloon ride! The food in the hotel was delicious. We tried most restaurants. The drinks, especial alcohol, were quite pricey, but we had been for-warned of this before arriving. The food was also quite expensive, but we figured, you get what you pay for and everything was delicious. Our first two nights sleep were some of the best I have ever had and thought this could truly be a relaxing holiday (-working in a behaviour unit term-time, means I value my time-off more than most!). On our 4th night some unpleasant, ignorant English speaking people moved into the room next to us and opposite us. From then on our holiday was horrific. I was woken at 3AM every morning from their return of clubbing. I spoke to the desk in the lobby and was told these matters would be investigated, but if this happened again to telephone immediately. Not only was the noise on their return at 3AM, but it often led to some sort of domestic-violence, shouting, swearing, thumping walls and doors for around 1-2 hours. They then started smoking in the corridors, which came in through our ventilation system. I know the hotel is not responsible for the noise made by guests, but we felt they did nothing to rectify it. I telephoned repeatedly to no avail. On my 3rd phone call, one morning, I was accused of lying by the receptionist. For the price we paid for the room and the amount of money we spent each day around the hotel (average price per meal £35pp), I was extremely dissatisfied with the service to a nuisance problem like this. We were relieved to depart on the 30th December as by then the beach music, and we and paid extra for a sea-view room (what a mistake!) was playing to 3AM. It was a very disappointing end to a trip, which should have been so lovely and relaxing. I came home and have suffered with exhaustion and tonsillitis so have had to take time off work.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasenatly surprised...”
Reviews.Author: ImranLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this last minute and was pleasantly surprised with the quality of this hotel. I have stayed at the jumeirah beach hotel, the one and only royal mirage, as well as al qasr and the fairmont - all in dubai. This hotel in terms of 'room quality' was up there, and in some cases better than the aforementioned hotels. The breakfast was excellent, and genrally it was a good quality 5 star hotel The pools are no where near the standards or size compared the the one and only or the jumeirah beach hotel, but it does the job. If you get a good deal on this hotel, then its worth paying for.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here !!!”
Reviews.Author: ismailm08
Reviews.Content: My wife and i booked in at the Habtoor Grand for about 4 nights during the Christmas and New Year period (2011/2012). We have both been to Dubai many times before and have stayed at many of the hotels. Despite the bad reviews, i thought i would try this hotel out for its location and ameneties. The hotel is full of Russian people so i felt a little out of place, but that was no problem. There are a lot of people just loitering around the hotel and you are not sure whether they stay there or are just visiting.Here is what i found... Good : The hotel has a fantastic private beach area which is huge, the location is fantastic as it is 2 mins away from JBR walk and 10 mins away from the metro, the massage at the Elixir spa was great. Bad: The music at the hotel plays till 3:00 am at least 4 times a week, the aircon makes a loud enough noise to stop you from having a peaceful sleep, the towels are old and not soft at all, the bathrooms do leak water, the restaurants are extremely expensive, the staff are very arrogant and not helpful at all, the hotel is very old looking and needs lots of attention. This hotel is not cheap, it is definitely not 5 star, and despite all the bad comments and reviews this hotel has on tripadvisor, the hotel management seem to ignore everything and take no action whatsoever. If you are young and interested in having a good time partying, you may enjoy this hotel for its party like feel. If you are a couple or have family and are interested in a good holiday at a resort, this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere near 5-star...Way too much noise”
Reviews.Author: Bas449
Reviews.Content: Hotel booked in the last week of december. I am used to a number of 5 star hotels (especially one from the Small Leading Hotels of the World group), and this one doesn't come close. The main issue is a beachclub on the premises of the hotel which plays extermely loud music every day from 12:00 PM till 03:00 AM. I am guessing that the only rooms that will not be torubled by this are the rooms facing inland in the towers. The staff is clearly aware of this, judging their reaction when we complained (after three days of trying to ignore it and even getting ear plugs). The sigh of "another one of our customers having a problem" was very clear. We got another room which was a bit better, but still didn't help. To me this is not a 5-star experience, but more a 3-start Costa Brava in Spain experience. If you are in for an everyday pary night...then it is not a problem Apart from that, check-out was extremely slow...took almost fifteen minutes at 6 AM in the morning, even while we paid for the bill the evening before. And reception was usually very busy, with waiting times of up to 10 minutes, again not 5-star like. The pool was also too small for the number of people in the hotel. "Experience the Essence of Arabian Hospitality" is the slogan for Habtoor...well I hope that normal Arabian hospitality is by far better than this...

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 5 star - rude staff - unbelievable noise. Avoid (or buy earplugs)”
Reviews.Author: Dutton81
Reviews.Content: It's not often I feel compelled to write reviews, but my recent stay at the Habtoor Grand Resort and Spa has really prompted me to start. We arrived on 28th Dec to a chaotic reception, crammed with an oversized Gingerbread House, around 35 flashing Christmas trees and a plethora of loud Russian guests. Check in was a laboured affair, where organising 3 rooms took approx 30mins. 2 of our party (myself and boyfriend) were placed relatively quickly and driven down to our room on a golf cart. The other rooms were not yet ready, bearing in mind this was a 4.30pm check in after a late check out from Abu Dhabi. The other members of our group waited more than half an hour for their rooms to be readied. Our room; firstly, I can't fault our porter. He was polite and attentive, explaining everything we needed to know in detail. My only observation was he was perhaps too keen, but I'd rather they be this way than rude and uninterested. The hotel claims to be 5 star but sadly falls short on many counts. Our room was dirty; the patio windows were dirty/smudged, the net curtain stained, our welcome book had dirty marks all over the front, the room was dingy and smelly, the balcony had bird feces on from the hotel’s many roaming peacocks, the bathroom stains on the floor. I wasn't overwhelmed. On our first night we ate at the Italian restaurant. The food was of decent standard and good portion size. We were entertained by a singing Duo who had a poolside stage. Little did we realise this entertain, which was quite literally looking over our room's balcony, would be going on for some time at considerable volume. We enquired with reception and they curtly told us it would end at 11.30. However, the poolside duo was nothing compared to the noise emanating from Club XL on the beach till 3am DAILY. The baseline from the club was awful; I've stayed next door to Es Paradis in Ibiza, and this wiped the floor with that! I was exhausted and so did fall asleep once, but awoke later to further bass. Additionally, on Tue and Thu, the open-air (between the two towers) Horizons bar has ladies night and has banging music till 3am, so you get a double whammy on these days. I am deadly serious when I say PACK EARPLUGS, or walk out of the hotel towards Le Meridien and there’s a pharmacy you can buy amazing earplugs in – this is the only way to get close to a restful nights sleep. On our first morning we tackled the buffet. I say tackle because you have to fight for your life amongst the rabble of Russian guests who quite literally stockpile their food, bringing carrier bags to fill with pastries. I’ve never seen anything like it: one morning we even queued for 15 mins to get a table. Lunch was more civilized and a very good quality. Although not well known, the hotel's beach is quite literally next to a runway where ‘Skydive Dubai’ sends up 2 small aircraft with parachutists in. You might not have gotten any rest the night before from the banging nightclub, and you certainly wont get much on the beach what with the take off and landings, combined with the stench of aviation fuel. You couldn’t get a space by the pool – too many guests and not enough loungers. On New Years Eve various areas of the hotel had been sectioned off as they had private parties happening – it made you feel very limited in where you could go as though us as paying guests weren’t of importance, and the external people were again getting preferential treatment. This is how the nightclub made us feel – they didn’t care we had paid a lot of money to stay for 5 days, and instead preferred to cater to the bar and club scene. On our last day our room key stopped working at 11am, even though checkout was at 12noon. So, after being on the beach and desperate for the loo, we then had to run all the way up to reception to get the room key reset for an hour so we could shower and check out. When we did finally checkout we got a snotty Russian lady on reception who called housekeeping to check our room and minibar, and another wait ensued. Why they don’t just take a card at the start of your stay, or ask you if you had anything from the minibar… maybe this is a reflection of how much they trust and respect their customers. All in all I would strongly recommend you not to book this hotel. It is a loud, dirty hotel, which doesn’t value your stay. The staff are generally friendly, but totally overworked and under supported. If it didn’t purport to be 5 star I could have forgiven its many shortcomings. The noise, however, is completely unforgivable. Sadly we came here directly after a stay at the Yas Viceroy in Abu Dhabi and the difference was night and day. Honestly, don’t waste your money, find another hotel – we will never go back here.

Reviews.Title: “dubai prices!!”
Reviews.Author: philipsmith
Reviews.Content: The 5* hotel ,although having 5* facilities, failed to meet my expectations. I understand that the Habtoor is one of thr first hotels to be built in Dubai and now needs a bit of attention, particularly in the bedrooms. On arrival we were sent to a room outwith the hotel (as advised beforehand to be fair) which should have been made up for 3 people but was set up for only 2. The situation was remedied but not to my satisfaction, (which I commented upon on leaving) The plus side is that we were upgraded to receive dinner on both nights which was a considerable saving given that a steak was £75.00 and a pint of beer £12.00. The beach front was marvellous and the swimming very pleasant in warm water. the gym was fantastic and we nearly took a parachute jump at the airfield ajoining the beach. good sense prevailed however!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: waqasgondal
Reviews.Content: Its a great hotel on the beach. Very clean rooms and atmosphere is great. Staff is fine also . I got a room with pool view and that was great.

Reviews.Title: “The discos until 3am destroy the experience!”
Reviews.Author: Steven D
Reviews.Content: It's so simple - have a resort with great food, staff, faciities, pool and fitness and you have repeat customers. The owners of this establishment perfer to have one time visitors as they spit in their face with two discos that keep all guests awake until 3am. Paid for a $500 per night suite? We don't care, we're going to play dance music as loud as possible to ensure that it penetrates the thickest glass we have to keep you up until after 3am. THIS IS NO JOKE. I AM HERE RIGHT NOW ON A THURSDAY AND MY WIFE IS PISSED OFF. This is normal at this place, so please book somewhere else to avoid a divorce.

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craig F
Reviews.Content: We were concerned with this hotel with the amount of negitive feed back seen on Trip Advisor and i have to say that there are so many sad people out there who expect the world when you visit a 5 star hotel. From the moment we arrived at the Habtoor Grand it was effortless, we had a night flight and arrived early morning and fairly tired but ready for our 1 week stay. we did not expect our room to be ready until the afternoon but they gave us refreshments and we sat in the foyer and said our room will be availible in 30 mins. Again we seen on trip advisor that some people were concerned that they asked to put 2000 Dhs on a credit card for your stay, which i have to say is normal and actually a great utility to have at hand. Now the noise issue, we was aware of this before we arrived , I have 2 young children under the age of 11 and we had a family tower room on the 15th floor inside over looking the Horizon Bar. Now this was our only negitive part of this hotel and holiday, Yes the music did play until 3am in the morining which was very annoying. However i know the hotel did move some people that night as we spoke to some other guests here who were not happy with the noise either and they demanded to be moved which the hotel managment kindly did. For the rest of the week there was no noise coming from the bar below after midnight which we could live with as we were not going to bed until then anyway. The hotel does need to think about thier policy with this as most of the family tower rooms are on the inside overlooking the bar below. Also to clarify there is a night club on site which is a magnet for the younger generation but this nightclub is on the beach which is quite a didstance from the main part of the hotel and we did not here any noise coming from the area. The service from the staff was over and above from what i was expecting, we do not get this level of service and respect in the UK. If you are seen carrying a bag they will take it from you and ask you where would you like it to be taken. If you wanted a taxi they would get one fro you straight away, The pool bar waiters were very polite and at hand when ever required for your drinks or food. This plus point out weighed the negitive from the noise coming from the Horizon Bar. The swimming pool is great for all ages, the kids loved the slides and it was very clean and tidy. The Private beach was great also, we had a fantastic view of the sky diving which is at the end of the beach. Some Tips, If you are on a budget, Try the resturants around the corner on the "The Walk" there are plenty of places to eat but will not serve alchohol which are cheaper than the hotel resturants. Alcohol is very exspensive at the hotel, do not drink bottled beer, drink draught beer which is only Hineiken which is cheaper than bottled beer. We found It was quite chilly at night during the month of December so take something to keep warm. There are quite a few Russains who stay here who treat the staff like slaves so ignore them, but there are alot of Russains in Dubai so where ever you stay you will see them Overall this hotel was excellent and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A stopover”
Reviews.Author: ayrbrain
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights enroute to Australia. We had a ground floor room overlooking the pool which was very very noisy at night and until 3am!!!! Due to the music from the nearby night club. You really need the porters to move your luggage to and from reception to your room as it is quit a distance, we did have the buggy drive us to our room. Rooms clean, staff helpful although they did to try to charge us for breakfast when we checked out despite the fact we had paid for half board. So check your bill carefully on checkout.

Reviews.Title: “Hassle at the Habtoor Grand”
Reviews.Author: chaffers
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a family for two nights on our way home from a 2 week holiday in kerala, India and I am being 100% honest in saying all the places we stayed in India were better on every level than the Habtoor. I had read the reviews about this hotel before I booked and the main concern we had was the negative comments regarding the noise from the night clubs. I emailed the 'director of rooms' 6 weeks in advance of our stay requesting to be allocated a family room " as high as possible" in the tower to avoid being disturbed by the music.On check in there was no record of this request but I had printed the email ( and response ) I had received so showed it to the check in staff. Thankfully they had a room on the 23rd floor ( there are only 25 floors ) so we were feeling pretty smug. Only problem was housekeeping were still cleaning so " take a seat madam it will be 15 to 20 minutes ". 45 minutes later we had been forgotten about so my husband went to the desk to be told it was ready so we were shown to our room but the luggage was not in the room - another 30 minutes was wasted waiting for our swim wear so we could get to the pool. Pool was lovely , plenty of free sunbeds and very clean. Once we returned to our room from the pool I checked on my daughter who was showering only to find the drain was blocked and water had flooded the bathroom. After 2 calls to reception who said they would get an engineer to our room but didn't, I asked to speak to the duty manager. As promised he phoned me back promptly but offered no apology , only another shower that we could use in a different room !!!!! No surprise that we declined and said this was not appropriate and not what we had paid for. He said he would get on to housekeeping and then phoned back 10 minutes later to see if they had arrived - they hadn't Eventually the engineers came and cleared the blockage but failed to clear up the flood so my husband took on the role of chamber maid himself. Obviously we did not want to spoil our holiday in Dubai with this nuisance and we did like our room - having said that , even the 23rd floor was horrendously noisy - the only saving grace was the fact my husband said " the music was good" We also had to ask the manager to provide towels , mugs etc to our room for 4 people and not two. The hotel was predominately full of Russians who went to dinner en masse making it a pretty unpleasant experience as they barged their way around the buffet restaurant giving it a ' cattle market ' feel. . Buffet was not great either and defintately not 5*. Communication was severely lacking at the Habtoor - it seemed once they get your money the service and customer care is pretty non existant and do not expect ANYTHING to be done with any urgency. Eventually we persuaded the manager to give us some free drinks for all the upheavel we endured which did little to compensate for the time we wasted waiting for our luggage and flood to be sorted. Drinks by the way are ridiculously expensive £4 for a small glass of soft drink and approx £6 for a pint of draught Heineken. Hence the fact that we saw barely no other guests drinking at the restaurant or around the pool. So ............... I would go to India next time where the people are so hospitable and actually care if you enjoy your stay !!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Mix reviews!”
Reviews.Author: bintheredondat
Reviews.Content: The hotels has a resort area and the towers. Rooms in the towers are much better. Recently the hotel opened two night clubs which happen to be very popular spots in Dubai and depending on where your room is the noise could be disturbing. The swimming pool is very nice and the beach area is huge and very clean. Its a shame that there is a skydiving place right next to the beach and you have a small airplane landing and taking off very frequently. The breakfast buffet used to be unbleivable but now its just good. Service in some area are better than the others but everyone is very friendly.I got to know the manager Farid and I can tell you he is the coolest hotel manager I have every met. So I totally understand the mix reviews on this place as your experience could be totally different than others.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it!”
Reviews.Author: s m
Reviews.Content: So this was supposed to be a 5-star resort, but I have no idea where it got such a rating. It certainly didn't deserve it. Service: friendly, but very inefficient and slow. Several calls were often required. Noise: the bar had pounding music till at least 3am, so very little sleep was had. Room: very far from the reception in a place that one must walk about 400m to, or get a cart, but it takes a good 15 minutes for the cart to arrive. Not convenient at all. There was an infestation of flies in the room. The water went from the tub up through the plumbing and out onto the bathroom flood. The toiletries were very cheap and the mouthwash had a very soapy taste. Strange. No real coffee, just Nescafe. In a 5-star hotel I'd expect much better. The resort has all kinds of junk lying around- racks, tarps, building and cleaning equipment all in plain view. Really not attractive. All I can say is I'm glad it was a business trip in which I wasn't footing the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor Grand Dubai - better NOT to select for the rest”
Reviews.Author: Eduard K
Reviews.Content: I stay in hotel for 6 nights from 27/11 till 3/12/11 so had enough time to have my own proper opinion about this hotel. “+”: - Simply EXELENT meal with wide assortment - Very friendly front desk (administrator Rubi and Aarej from front desk) - Big and nice swimming pool - Nice green area with 14 restaurants - Nice and well organised service on beach - Super fitness centre “-“ - Toooo noisy over the night till 2 a.m. - Not really good service during dinner time and too much people at the same place - Tennis corts were not available - Beach place too far away from th water, sea is not deep at all + you HAVE TO smell trace from located near by FLY clab - Balance price – service on low level

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: Finnishtraveller_9
Reviews.Content: Positive: kind and good service at front desk, nice location, nice swimming pool for children, good restaurants. Negative: Noise! We stayed at floor 16 and during "womens evening" on tuesday and thursday the noise from discotheque is something unbeliveable. Cant understand why hotel chooses to serve its clients like this? We were moved to other side of hotel and got a smoking room (terrible cigarr smell), very nice with two children. The breakfast room is noisy and too crowded, and people from our eastern neighbour dont always behave very politely.. Overall status of hotel is pretty outdated. Extra comment: as a tennis fan I would have liked to play at least one hour during the week. But, there was a tournament wich ment that all courts were booked whole week (even if they were empty from time to time). A true five star hotel would have arranged a court for its client, if nothing else from a court from somewhere else. But habtoor grand, no way! Compared to other very nice hotels in dubai eg Westin, this hotel just doesnt live up to the standards.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful place - don't stay here if you value your beauty sleep!”
Reviews.Author: mobilelisa
Reviews.Content: I travel at least 5 times a year to Dubai with work and occasionally on holiday and stay in a variety of 5* hotels but have never had such a bad experience. I came away feeling stressed, sleep deprived and generally quite annoyed at my treatment at the Habtoor Grand. Stayed here a few years ago in a resort room and actually quite enjoyed the trip, but this trip was just terrible. I checked into the hotel and even booked / paid for an extra night's accomodation to avoid the usual Dubai hotel arguments about rooms not being ready when arriving on the early morning flights from UK. The greeting at reception was lukewarm at best. The resort rooms, pool area etc are also looking quite shabby now too. However, my main issue is the noise and even worse the hotel's response to my complaint (and trust me, I am not a born "complainer")! My room was adjacent to the staircase and opposite the accounts office. The cleaning staff seemed to also "park" their vacuum cleaner outside my bedroom door on most days. The room was very dark as the "view" from the bedroom was the wall of the hotel, overlooking the cobbled "service route", used by staff for wheeling porters trollies around. I politely put up with all these disturbances until the Thursday night of my stay, when at 11pm the music started up at the Ladies Night party opposite my bedroom window... I love music and work in the industry, but REALLY... I don't stay in a hotel room in an evening to listen to the booming music vibrating through my bedroom when trying to sleep.. if I wanted that, I would get up and go out. So I called to enquire to guest relations about when the music would finish, and was told 2am.. I couldn't face 3 hours of it and had to be up early the next day so I politely asked them what they could do to assist. The reply... wait for it... "what do you want me to do about it.. everyone's always complaining"!!!!!!!!! After asking to speak to the manager at this stage, and asking why they were making me feel bad for wanting a night's sleep, I was told they would see if someone could call me back... 30 minutes later no-one did, so I got dressed and went to reception and I was reluctantly moved without even so much as an apology. I am not some old fuddy duddy, nor am I prone to complaining, but the icing on the cake was the response "what do you want ME to do about it" was so unbelievably rude, that I felt compelled to write this review. Not even a small apology at any stage. That's terrible customer service and the hotel management needs to address the noise and service issues. If you know you have a problem, then deal with it.. don't leave your front of house staff in the firing line.

Reviews.Title: “breathtaking views and very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: viewhaloo
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel right on Jumeriah Beach in Dubai. It has all the amenities one would expect from a hotel of this caliber. The pool bar is a great place to relax. Drinks can be pricey but that pretty much sums up Dubai in general. There is a fantastic Lebanese restuarant on the property that has live belly dancing and very tasty dinners and deserts. The beach is right at your doorstep and the property has other amenities as well (tennis, spas). It also has an infinity pool on the 3rd? level. A very nice hotel if you are looking for somehting on the beach, close to the Marina and train for around 400 USD.

Reviews.Title: “very nice in november”
Reviews.Author: renard1
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated practically on the jumeira beach and is an excellent location for those who like to walk as the beach is very long. The hotel's own part of the beach is very limitted and the sunbeds are located very far from the water, probably because jumeira beach is a public beach. You can walk along the beach and swim and sunbase on different parts of it, closer to other hotels as well. The food at the hotel is very good and there are a number of restaurants to choose. The club floor was very quiet but we had to request to talk to a manager in order to get a higher floor.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing for a five star hotel which is extremely over-rated.”
Reviews.Author: LancashireMaxwell
Reviews.Content: Luckily we were upgraded to a suite which made our five day stay more palatable. Breakfast was noisy, extremely busy in the dining room and definitely not a good start to the day. The staff were polite, helpful and appeared overworked. They were certainly an asset.

Reviews.Title: “had no sleep even after moving to 21st floor tooo noisy”
Reviews.Author: rlg5358
Reviews.Content: we booked habtoor as have stayed before and enjoyed it. went for more expensive rooom this time (club room). as daughters wedding was in dubai at madinat and she lives right oposite. we were given a room right above horizon night club, my daughter told us to move rooms as thursday night especially (night before wedding) would be horrendously noisy and we were ove main entrance too. they charged us 120 pounds to move to 21st floor after assuring us club finished by 12.30. but then we found out new club opened on beach went on till well after 4am. my husband had no sleep. other than noise lovely hotel needs updating abit but service and staff very good., tey sould state this hotel is for young clubbers.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars and great value for money”
Reviews.Author: David B
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed the weekend here on business and its the forth time for me, the previous times were at least a week at a time. The bottom line for this hotel is Great service and great value for money! The staff are really attentive and nothing is too much trouble. They even catered for my son who is Gluten Free. It has a great bar called the underground and features a dozen flat sreens with world sports, and you can get a good pint of beer for a reasonable price. I would always consider this hotel first before booking anything else in Dubai. Great beach, great pool & Gym and great location.

Reviews.Title: “Bad quality and service”
Reviews.Author: Khonya
Reviews.Content: Was in this hotel in November 2011 with family (2adults + 2 kids) Based on reviews of other travellers to Habtoor Grand after arrival I've asked room far from night club which is located on 3rd floor. Actually first intention of receiption guy was to charge us extra 200$ per night for upgrade to suite from family room, but after my refusal to pay he just got same suite without extra payment and I have feeling that family room was simply unavailable despite that we arrived midnight. Regarding room - the shower leaked and nobody take care of it. Even if we put big towel to floor nobody from cleaning guy take care of that leaks. Only 1 (ONE) time they put special bath carpet to floor, but it was disappear next day )) The room was not cleaned properly and there was no turn down service at night , a service which is offered by all other five star hotels Breakfast - it is complete disaster. Lack of plates, crowdy from people and long waiting time until get the table. Range of food for breakfast was limited and some time even bad quality In order to get coffee or tea you have to wait long long time. Be aware that for unknown reasons to me at the evening it is big traffic jam to JBR and we were forced to leave taxi just after the bridge and walk through to hotel

Reviews.Title: “could be better”
Reviews.Author: crocusaz
Reviews.Content: it was my second time at this hotel and I booked it just because of private beach and kids facilities. The thing is that all other options were too expensive. Otherwise I would prefer to go to other place. Hotel is old. Rooms need to be renovated. However, service is fine. I would say that it is overpriced also... there are certain kids activities which is great, pool is ok, food is good. DO not miss grill restaurant. Fantastic meat.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with really good service -> good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Sandra9856
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at Habtoor grand for 6 nights. We booked a sea view room in the tower. The room was immediatly available after arrival. The sea view was amazing from the 19th floor. The room was in really good condition - very clean and we loved the big, comfortable bed and the bathroom with it’s huge shower. The pool area was also very nice and at the beautiful beach were plenty of sunbeds available for free. The staff were lovely and attentive and made us feel really comfortable during our entire stay. Our favorite spots were the Hoirzon pool on the 3rd floor and the beach club next to the beach - very cool locations. We only booked breakfast in advance but had finally dining every evening in the Habtoor due to the big choice of restaurants with really excellent food and good service. We were really impressed with the hotel and will definitly come back. Sandra

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ned87
Reviews.Content: The first time i stayed in this hotel was in August 2009, i stayed in the towers which were beautiful. not alot of choice fr breakfast. at the time nozomi was under construction and the the bar on the third floor was closed due to the summer season. however this was a good stay, and lovely private beach. second time is stayed her was in May 2010 but stayed in the resort room facing the pool, this was not nice at all, i felt i was being treated not the same because i have a cheape room. If i am in Dubai next i would stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Much better this time round”
Reviews.Author: Paulacul
Reviews.Content: We visited the hotel in October 2011. We were upgraded to a suite and paid for half board. It was well worth it. The food is fabulous. The one bedroomed suite was lovely with views of both the marina and the Jumeriah Beach. Only down sides were - breakfast is very hectic. Too many people and not enough staff. I found the choice fair but not as good as the Hilton in Portugal where we stayed in May 2011. The pools were great. Our children thoroughly enjoyed the slides. Fantastic beach. Loved the camels. Some of the staff are wonderful but one or two can be a little rude. Other than that, great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel at all costs.”
Reviews.Author: 401simon
Reviews.Content: Date of stay Nov 3 - 6 2011 I arrived at the hotel and the circus began. This hotel has loud music and loud customers crammed into every corner. Aside from the screaming and shouting there were literally people falling down drunk in the corridors. I checked in and was given a 'resort room'. This was in what must have been the older part of the hotel. The rooms have recently redecorated so at leas that was something...however the pumping club music could be heard as if being played inside the room. A call to reception provided the key to another room down the hall that also had the same loud music issue. This time a trip to reception provided a third room also in the resort area right next to one of the night clubs. The previous occupant of this room had also been smoking cheap cigars in there. This room was also rejected. Another vist to reception and some discussions with a shift manager Johan led to another set of viewing rooms, this time dispersed through the two towers. All of the rooms faced the other night club but the sound proofing was slightly better. During the walk around from room to room Johan was trying to explain that Dubai was a party place and that this is what we should expect, additionally he was trying to convince us that 'resort' meant that loud music 24x7 !! For those of us lucky enough to travel a lot this is clearly rubbish. Having finally selected a room we settled down to wait for the music from the clubs to finish at 02:30, only to be confronted by the noise of all the AC units on the roof and the rooms below rummbling through the night. Other points to note: Shower leaks all over the bathroom floor as does the sink. Lights in the room switched themselves on in the middle of the night for no apparent reason. The hotel grounds are not very clean and smell like old booze and stale cat litter. The rubbish pumping Euro Pop club music does not stop even during the day by the pool. The pool side toilet facilities are unclean. There is no cold runnng water in the bathroom in the bedroom. The hot water is scalding hot and the 'cold' water is only a few degrees off boiling point. Lets be real, if you are looking for a crappy old resort with a Benidorm type feel this is the 3* place for you. If you are looking for a 5* luxury Dubai experience you WILL NOT find that here.. Avoid, avoid, avoid.

Reviews.Title: “OK not brilliant”
Reviews.Author: neezy10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for three nights after having spent two nights at another hotel, and would say that 5 star its not. Large hotel, very busy but looking a bit tired. Our (family room) was adequate and spacious and clean. Housekeeping good, we were missing a bed in the room and this was sorted out immediately with lots of towels and spare bedding. This is very much a hotel for families with the pools and kids club, not recommended if you are a couple. Bit of a walk to the beach but there is a buggy. We were not bothered by any noise from the night life but i think that was more about where our room was. Good position for the Beach Walk area, about a five minute walk. Food adequate, would be a bit uninspiring if you had to eat the dinners for more than a few days but breakfast acceptable, dining room very busy, if everyone decided to eat at the same time it would be chaos. We had no complaints about dishes being cleared away or the staff during our stay. This hotel is very heavily promoted to the Russian tour industry, it has its own in house translators and tour bookers, and consequently a large number of the residents are Russian..you may want to take this on board if deciding on this hotel! A note of caution..we asked for a taxi to take us to the airport and unbeknown to us they put us in a hotel car who then tried to charge us double what we would normally pay..naughty. On the whole OK but nothing special for Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY TERRIBLE! SHOULD HAVE ITS 5 STAR RATING REMOVED”
Reviews.Author: cassie320
Reviews.Content: We are regular visitors to Jumeriah Beach and wanted to try a hotel nearer 'the Walk'. This is the ONLY GOOD POINT of this hotel. We have just returned from a 4 night break to the Habtoor - 2 adults and 2 kids in a family room and 2 grandparents in a garden room. Rooms 401 and 121 for the room manager who will no doubtedly return his standard comment on this review but not actually do anything about it! On booking I realised I had made a serious mistake and emailed the hotel to ask if we could have 'quiet rooms' away from the loud music that everyone refers to. They put us on the 4th floor (above the entrance to the Horizon Bar which opens until 2.00am) and my parents in room 121 (next door to the outdoor disco called XL Beach club which opens until 3.00am). Complete disregard to my emailed request. On arrival in the early hours, despite requesting two rollaway beds in the family room on booking there was only one. After the third request (and someone trying to sell us an upgrade!), eventually a housekeeper who seemed to be ill informed of our request turned up with some sheets and advised that we could use the sofa bed shoved in the corner of the room. This is supposed to be five star and certanly not what we have paid for! On checkin we were given no details about the hotel, facilities or how to find them etc. We made our way to breakfast the next morning and my small child wanted the toilet. On asking the waiter for directions he just shrugged his shoulders and said he didn't know. On the second day our bath mat for the bathroom disappeared leaving the bathroom dangerous for small children (shame they didnt take the shabby looking towels as well!). On the 2nd night my husband was trying to find some ice for the icebucket in our room. He eventually went into reception with the empty bucket and was told someone would bring some up to the room - to this day it never actually arrived. It also seems rather odd but our room was not made up until well after 3.00pm each day. Breakfast rooms are always busy in a morning however they ran out of plates and the fruit juice glasses were always warm? I dont even want to begin on removing used plates from the tables in a timely manner. There seems to be no staff training whatsoever. Horrendous loud music problems on EVERY NIGHT except Mondays and Wednesdays until sometimes 3.00am. Guest relations just shrugged their shoulders once again! It seems to me that this hotel needs a massive refurbishment to bring it anywhere near Dubai usual 5 star service. The loud music is aimed at 'locals' rather than guests and on these nights there is no care or attention to the paying guests. We even had to stop our taxi on the main road and walk with our small children as we couldnt get anywhere near the hotel due to the large numbers of taxi's dropping off the locals to their entertainment venue. No where is this mentioned in their holiday literature or website! The music is so loud (ex clubber in my time) that it would be heard anywhere in the hotel and therefore no changing of rooms would have made any difference. I would advise anyone who has booked to try and change their booking as this hotel should not be able to operate in its current format. I am extremely annoyed that guests are lured under false pretences. It was probably a very nice hotel at somepoint in time. The staff/management seem powerless to make any changes. When we checked out - one lady at the reception commented that we were lucky we had only stayed 4 nights (she had been there all week!). Please do not waste your money on this hotel you will be very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Major dissapointment part II”
Reviews.Author: Jx2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is expensive for NOTHING to start with... We booked a non-smoking room (somebody -duty manager?) - confirmed before arrival ! and we received a smelly and unpleasant smoking room, so nice! :-( . When we requested for a change , we were told that the hotel was fully book ... Surprise!!! and Of Course after seeing a very FURIOUS face complaining -and that would definitely would not accept this -; the very -unwilling to help- staff found one! The rooms have something special ? not really .... our DVD didnt work , there was also a damaged scale that no one ever came to check. The balconies look very unsafe and with poor maintenance. We could observe the metal base from the balcony on 22nd floor was not aligned properly. Maybe the glass was not supported properly? ... This is scary ... The water in the toilet is hot or hotter ... cold water doesnt exist. The noise level at night was HIGH! from the music down stairs ... we were on the 21st floor! The Grill restaurant was a relief, food was very nice and staff provided with a good service. During check out the place looked more like a market, people queuing and lots of people waiting ... they made us wait with this explanation: 'we need to send someone to the room first , it will only take 5 minutes, we need to check that nothing is broken in the room first and check that nothing is missing in the minibar ' You know standard... (do you say this to your guests? ... Shocking! are you kidding me? What kind of treatment is this? What kind of training this people had??? The replies from the staff were incredible ... they certainly dont know how to talk to a 5 star guest . they have no experience! We requested to talk to the manager , and the lady in the front desk pointed at him : If you want to talk to the duty manager he is there ... Front desk manager was busy dealing with some other complain (i could see for the faces ohhh i dont know what exactly happen ... they were upset too!) Im not surprised ! With all this issues and plus there is construction next to the building never understood why this place is so expensive.

Reviews.Title: “LOud music”
Reviews.Author: roseb59
Reviews.Content: WE too had little sleep on a tuesday night before an early checkout to catch our flight and we were on the 19th floor. Apart from this we enjoyed our stay here great breakfast staff fantastic room also great. Very relaxing by the pool during the day all in all i would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Not close to topping the list...for good reasons...”
Reviews.Author: Justin G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the habtoor in march 2011 and it was fairly disappointing. The main issue was the incredible noise from the disco until the early hours. I actually have to laugh when i recall our calls to reception in the early hours..."Really sir, is it too loud, i'll have somebody tell the DJ straight away sir...nobody has ever said that before sir...". And we were on the 23rd floor! Otherwise it is an ok hotel, quite arabic in decor, little dated, main pool was out of action, bars were expensive (£100 to sit at a table on friday minimum spend). Good points - club lounge was ok with nice staff. Room was nice and large too. Location was ok, on the nice beach but the marina area itself is pretty quiet, we headed back into town everytime we left the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not if you want to sleep at night”
Reviews.Author: KevinATaylor
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here with family and will never go back. The hotel has a very loud disco in the rear gardens that goes on until the early hours. Complaints about the noise in our room were taken politely, but they did absolutely nothing about it. With two small children and no intention of joining the party this quickly turned into a nightmare. It would seem the hotel is more interested in partying Dubai youngsters and not the people who have actually paid to stay there. You have been warned!

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay for a long weekend”
Reviews.Author: DORDubai
Reviews.Content: We celebrated one of our friends birthday this July there with a long weekend stay and we were all very happy with the service and with the rates. Check in took quite long due to the number of guest with promotional rate, however our stay was nice and comfortable. The beach is quite spacious and the pool area despite it's small size still does not feel congested. The range of cusines offered within the property is quite good as well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice vacation stay, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Dake07
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 8 nights, check-in was very quick, there were no garden rooms available and they had upgraded us for free to tower sea-view room, which was very nice. Although hotel seems to be pretty old now, and interior requires some renewal, this is still looks very nice.There are no wifi internet in the room and it cost about 30 dollars per 24hrs, so be ready to pay for this. Breakfast was very reach, variety of choices. We stayed on the half-board rate, so we could choose to have lunch or dinner at the hotel, very convinient if you do not want to go outside of the hotel when it's +40 at the street. Beach is very clean and safe, the only inconvinience of the beach is remotness of the beach lounges from the sea, you need to walk about 100 meters to the beach lounges after you walk out from the sea, so we had to put our towels on the sand, and stay on the shore without umbrella. Infinity pool is a life saver in the sunny afternoons, because the water is cool and you can enjoy the shade on the roof.Hotel's location near JBR the Walk, make it a good choice if you want to have a beach at the hotel and have your meal outside of the hotel, there are variety of restaurants on the Walk, so you could choose one for every night out. The only big minus of the hotel I can think of is russian speaking staff of the Elixir spa, which is located on the ground floor of the hotel, the russian speaking lady that was on the Spa reception, is very unhelpfull, not giving any information, and her style of customer communications leaves you to desire a better service. She pretened to not understand any russian and the moment we approached her, than she insisted that she would only tell us about the spa if we take a massage or somthing, it left some unpleasant momories. Overall the hotel is very good for family stay as well as for groups of young people, since they have bars and disco club on the territory. Will definetely recommend it for your vacation stay in Dubai, will also suit to those on the business trip to Media-Internet City or Knowledge village.

Reviews.Title: “Different”
Reviews.Author: dal d
Reviews.Content: Loved it! The beach was a dream, the food was different.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel although starting to look a bit tired in places”
Reviews.Author: ExpatscotAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel as part of a promotion which meant that the hotel was at its busiest. This meant the pool and breakfast were busy than perhaps they would be normally. Breakfast did have a very good selection though. We were given a smoking room after the hotel could not give us an early check-in therefore and as they were so busy we thought better not to ask for a change. The smell in the room was very overpowering. The room was very spacious though. The toiletries were varied but not of the quality of some other 5 star hotels. The carpets and bedding did look a little dated and in need of freshening up but this could have been the result of being in a smoking room. The pool was good and there was a little flume for kids. There is a bar called Horizon in the hotel which is very popular at the weekends so you can have a lot of people passing through the hotel who are not staying there although if you are high up in the hotel this should not affect you too much.

Reviews.Title: “A really excellent stay at Habtoor in a great hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Linzi2011
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in Habtoor Grand for 7 nights and were really impressed with both the hotel and the facilities. The staff were so lovely and attentive and made us feel really welcome. Loved the breakfast and High tea that was available to us through the club suite (worth paying that bit extra as you get so much for your money). Our room was spacious and spotless and had an excellent sea view from the 23rd floor. We arrived very early prior to check in (7am) and only had to wait 1 1/2 hours for our room to be available which was more than acceptable. Our favorite spot was the Hoirzon pool on the 3rd floor also Bartini and the Underground. Cheap taxis outside hotel too. An excellent stay would defo go back and recommend to others.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: SHAM5TA
Reviews.Content: amazing hotel, its a 5* and is the cheapest out of all the loacal ones around there in jumeirah beach. this building was constructed by the finest arab construction firm around (Habtoor), the building is amazing with a restaurant on the top floor giving you the finest views of the palm island and the burj al arab (7* star hotel). i highly recommend it, but just remember you need deep pockets.

Reviews.Title: “Great Holiday beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: louisa63
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Habtoor grand for 5 nights. On arrival we were upgraded to a sea view room in the tower block. The room was clean spacious and better than we expected.We were half board and ate in the buffet restaurant where the food was excellent and as I have a garlic intollerance I was helped no end by Lorrenzo and staff who cooked steak and fish without the sauces for me which made my holiday as no worrying about what I ate. The pool was good and beach beautiful with plenty of sunbeds and as Ramadan quieter than usual. Alot of the bars were closed due to Ramadan but this was no problem as plenty of places to go and see and the Underground bar was a good place to end the evening. Yes alchohol and drinks expensive but found with the heat the fruit juices excellent. Our stay in Dubai was more than we expected and the hotel excellent.We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: petermeyer
Reviews.Content: We needed a place to relax, have fun and still enjoy good service. Habtoor really had it all. Nice rooms, good food, friendly nd helpful staff, good mix of facilities and restaurants and a large beach. Horizon is a nice place to enjoy with the pool and Bar/Club with a good team who look after you. Gym is very good and everything you need. I would definitely come back and stay.

Reviews.Title: “NOT FOR FAMILIES”
Reviews.Author: fabfabgirl
Reviews.Content: Travelling with 3 teenage children, interconnecting rooms booked, not allocated, reception were not interested in even looking at my confirmation, no other rooms were available, went to the rooms they werent even next to each other and a overbearing smell of paint and varnish. Phoned reception, told them that this was unacceptable, they mumbled hotel' fully booked' so i asked to speak to the manager, but this was denied. A while after reception said that they had another 2 rooms available, I went to view them, again same problem, then they took us 2 a '1 bed suite' we had now been there 3 hours kids were tired so accepted the room and 2 single beds were placed in the living room. 4 of us sharing 1 bathroom not ideal. 2nd day our rep phoned me i explained what happended she spoke to guest relations and again suddenly 2 rooms with en suites were available. Moved into the rooms. I wrote to the hotel manager as i could not get past reception. Had a meeting with him, he was very sorry, gave us a late check out and we received fruit plates in our rooms. Rules changed on a daily basis, after swimming all day kids would go to 'pub' for a snack,(entry allowed up until7 for under 21s) 4th day kids received there food and were asked to leave because they arent allowed in there! Also kids were encouraged to go in there to pay to play playstation.Something they didnt think about before taking they money!Yet the next day there was a non british family sitting there eating! Manager unaware of rule changes but later confirmed 'yes' rules had changed. Duty manager was very nice but unable to resolve any issues. My daughter who is an accomplished pianist was told off for playing the piano because it was for 'decoration' yet a small child bashing the keys was fine.All the showers have a design problem, the glass does not reach the floor, so when you shower, the bathroom gets flooded. The idea that we in the UK have an endless supply of money is wrong, we work very hard an deserve a stress free holiday. Staff more concerned about people using the nightclub facility over hotel guests.Not a place for families because apart from watching tv in the evening there was nothing for the kids to do, and I wasn't allowed to sit outside in the pub garden with them so we would sit outside on the steps, or in the lobby just to socailise with other people. The Family pool was full of adults standing in the pool, and they would get upset when they would get splashed in the pool!They should have gone to the adults only pool. In comparision to families from other countries I truely believe that we received very poor service. This is a 'Want to be' 5 * hotel but is far from it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Rooms, Restaurants and Wonderful Beach”
Reviews.Author: PhantomTraveler79
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a suite, which had incredible views of the Palm and marina...the room was phenomenal. The gym in the hotel was fantastic and the multiple dining and drinking outlets made you not want to leave the hotel. We spent all our time there. The main pool is a bit smallish given the size of the resort, but there is also the Horizon pool to visit. Beach facilities were great. Only complain was with the spa experience, which both me and my wife found pitiful. During my massage, my therapist's phone rang, he typed out a text message in the middle of the treatment and another therapist tried to enter our room mid-treatment....Not very relaxing.....My wife experienced a terrible massage and found her therapist disinterested and not very competent. other than the spa, a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: gpidcock
Reviews.Content: As Dubai Resisdents we took advantage of the many deals during Ramadan offering great packages. Ours was with Go Nabbit and we had an overnight stay, lunch, breakfast and an hours massage each with a future voucher to use at the beach. The hotel was extreemly comfortable and the service was excellent. As we were celebrating our 10th Wedding Anniversary we were upgraded to a suite which was a lovely surprise. We had drinks on the rooftop bar and had dinner at the Grand Grill again high level of service and would highly recommend the steak. The only negative comment I would make is that the pool area is very busy with kids, great if your a family not so great if your not. There is an adults pool on the 3rd floor but this was packed when we checked. I would highly recommend this hotel for either 1 night or a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “An amazing and adorable hotel”
Reviews.Author: tipichita m
Reviews.Content: Hotel, pool, room, room service was exellent! The hotel is in a good area , near the beach ! There are all comforts, many restaurants, bars, tennis court, 3 swimming pools! I would like to go again there!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING - Cant wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: kiran_gill
Reviews.Content: Amazing country and hotel. the staff there cannot do enough for you. drinks on arrival, someone taking care of our luggage right away - room was upgraded instantly.. room was so beautiful and massive!mini bar is crazy expensive though! the august month is probably the wrong month to go if you want to drink and eat during the day because its Ramadan no food is served anywhere till 7ish.. which was fine. it was crazy hot like 40 degrees plus! I really miss it. got home today, they provide you with everything, you won't need anything but your clothes and shoes!! They will try and accommodate you in anyway possible. they do try and get you in to their Lexus taxis outside tho which start at like 30 dhs instead of the city taxis which start at your usual 3 dhs... city taxis are creamy with different coloured corners.. you can't miss them!... minimum fare is 10 dh. So much is close by... JBR walk is 5 minutes roundd the corner... Marina mall is like 5 mins int he taxi!.. lots of restaurants.. shisha lounge in side, called hush.. very popular with the Dubai's residents.. people pull up in their beautiful cars to go for shish here... make reservations anywhere and everywhere else you won't get a space... the pools are amazing too!!.. they already have a hair dryer in the room, towels, night gown, slippers, chocs on your pillow every night.. complimentary water tea coffee chocs.. fruit. amazing view and always fully air conditioned.. you can haver full access to the gym which is amazing.. there is a spa which is heaven!!! and 24 hours assistance... if you need anything. very safe and secure hotel.. êlite people stay there... who can think they are above you lol.. but hey a real mixture of people from all over the world! btw i had a beautiful sleep in this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor Grand, No problem!”
Reviews.Author: alunandsue
Reviews.Content: I booked 12 nights at the habtoor back in may, and thought i had made a massive mistake when i read all the terrible reviews on here. We got back on saturday 13th august, and it has to be said, had an absolutely fantastic time. The hotel was spotless, as was the pool and beach areas. We were in the tower A on the 18th floor, and the room was well equipped with a huge 5 foot bed. It was our 25th anniversary, and 2 cards were signed by all the staff, and a bottle of wine, a bowl of fresh fruit and a selection of cheeses were left for us, which we thought was a nice touch. The hotel has some excellent restaraunts, we ate at the Steak House which was supurb, but if i have 1 complaint it must be the absolutely ridiculous prices of the food and drink throughout the hotel. 3 steaks, 1 fish and chips, and 3 desserts and 1 nice bottle of wine came to £269.00! Its a shame, because the food was first class, but it did put us off eating in any of the other restaraunts. Apart from that, we have no complaints about anything, the polo bar is a nice place to relax with a drink after an evenings shopping in the malls. Kushan the waiter there is a genuinely nice guy. Its ramadan throughout august, so we were unable to get an alcoholic drink until after 9.00pm, and the music was very low key, so we didnt experience any noise which apparently is a problem when the clubs and bars are in full swing. I would definately stay there again, but maybe go with deeper pockets, so we could eat in some of the other restaraunts!

Reviews.Title: “Amamzing Views, Great Pool and Water Slides, fab location”
Reviews.Author: Rajeshsaryu
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early for my wifes 40th Birthday Celebrations on a flight from Mauriitus. The hotel had our room ready by 9am. However the tower family rooms provided 2 large single beds and one foldaway. As soon as we asked for another room, Rubi inguest relation assigned a new room with everything we wanted and more - a suite! They went out of their way to make things easy for us! A surprise cake and basket of fruits in the room. Free room service breakfast when my wife was down with a cold. The extra touch of a card to say get well too. Even the manager sent a card to welcome us!!! The gym was awesome as was the spa. The pool area and beach too were incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: dwrgodden
Reviews.Content: The quality of this hotel exceeded my expectations. The bedroom was huge and the bathroom luxurious. I was lucky enough to be on the top floor, so the view to the sea and The Palm Jumeira was spectacular. The hotel pool was huge with a great swim-up bar. The service throughout the hotel (poolside, in the bars, the restaurant and service desk) was all first class. The breakfast served everything you could possible desire and the quality of food very good. It does get pretty busy in the breakfast room, so consider room service. Between the two main hotel towers is a very lively Horizon Lounge Bar, but it may be a bit noisy at night if you're trying to sleep in one of the overlooking rooms. It's a short stroll to the white sandy beach and warm sea. Fantastic sunsets and yet another cool bar, Al Manara, just off the beach is great for those sundowners. As is the case in Dubai, there is always a lot of construction work going on, so worth asking at the time of booking for a room with a sea view to avoid this potential problem.

Reviews.Title: “We would go back but make sure we are booked into the tower rooms rather than garden view”
Reviews.Author: Raymcclay4
Reviews.Content: Habtoor Grand is classed as a 5 star but more like a 4 star - a bit tired to the other 5 star hotels in Dubai - we stayed in Garden view rooms which were a bit tired - there was no happy medium with the air conditioning. Bathroom was tired and quite small - grout needed redoing in bath. No cold water at all - although on the last day we asked to see the rooms in the tower and these were much better - more on par with the Jumeriah beach were we normally stay. very built up area but close to the walk which has a load of restuarants

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Have Fun”
Reviews.Author: ZTA87
Reviews.Content: Spent a weekend here with my brother. It's a fairly nice hotel, but I would its star rating hovering around between 4 and 5 rather than it being 5. The bathroom in our room wasn't up to 5 star standards in terms of finishing and cleanliness; the pool is big but it has a weird smell; and the breakfast buffet definitely was not 5 star standard in terms of quality and choice of foods available. There is a really nice gym though and that's always a plus.

Reviews.Title: “We have re booked for Christmas 2011”
Reviews.Author: dominic0
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff could not do enough for us. Always went the extra mile to make sure our stay was top quality.
