The room was kept spotless by the cleaning dept and always had flowers and fruit . On many occasion the executive chef talked with us regarding the food quality and what might be changed in respect of choice. None was my reply. I also know that the government food hygene inspectors were there during our stay and the hotel passed with flying colours. Many thanks to Alex the General manager he took the time to ask if all was well with our stay and if i needed anything to contact himself and the food director Luke who made sure all was perfect. We even had a chat with the Charman of the hotel group Mr Habtoor himself if he can take time to speak with his guests it speaks volumes for the company. Well done and i can only hope that other Hotels take note of the commitment to its customers that the Habtoor Group as taken to roll out to its paying guests. True 5 Star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “the brilliant break!”
Reviews.Author: sbaig2
Reviews.Content: extremely friendly staff, always willing to help. especially Arvy at the reception! the hotel gardens are beautiful like an oasis and we really liked the peacocks :) this is a good hotel for families as the kids club, children pools and slides are a lot of fun. also if you have a disability the hotel run a club cart service which makes it easier to get about the resort. overall we had a good stay and look forward to coming to the habtoor grand resort again. A big thanks to all!

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good if you know the place”
Reviews.Author: Davewbrown007
Reviews.Content: For a business hotel it's important to get a "tower" room, rather than an outside room - the internet in the ouside rooms is intermittent at best. Aside from this, the hotel is fine; what you can expect from a hotel of this standard in Dubai. The African restaurant on the ground floor is superb, the staff friendly and the food excellent. In fact, all of the restaurants are good and offer a wide variety of cuisine. This is probably the best of the beach hotels in this area, as there are water-sports located directly down from the hotel. Typical of Dubai, expect the surrounding roads to the hotel to be building sites, but this doesn't really spoil the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “"Sleepless Nights in The Habtoor"”
Reviews.Author: K80DWP
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a two week holiday through Thomas Cooke comprising a stay in the Maldives with the last couple of days in Dubai. We asked for a quality hotel which would meet our reasonable requirements predominantly to able to relax and enjoy the sites of Dubai. On the recommendation of our Travel Company and knowing what we wanted the Habtoor was recommended. Following Trip Advisor reviews prior to our holiday it became apparent that there maybe a noise problem with a nightclub in the hotel. Having checked this out we were assured by our travel company this was not the case. When we arrived at the hotel we noticed that our dark musty room near the pool was close to a new outside bar and the room boy recommended we upgrade as it would be noisy. We ended up in a nice upgraded room in one of the towers which we had to pay extra for and looked forward to the remainder of our holiday. However, we had not bargained for the nosie from the nightclub between the towers, which is a franchise ,and the hotel has no control over. The noise levels were unbelievable and even with ear plugs we could still hear it well into the early hours of the morning. The manager was very apologetic and confirmed all he could do was offer us another upgrade at no cost. He confirmed that we would still hear the noise!! On checking out we asked to be reimbursed by the hotel for the upgrade which was refused. Since returning to the UK we have tried to sort this out through the travel company with no joy to date. Trip Advisor is invaluable and we strongly recommend if you want a quite and relaxing hotel this is not for you.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, we were lucky that we picked the habtoor as it was perfect for our needs!”
Reviews.Author: Danzi333
Reviews.Content: We were 3 guys in our late 20's looking for a fun filled holiday but a nice quality place to rest! When we arrived at the hotel we had a nice greeting by reception, they even asked us about the room we wanted and showed us around a few so we could decide which on we preferred (or upgrade to if we wished) after deciding on a sea view room on the 12 floor they allowed us to check in at 9.30am even tho it stated we wasn't ment to till 2pm (thank you habtoor) We were all sharing this room so had to have a portable bed bed brought to the room, this was a little hard but again they promptly listened and gave us extra bedding to soften it up :) the king size bed was lovely and managed a perfect nights sleep every night, the aircon was nice a cool and was much needed due to the heat outside. The facility's were great just a shame we didn't make the most of them all, we did use the gym which was lovely and clean and very good equipment. My favourite has to be the horizon pool, it was higher up and over looked the beautiful sea and twinkling buildings in the background! There was always a nice guy to welcome you and bring you a towel. They other pool was very large and had a pool bar. Next to it was a few slides (even fun for us big kids) There are many places to eat and drink within the hotel but were a little expensive but this was to be expected. The grounds was beautifully maintained and had good security! We had no problems with any other guests and never heard any noise from other rooms at night due to solid Walls! NIGHTLIFE....the hotel is quite renowned for the nightlife mainly the XL beach club, this was set a little away from the hotel towards the beach. There is another bar tho which could be heard at night from our room mainly because we overlooked it, it didn't bother us in the slightest as we were all up for the nightlife (to other guests this may be a problem if you go to bed early and are a light sleeper) I'm sure the hotel if possible would move you?! Very mixed group of people at this hotel but everyone got on well! Would strongly recommend it and would love to stay there again! Thank you Habtoor.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it & we will definitely be back”
Reviews.Author: Butt_5054
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best stays me & my family had, we would definitely recommend this to others. We were looking for a hotel that is closer to the beach this ticked every boxs. They had everything we needed, gym, beach, pool, spa etc... Our room was over looking the garden & pool which was really beautiful, the hotel had very friendly staff & had very nice hospitality skills. The hotel location is ok as the main attractions are abit far, although you have the marina walk & JBR which was a 10mins walk away from the hotel. The reason why I would come back to this hotel for my next stay in Dubai is the friendly staff & the facilities the hotel provides. The only thing that some people may be put off from is the noise from the 2 clubs on the resort. Although I did use both of them, but just request a room away from the noise & the staff will definetly help you.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and my husband is already back!!!”
Reviews.Author: Elsa-Leonidas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at HGR in June for 10 days during a business & pleasure trip. The experience was fantastic. Our room was nice and very clean and overviewing the garden and the beach. It was very well climatized, the bed was huge and very comfortable. The bathroom was just great with big bathtub and seperate big shower. The morning, as well as the evening buffet were very rich with many choices. We alsa tried the food at Al Basha restaurant and at The Grand Grill. Both of the were very tasty. The pool area was very clean and pleasant and the coctails at the pool bar ... super. The pool was really great and the pool area for the children, with the waterslides ... fantastic. Right now my husband is on a business trip at Dubai and he stays OF COURCE in Habtoor Grand. Where else?!!!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful hotel we will always return to”
Reviews.Author: Ispahir
Reviews.Content: We had nice rooms overeviewing the garden and te beach, well climatized and all the time filled with the things necessary. The buffets were great, the morning the same as in the evening. A delicious mixture of cooking styles that fits every hunger and taste. Pool and beach were verz clean and the service there excellent. We especially loved the fresh towels we got at every visit! The only thing we did not like were some guests not especting the class of their hotel and coming for breakfast or even dinner in muscle shirts and bathing sandals. Perhaps a little sign with pictograms may help to avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Good beach hotel in Dubai Jumeirah beach”
Reviews.Author: mwafrica4
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a beach hotel in the area of Jumeirah, and decided to try the Habtoor Grand. We selected a room on a high level of one of the towers. It was quite nice with the usual Dubai luxury items although a bit tired at the edges. The beach was very nice although a long walk through the private gardens. The pool was big but far too hot. The drinks were crazy expensive. The fitness room was super nice. Staff were good although a bit overworked by the demands of some of our fellow customers who came from the ex Soviet states. Plenty of them. We enjoyed watching the sun set over the Gulf each evening while sitting on the quiet beach, and having evening drinks in the palm tree and jungle garden. There is valet parking only but this was quick and efficient. In all we have a good time despite the way Dubai is going these days. Only a bit of construction happening on the East side of the hotel, but this doesn't disturb you.

Reviews.Title: “NICE CHOICE FOR POOL & BEACH DAY USE”
Reviews.Author: bbears2118
Reviews.Content: Me & my sister had fun in habtoor grand when we had day use for their pool & beach last June 2, 2011. The pool & beach area is relaxing.We paid 175 AED each for day use. Affordable prices for food and drinks too. They have a lovely peacock roaming around the area, that was an additional amusement. The staff are friendly especially the staff in the towel counter. The sea food pizza in Ksara restaurant is deliciously served hot. Thanks habtoor, till next time.. Hope you will have a better deal price for day use so we can invite more friends.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE the XL Beach Club!”
Reviews.Author: Love079
Reviews.Content: I love everything about this hotel.The experience of Hatoor Grand Beach Resort and Spa has been totally amazing!Even though it is now the middle of summer and the sun is extremely hot,the food,the service,the shisha,places to party and unwind is fantastic!<3 The staff are very friendly and polite especially from the young lady from the Concierge,Ms.Candy who gave over and above 5 star service and made me feel very special.I will definately come back to this hotel!Keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful Stay and a fantastic overall experience”
Reviews.Author: suzywongSouthwest
Reviews.Content: I along with two friends have just spent 5 nights at the Habtoor, we had an absolutely wonderful time. The staff could not have been more helpful, our room was spotlessly clean and very comfortable, the staff around the pool appeared to be able to anticipate our every need and were available without being intrustive, we were on a half board basis and found the food to be of a very high standard (we never experienced any problems at breakfast time) the food was always hot, tasty and looked fresh. During our visit my friend had a problem and needed some medication and when we went to the pharmacist they advised that they could get the medicine by 19:00pm, the hotel staff arranged to collect it and delivered it to our room....you cant get better than that for service. We never had any problems with noise and we found the staff to be very happy, helpful and attentive, nothing was to much trouble, I highly recommend the Habtoor and we will without doubt be returning, we also did not feel that the Hotel decor looked old or in need of updating, all in all we had a great time and as I have said we will definately be returning, so please ignore all the bad reviews and go to the habtoor.

Reviews.Title: “missing dubai due to expereince we had at habtoor grand!”
Reviews.Author: Ayyaz022
Reviews.Content: when we arrived at the hotel the welcome we had was amzing very friendly and helpful, we told them our preference of room and they gave us a room that meet the expectation we was expecting they also arranged our luggage to go upstiars to our room so it was there when we got there. the room we stayed in was amazing very clean the cleaners our very though in there work . the room was very spacious and the bed was ever so comfortable , the view we had from our room we could not of asked for a better view to wake up to. the wardrobe space was excellent had anoth space to put both our stuff and more . we also had a safe in the room which you could use your credit/ debit card to open and close no change on this. the bathroom was also a decent size with a good flow of water the bath was bigger than and standard bath which was fantastic it also had a maginifying mirror which was helpful. i also like the fact how they pt little travel size toothpaste mouthwash shampoo conditioner ect in the bathroom for you. the pools where great you could always get a sunbed the bar pool was good quick service and was just all around clean and a enjoyable placew to be aswell as the beach, the infinity pool was also amazing couldnt believe how cold the water kept what made all the difference as it was a hot time of year the view was also spectaucular. me and my partner had a full body massage we both enjoyed this expereince we had the sauna was very nice very relaxing would recommend this. we went to the horizon pool club one night this is a good night out a night to remember very enjoyable lots of friendly people gets very busy on a tuesday but u still get your drinks in good time. we recieved half board n the hotels the pasta was very nice you could choose yuor topping which we both loved and also the breakfast was good as yuo could have aan omelette and choose the topping on this also you could have crossiants toaste and lots more food that was also very nice. the hotel itself was at good standard and would defo stay there again there is a business centre which they are very helpfull if you need to book any trips online they are happy to help you and ever so friendly. this hotel is situated in a good place not far from the jumeriah residence where you will find a variety of restaurance and it only a 5-10 mins walk at the most. the metro is also walking distance and if you do not want to walk to there it is only 10 aed or less which is around about 1.50 recoemmend going on the metro it is very cheap and easy to get places also very clean like the whole of dubai. the fair well we receieved was excellent from the hotel easy check out our baggage was brought downstair and when our transfer came they brought it out and put it in the car for us the people here and very kind and helpful no matter where you are from you feel like u get treated the same if you have any problem if u speak to them they sort it out straight away . i would highly recommened this hotel . cant wait to come back out to dubai and stay at this hotel again see you in decemeber !! ps i recommend going to wild wadi also dubai mall to see the water fountian show its out of this world

Reviews.Title: “exellent :)))))))”
Reviews.Author: jovanovicirena
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay, staffs are nice, food is good, pool and beach, rooms everything are good and i will be back on december. :)))) :*****

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service, Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelMuch1263
Reviews.Content: The Habtoor Grand was a stunning hotel in a very convenient location, just minutes from the Emirates Mall and a short taxi ride from the Burj Khalifa and its beautiful fountains. We purchased breakfast and lunch/dinner with our room rate, and it was every bit worth it...the selection of foods was diverse (the only thing we noticed was that with the lunch or dinner, drinks including water are additional even though we paid for the buffet--minimal cost). The pool was family friendly, a very short walk from the beautiful Jumeira Beach. Very well kept and clean, and the servers were very attentive. Our room was a corner king room with windows on both sides facing the sea, we recommend you pay the small difference in rate. Housekeeping and room service were very professional and our room was cleaned each morning with a turn-down service offered in the evening, including delicious chocolates. :) My flight was delayed our last day there, and Mr. Trabefsi, their chief concierge was so accommodating it truly surprised me, at a moment when things were not so clear as to when we would be flying out, he offered a late check out to accommodate us. Little things like this really make all the difference, and we are already planning a trip back to the Habtoor Grand!!!! Beautiful Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “excellent and friendly stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: xvianna
Reviews.Content: In this hotel I fellt as in my home. everyone is so kind and I have to say I am missing since now everyone that I met here. Rodel, Purna , July and Larcy, for ever in my heart!

Reviews.Title: “Hope I'll come back”
Reviews.Author: shevoks
Reviews.Content: Very competent staff, perfect servise, good breakfast and pleasant green territory

Reviews.Title: “Chose your room wisely”
Reviews.Author: s_mulch
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights in a tower sea view room. Everything was going well the views awesome, the room clean and nice, It wasnt until we got back to our room about 10.30pm after a full day of sightseeling that we could hear the banging dance music . We immeidiately complained and was moved to a suite where you couldnt hear the music. This was on a thursday night. This i heard from staff is a common complaint . I can understand why. Overall the hotel has great qualities , the staff are friendly and the facilties good, but be warned its a busy hotel and chose your room wisely. The night club on site is suppose to be the best in Dubai and is very popular , If you want a quiet break go somewhere else ,

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel but extortionate prices and too noisy!!”
Reviews.Author: MellyMoo84
Reviews.Content: We booked a 4 night stay here as part of our honeymoon, then went on to Kuredu in The Maldives for 10 nights. We arrived at around 7am in the morning and the reception informed us that check in wasn’t until 2pm but they would ‘allow’ us to go to a room – like they were doing us a massive favour. With an overnight flight and the time difference added on we were shattered and just wanted to go to bed so I chose to ignore this apparent attitude and being made to feel as though we were a huge inconvenience. Room: We got taken around the hotel in a golf buggy and the driver pointed out where things were, which was a nice touch. Then we arrived at our room, opened the door, and the bathroom ceiling had obviously been dripping for a few hours as the bathroom was flooded, we presumed there was a leak on the floor above. My husband rang reception who said they would send maintenance. We then had a 2-3 hour nap and maintenance had not showed up so my husband walked up to the reception and told them again. On our return from the beach later on the bathroom had been sorted and the leak didn’t come back luckily. Apart from that I was happy with the room, apart from it being on the ground floor when we had requested a high floor. It was a lovely size, clean and had a nice view of the gardens. There is a turn down service every night with a little chocolate placed on your pillow and 2 complimentary bottles of water every day. Also cleaned daily, bed made and towels changed. Hotel: The hotel has lots and lots of different bars, we didn’t get to visit them all but if you do you have to shout to hear each other over the music. There are also 3 restaurants that you can book and have to pay extra to eat there. We looked at the menu for Luciano’s (Italian) but weren’t that taken with it so didn’t bother with any of these restaurants. If you like to go to bed early I wouldn’t bother, the music is ridiculously loud and once in your room a constant boom, boom, boom can be heard. We went to bed around 11-12am and luckily our room wasn’t too close but we could still hear it, although not enough to bother us. After reading other reviews I think we were quite lucky with our room allocation in regards to the music! Beach and Pool: Due to the ridiculous amount of children at the hotel and in the pool area (running around and screaming!) we decided to spend our time on the beach. The staff here were fabulous, made sure we had a bed with a shade etc and just generally helpful. I know certain nationalities like to ‘save’ sun beds by placing their towels on them, this didn’t happen. The guys moved any towels left for long periods of time to allow other guests to use the sun beds, something I totally agree with! On our last day I went parasailing with the guys on the beach and it was amazing being able to see over Jumeirah Beach from the air. We also spent some time in the infinity pool on the 3rd floor as it is over 16s only so was nice and quiet! This pool is extremely clean and warm and when the marina is finished it will have a tremendous view! Food: We booked B&B but were upgraded to HB and thank goodness we were! The food and drinks prices were EXTORTIONATE!!! I am not a naïve traveller and I have stayed in other 4 and 5* hotels all over the world. I knew Dubai was going to be expensive but I was still shocked at just how bad it was. It was around £6 for an orange juice, £12 for a cocktail and £9 for a bottle of Corona!! As there aren't other restaurants around the hotel and it is a dry country so no bars (and restaurants don't serve alcohol either) they have you over a barrel and can charge what they like. It was about 30-40mins in a taxi to the city centre where all the restaurants are so by the time you have paid that you may as well eat at the hotel and save messing about. Most things cost either 50 or 100AED which was roughly £9 or £18. One day for lunch we got a baguette each that came with either fries and wedges and it cost 100AED, insane!! The food in the restaurant was OK, nothing to write home about. There does seem to be a lot of choice but once you look it is all similar/repeated dishes. I did love the pasta station where they cooked it in front of you and you choose your sauce, type of pasta, and what you want in it. Breakfast was absolutely ridiculous, the staff clearly couldn’t cope and get tables ready quick enough and I don’t feel the time slot is long enough to cater for the vast quantity of people staying at the hotel. I was so disappointed that they didn’t have pancakes, something you expect to see, and what they did have was cold (waffles and French toast). The orange juice ran out as soon as it was topped up because guests where getting up to 4 glasses at a time, probably to stock up on liquid so they didn’t have to pay for a drink in the next couple of hours!! At lunch or dinner when you order a drink they bring a bill, you then pay for it and sign the sheet, or so we were told on the first day by the waiter….. Our flight to Kuredu was at 10am so we had to leave the hotel at 7am. On checking out the receptionist claimed we had a charge against our room for 2 drinks we had had in the restaurant the night before. My husband had paid cash for these, as we had for everything throughout our stay, we did not charge anything to the room. He argued for a bit then got his manager. My husband was getting extremely angry and irritated as we had to get to the airport and this was now 20minutes later. The manager said that you only signed the slip of paper to agree to the charge been put against your room. We were not told this and now think that some of the waiters are pocketing cash used to pay for things and then running the charge to your room, I’m sure some people wouldn’t notice, but as we had charged nothing to our room we knew it was their mistake. The manager then rang the restaurant staff manager and wanted to speak to somebody who had worked last night, but obviously they weren’t in as they did the night shift so he disappeared to try and ring somebody at their home! We were furious and made to feel like criminals, also worried we were going to miss our flight. He then came back and said it ‘didn’t matter’ and got us to sign a customer discount card that they swiped through the till, so who knows what happened when he disappeared! It spoilt the end of our trip as they were extremely rude and acted as though we were trying to rip them off. Would I stay here again? Probably not, it is too expensive for what you get, I certainly didn’t feel as though we got our monies worth. We wanted pure luxury with it being our honeymoon and I would only describe this hotel as ‘nice’. We went on the dolphin trip to Atlantis which I would highly recommend, this includes entry to the water park and the swim with dolphins, although it cost almost £250 each! All of the trips are super expensive so if you are planning on doing any make sure you take plenty of money. My husband also got a massage in the spa which cost about £80. I would also recommend a trip to the city centre to see the fountain show next to Dubai Mall, and the mall itself is huge!! Defiantely worth a look! One thing that did irritate me is that an old school friend of mine stayed here 8 months before us for her honeymoon and they upgraded her room, put a fruit basket in their room and invited them to a free evening meal which should have cost around £400 including drinks! We didn’t get any of this, or any other special treatment for being honeymooners which I was disappointed about.

Reviews.Title: “It's getting old...”
Reviews.Author: MrsKRR
Reviews.Content: We went to the hotel for four days in May for our honeymoon. Staff were aware it was our honeymoon but no one went out of their way to make it extra special for us. Reception staff were not very helpful which was a total contrast against all other staff in the restaurants, near the pools and at the bars as they were superb and customer service was great. We asked to stay for two extra hours as our flight wasn't until 11pm, however we were told we'd be charged half the fees of staying an entire night. There was no offer of our luggage being stored and us enjoying the hotels ameninties until we departed. The hotel itself is not what I would class as 5*. We arrived to a room which firstly appeared nice but upon further inspection you noticed was ageing. There was a handle missing from the bathroom door. You could see where things had been glued back on. There were marks on the walls. We were only supplied with one bath robe and when myhusband put that on, it had large holes in it. The towels were hard and although the room was clean, attention to detail had not been paid. When we arrived there was blue gel all along the bathroom wall and this had been left there and remained there throughout our stay. We were left with no toilet rolls one day. The pools close too early, a late night dip would have been lovely in the heat. As for the salon, I found that appauling. I had a pedicure and was left in immense pain. The stool which the beautician was sat on was held together to cellotape. The salon itself looked and felt very cheap. The spa however was lovely, though it was a shame my husband and I couldn't have treatments done together. In all, on first impressions the hotel looks lovely and our stay was quite pleasant, however, we were hoping for romance and exquisite surroundings but instead got a room which we could hear music beating every night and no rose petals left on our bed. It is the attention to detail that makes a hotel worthy of 5* and I do not think this hotel is worthy of all 5.

Reviews.Title: “A nightclub....with rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ravpan
Reviews.Content: We stopped here as a last destination coming back from our honeymoon in the far east. On check in, I specifically specified that we wanted a quiet room which was away from the all the noise (as I had read the reviews regarding the nightclub). The manager discussed this with his staff and decided to offer us room 123, which was on the ground floor in the annexe building...right next to a bar and the nightclub!! The manager stated that this was an excellent room which was very quiet and away from all the noise! Luckily, after a heated discussion, he managed to get us moved into the tower, which was quieter and we had a better view as well. As it was a saturday night, we could still hear the music, but it wasnt so bad - the other nights, the music was very quiet as was the hotel (maybe all the reviews have put people off from staying here!). I dread to think what its like on a friday and saturday night though! Definately the priority appears to be with the nightclub and bars and not the guests The rest of our stay here was pleasant, food was ok, staff were very slow (but got there in the end), rooms need some paint and more functional items, but on the whole it was a good destination to stop at. However, if we stayed in the annexe, then I would have been extremely disappointed and have asked for all of my money back, I wouldnt recommend putting animals in there to stay! Also, please DONT book any excursions with the chimps at the hotel - they are well overpriced and a waste of money - instead speak to the concierge who will give you a Dubai map, and local companies that can offer exactly the same things for half price. For example, the desert safari - with the hotel its 290D PER PERSON, with Oasis Travel it was £170D per person! Overall, stay here from Sunday - Thursday (only if there are special offers) and if you want a good nights sleep, specifically state to be put in the tower and not the outdoor sheds!

Reviews.Title: “Broken promises...Please do not book here”
Reviews.Author: Jay72Toronto
Reviews.Content: If you value your time and effort please DO NOT book here. We arrived to find the most incompetent front desk staff I have ever experienced. We were on business and the rooms were paid in advance however the front desk still wanted a deposit of - get this - $2750 CDN. I refused and they finally relented. The staff are at best present, with no interest in service. The food sucks termendously. The spa is very unaccomodating. We received a voucheur for a free spa visit however after booking and speaking with no less then four staff members, I was advised at 11:00pm the night before that they had mistakenly given me along with the others in my group this voucheur, and they were not going to honour it. What a sorry "5 star" hotel. They will not care if you come or don't, as they have more money then, well you can guess the rest. Please take this warning and choose wisely before coming here.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bchristo63
Reviews.Content: Tower rooms very good, pillows not comfortable though. If you need to sleep a bit at night, avoid the side of Horizon club; it's open until 02:30 hrs several times a week. The resort rooms are old and need refurbishment. Large spaces outdoors as in all hotels in the area. Staff is polite as everywhere in this country but not efficient at all...so what to do the nice smile if it doesn't help you at all....for a minor or a major problem; you expect to get solutions in a 5 star hotel, no?

Reviews.Title: “One Night Only”
Reviews.Author: Lulusmum
Reviews.Content: Was booked in this hotel for 12 night vacation for Easter 2011. Did not even unpack. Would not have stayed at all but for our midnight arrival and trying to get another hotel at that time of night would have been difficult. Horrible check-in but at least it provided us with the amusing' sights' walking in/out of the hotel for the 20 minute wait. The room looked like a furniture repository with a chaise-lounge, large armchair and matching footstool as well as the bed and dresser. The only thing good about this room was the bathroom which seemed at odds with the rest of the down-beat 'suite' Went to look at the beach area but the pool area was very crowded and the fumes from the barbeque were choking. The gang of drunken men playing football helped us to make up our minds about vacating the place. Arrived at 12.30am and left at 11am the same day. Didn't mind paying the cancellation charge just to be out of the place. The Westin was a much better option.

Reviews.Title: “Standards slipping”
Reviews.Author: darrenxxx
Reviews.Content: We started going to this hotel in 2007,we've very fond memories of the Habtoor and Dubai as its where we bought our engagement and wedding rings ,We always loved the Hotel ,the staff go out of their way to say hello and the food and breakfast were/are top notch, the rooms are a good size (tower rooms) So in itself the hotel could not be faulted BUT and here’s the big BUT and a BUT that made us go to New York this year ,The infinity Pool which is located over the reception used to be a nice quiet area for couples and there were not kids allowed but when we returned they seemed to have erected a huge marquee/tent and come towards the weekend they BLAST disco music out in that area, now I’m young enough only in my mid 30's and love all types of music but when all you want to do is chill beside a pool and you can’t because you can’t hear yourself think ,it’s not good. I mean my wife was laying beside me and I had to shout at her to hear me, it was that load, We did try and go down to the main pool area but with the heat and no breeze behind the hotel and it being one of the busiest hotels at the weekend we lasted about 30mins before heading back to the room. To the Management of the Habtoor - Please remove the marquee and turn the infinity pool area back to the tranquil place it was.

Reviews.Title: “Noise pollution + arrogant bouncers = no return”
Reviews.Author: s_club_1
Reviews.Content: It's great to have a hotel where the bouncer at the in-hotel club refuses you for not 'booking in advance' whilst admitting his Emirati cronies. It's also great to find it impossible to sleep until 4 am because the aforementioned club leaves more privileged people shouting and screaming outside your window until the early hours. Thanks, Habtoor Grand!

Reviews.Title: “Dream Dubai Not A Dream”
Reviews.Author: LABx4
Reviews.Content: Context: Family with two young boys traveling from London over spring break. We booked the holiday through DreamDubai (dreamticket.com) travel agent. Our requirements: 5 star hotel on Jumeriah Beach, kid friendly, non-smoking room, with one king bed. Prior to paying for the holiday, the travel agent was initially fantastic helping us sort out air and hotel. We had seen the negative reviews on the hotel and were extremely hesitant but a colleague in the travel agent's office vouched for the Habtoor Grand. We further requested seats on the plane before the wings as my boys get motion sick and the forward seats minimize the problem. After we paid for the trip, I noted the final confirmation had noindication of non-smoking room but with two double beds (when we travel we co-sleep so not accepatble). I called and e-mailed multiple times but from the day we paid until a week after the trip never heard from our travel agent . Note we did speak to another representative the day we flew out but had no reassurances. We also contacted the hotel ourselves. Problems: - Seats in the back of the airplane (and one of my boys did get sick) - Not only did we not get the early check-in we requested ;we didn't get our room until nearly 6 pm (check-in was 2 pm) - the hotel upgraded us to a suite, so it had a king bed but it was SMOKING (I would have preferred our friends room that had just king bed, no sitting area, but no smoking either) - the room and anemities are dated; carpet needs replaced - looks like 1970's - the shower was broke, soaking the entire bathroom floor (never fixed despite several requests); had to roll towels outside the shower doors to act as dams - the phone was broke, so light was constantly blinking (particularly annoying at night - again never fixed) - the common areas of the hotel was nicer and the hotel was generally clean - meals were convenient bu chaotic; not enough glasses to get drinks (regardless of when you ate); nor cereal bowls for breakfast - became a running joke with our families - further half board didn't cover drinks; so we spent over 500 on juices, water, soft drinks - no personal touch (had to serve own drinks; clean up own plates) experiences wouldn't expect of a five-star - my kids take piano lessons and on the last night was rudely removed from the piano that they had played multiple times, usually recital pieces (I'm specific because they weren't "banging" on the piano - put up a sign if you don't want people playing your piano) - concierge was no help; for example when we enquired what we needed to book a dolphin encounter, we were told to "look it up on the internet" or wait until the excursion agents returned the next day (desks manned by companies); my questions were generally to the tune of how long it took to get to a location or the opening hours... - when we did ask the next morning about the dolphins at Atlantis, we were informed fully booked; we went to Atlantis anyway and got tickets immediately Helpful HInts - Wild Wadi: take your own towels (charged 45 to rent) - Ski Dubai: pack gloves (not a rental item; had to buy in store next door); where helmets in the snow park! - Burj Kalifa: buy tickets on line before you leave (no tickets available on day of entry) Overall, we had an enjoyable trip but no thanks to our travel agent. Our friends were able to organize the air and hotel themselves for the same cost as the agent (actually lower; agent then threw in half-board, which in hind-sight tied us to the hotel.) The "Walk" is five minutes away and also has nice dining probably at a lower cost. Kids enjoyed the pool slide but would NOT stay in this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Kassioun
Reviews.Content: Had a fabulous 5 day stay here. Family room stunning view and great accomodation. Staff just wonderful in all areas of the hotel, especially the pool and buffet dining room. We went half board which was a stroke of genius. Buffet astonishinly fresh, interesting and great quality: suited all the family - including a very fussy eater - congratulations! Altogether combined comfort and luxury. Loved the choice of bars, restaurants, pools and the beach was just brilliant. The hotel was very full when we went but there is so much space and options of things to do and places to go, you never felt crowded or rushed. Just perfect and qute frankly I would go back again as soon as possible for a totally relaxing and enjoyable family break. Never said that about anywhere before.

Reviews.Title: “Overall good experience but choose your room wisely!”
Reviews.Author: Sport15
Reviews.Content: The good,bad and ugly! We have just returned from a long weekend in this hotel. Firstly the rooms are excellent we stay in the towers. However, the music was an issue playing until around 2.30am not funny! We did request a room change in the morning and thank god they had some rooms available. When we arrived at the hotel they wanted 15,000 Durham as a deposit from our credit card whilst I have no problem with this until I came to check out. I paid for our stay in cash and asked for the card to have the money Iaid as a deposit reversed. I was then informed that this will take up to 3 weeks!! Complained I did but whilst waiting a reception for the manager I did see three other couples with the same problem. Why so long for the credit ? If you are staying half board please be aware when you arrive as again the hotel state it only commences from your first night sleep. All in all the hotel experience was good and service good apart from the above a

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor Grand Resort and Spa Tower Sea View Room Or Le Royal Meridien Club Seaview room”
Reviews.Author: Pearlha
Reviews.Content: Hello Please help us with your reviews, we are not sure what to choose between Habtoor Grand Resort and Spa Tower Sea View Room Or Le Royal Meridien Club Seaview room. We are supposed to go there in mid August 2011, just me and my fiance What would you choose and why? Please advise

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel - only complaint was loud music played to 2.30 to 3.00 am”
Reviews.Author: Terry_June_11
Reviews.Content: 29th March to 6th April 2011 My wife and I found this hotel to be very pleasant and clean with well mannered staff to whom nothing was too much trouble. Every effort was made to ensure our stay was without a hitch. The food was excellent and the service also of a high standard. The only complaint we had during the entire stay was the loud music played until the very early hours (2.30 to 3.00 am) most nights with complete disregard for people who wanted to sleep. Our room was situated on the 18th floor of the Sea View Tower and sleep was impossible. After making our verbal complaint to the night manager we were moved the next morning to the 21st floor and on the outer side of the tower. This room was a tremendous improvement and we managed to get to sleep without any further problems for the rest of our stay. Summary: A great hotel as long as you get the right room in the right location where there is no noise !!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing due mainly to noise from disco between midnight and 3AM”
Reviews.Author: jocsac
Reviews.Content: 3rd occasion I have stayed at this hotel but will not be returning. I stayed in a club room on the 8th Floor which was very clean and comfortable although the decor is a little 'tired'. The general service was good with the service in the club lounge being absolutely fantastic. The noise from the music between midnight and3AM was terrible and there was no chance of sleep between this period. How residents in the garden rooms put up with the noise I cannot imagine.

Reviews.Title: “Super!!!”
Reviews.Author: khokhlovaelena
Reviews.Content: Hello All, I would like to thank all staff of Habtoor Grand hotel. We lived there 12 days. We lived in the bungalow with garden view. Our daughter was very happy (10 years). She liked the slide in the pool for children. We had easy access to the swimming pool and all restaurants around. The hotel service was very quick. The people very kind. I hope to come back to fairy tale again!

Reviews.Title: “Not my first stay and definitely not the last”
Reviews.Author: Ramy58
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay in Habtoor Grand. I'm very pick when it comes to selecting a hotel to stay in, especially in Dubai. I've stayed in almost every hotel in Jumairah, Dubai Marine, Atlantis, Le Royal Meridien, Mina A Salam, Grosvenor House, Hilton Jumeirah and of course, Habtoor Grand. Although other hotel looks so classy and fancy, yet, I've enjoyed staying in Habtoor the most. Not only because the facility is so good, the location is superb, the rooms are wonderfully furnished and the service is great, but also because this is the only with so much varieties of venues that you won't need to go out! Seriously, between enjoying wonderful atmosphere and music in the beach club, hanging out in 4 different restaurants and 3 different bars and the wonderful view of the pool bar, I didn't have the time (or the need) to go out in my 8 days stay! The hotel is also located very close the the famous JBR Walk if you want to have some nice afternoon walking and seeing around. food in the hotel is spectacular weather you order it in the room or in one of the restaurants. the hotel has to types of rooms: Tower Rooms (and Suits) which are located in the main building of the hotel, and Resort Rooms which are located around the pool area. I haven't stayed in any of the resort rooms although it looks more fun, because it's always fully booked. So, if you're planning to stay in one of those, you will have to make you're booking early enough to find availability. Over the weekend, the hotel gets so busy with visitors for Beach Club and Pool Bar which confirmed to me that it is one of the best destinations for outings in Dubai. So, if you're staying in, why to go out? :)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but can be noisy”
Reviews.Author: lynnd1959
Reviews.Content: Habtoor is excellent in many ways. The staff are very attentive and the room on the 18th floor was excellent with a super view of both Burj al Arab and Atlantis. The shower leaked and the toilet got blocked twice but the staff were very quick in coming to check it out. The bed was wonderfully comfy and with my bad back I slept better than I do at home and that's saying something. The hotel taxi from the airport was 200 dirhams but a regular taxi on the way back cost only 100 dirhams so use that. If you are female and travelling either alone or with other ladies, then try the pink taxis which are for women only. On arrival we upgraded and I was so glad we did. The room we had booked was called a garden room and this was very close to the beach club with music blaring out with laser lights until 1-2 am some nights. We could still hear it on the 18th floor but not quite so badly. Breakfast was lovely although the food could have been hotter. A map layout of the hotel would have been useful as it was difficult to find your way around. Internet access was expensive. 5* hotels here give free internet access. For the price we paid it should be free! Overall a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay - wish I was there now.”
Reviews.Author: Kjones77
Reviews.Content: My Fiance and I satayed here for a week earler this month and had such a lovely time. The staff are so friendly, we were upgraded to a room right by the pool which was fantastic and during the stay it was my Birthday an I returned from a day by the pool to be greeted by a lovely birthday cake and 2 birhday cards from the hotel - such a lovely thing to do. We really could not fault this hotel, the food was lovely, location was great, fabulous beach and the weather was just beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC STAY...didnt want to come home!”
Reviews.Author: Alicewilli
Reviews.Content: Myslef and my partner travelled to dubai to stay at the habtoor grand hotel resort from March 7th-15th 2011. After having read previous reviews i was a bit concernd on our choice of hotel but dont let this put you off!! I made sure i emailed the hotel my concerns (particulary the noise level from horizon bar) to ensure i was put in a room on the outside of the towers as the horizon bar is in the middle. Our room was great...we had views of the sea, harbour plus 3 of the best landmark hotels, the atlantis, burge and the burge khalifa. The pool area is fantastic, plenty of comfortable sun loungers where you collect fresh bathing towles each day to use. The infitity pool on the 3rd floor is gorgeous too for a bit of peace and quiet. Leading from the pool area is the gardens then the beach which has plenty more bathing areas and bars to chose from. Food is excellent, we ate an evening meal twice in our hotel during out stay, i reccomend the al basha restaurant which has belly dancers and a lebeneese cuisine and on a monday night we had a private table by the pool in candle light with out own mini barbecue with a large choice of kebabs. The salamar bar is is a must to try before or after dinner (you can also eat here) The atmosphere is so relaxed and in suberb surroundings to just chill. Be warned though, any alcoholic drink in dubai is very expensive!! For a galss of wine and bottle of corona your looking at £20! Not the place to be if you like nights of heavy drinking!! Look out for the ladies nights as free drinks are offered here (for the ladies) and the nights are always buzzing! As it was my birthday during my stay the hotel staff brought up a gorgeous birthday cake and birthday cards signed by everone at the hotel which was very thoughtful! One disaster i did have whilst my stay at the hotel was at the hair salon. I wanted my hair pinning up for an afternoon tea at the 7* burge hotel as it was my birthday. The service here was shocking. I left in tears as the hairdresser was terrible and had no idea what he was doing (even though they advertise wedding hair!!) I ended up just doing my hair myself. DO NOT USE THIS SALON!! There is plenty to do, a free shuttle bus goes to all the big shopping malls, i recommend the dubai shopping mall, its amazing, you can see the underwater zoo, go up the tallest building plus if you have dinner here, from 6.30pm, every half hour they have the splendid dancing fountains (far better tan the bellagio!). I also reccommend the safari, dinner cruise, atlantis day trip and big red bus tour. Aslo, always wear a seat belt whilst travelling...the road safety is horrendous! Sad to leave, will definately recommend this trip to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for good price”
Reviews.Author: moscowolechka
Reviews.Content: I really loved this hotel. The food was good, the room was always clean and well done. It's just a week since they have opened a really cool Beach Club! Cool place for those who like crazy sleepless nights full of music, dances, cocktails and fun! During day time you can relax there in cute private rooms! Plus 2 more clubs in the main buildings - one inside and one in the outside terrace! We were staying on the 8th floor and inspite of the fact we could hear music at night we slept really well (I guess due to the fact that we work too much at home :) ) I guess this hotel should more oriented on young people rather then families due to the fact they have 3 clubs in one place! I'd love to go there again with my friends.In my opinion there is only one disadvantage - they don't clean the sand in the mornings (there cigarette ends in the sand, candy wrappers, etc. But again in general it's a really good place to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than led to believe on here!”
Reviews.Author: Sugar577
Reviews.Content: We booked our holiay to Dubai, which included a few nights in the Habtoor, before I looked on here to see what the reviews were like as the hotel looked good in the brochures. I have to say that on reading the reviews I was a little concerned - however, I am happy to report that the majority of the reviews on here are rather unjust based on what we experienced! Perhaps there has been a change in the way they do things but we really enjoyed our stay here! We arrived at the hotel around 8am and understandly our room was not ready. We had requested one of the family rooms higher up in the tower having read about the nightclub on here. We were offered a drink whilst the staff member tried to find out when the room would be available. When it looked like it might be an hour or so we were invited to have breakfast. As it was, halfway through breakfast the staff member (I wish I'd made note of his name!) came through and told us that our room was ready when we were. Whilst on the subject of breakfast - its what you would expect in terms of a buffet breakfast with people walking around and a seemingly high turnover on tables but the staff were very quick to clear down tables, the food & drinks were regularly replenished and they seemed to appear from nowhere to replace clean cutlery (my youngest dropped his spoon the floor). The food was tasty and fresh and the banana cake was a particular favourite with my two. The room was clean, had a great view of the beach and the bathroom was very clean and tidy. We did overlook the Horizon Bar nightclub, which did concern me, this would be my ONLY criticism - on the Thursday and Friday night the music was very, very loud and seemed to get incrementally louder after midnight til around 2/3am. Unfortunately I am a light sleeper and once I heard the music found it very difficult to tune it out. The rest of my family however slept through it undistrubed. Saturday night there was no music at all. The pool was lovely and clean, the staff very friendly and attentive and the food from the pool bar was of a good standard and price. With regards to the food at the hotel - I can highly recommend the Salamar restaurant (hope I've spelt it correctly) Sat on the decking in the evening, the whole ambience was very relaxed but quite special. Our waiter (Islam) was very friendly and attentive, the food was amazing *cooked to perfection* and even the chef came out to speak to us. Their signature bread was freshly cooked and delicious and my steak just melted in the mouth. We also dined in the Bonsai on the 25th (?) floor - this restaurant is amazing! We sat on the terrace which looks out towards the palm, it was a little breezy (but we were determined) and the waiter bought out a couple of pashminas for my daughter & I to borrow. The decor and ambience of the restaurant is fantastic! Once again the food was delicious - my children throughly enjoyed the soft shell crab starter and the puddings were out of this world!! The one thing that struck me with the food is that it is all freshly prepared and cooked - they take real pride in the presentation of the food. It was also the little things like the pashminas, ensuring the children had their food in a timely manner and keeping them entertained, that just made our stay very very enjoyable. It was nice to go somewhere where the children aren't treated like parasites (I have two very well behaved children) and where they are proud of their service. I would happily recommend this hotel to anybody - although if it was a family with young children I might add a caveat about the nightclub, but even then I think the good points far outweigh the loud music, the food, service and friendly staff make this a good place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: smanteghi Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: When we arrived room was ready. We didn't have to wait long at check in. Very nice hotel overall, nice restuarants in the hotel. Room service was speedy. The only thing we weren't so happy about was we had to extend our stay but we weren't able to stay in the same room. We had to check out then check in to another room. The second room we checked into was a bit of a walk from the hotel. It was like a separate part to the hotel and there was like small lizard going up the wall so I was a bit scared of them. (The small lizards were outside the room. Not inside!) Room service to the second room was a bit slow and by the time it arrived it was a bit cold. I would recommend this hotel to friends and family and I would stay there again if I were to go to Dubai again.

Reviews.Title: “Last year visit... Void at all cost”
Reviews.Author: Saif-UK
Reviews.Content: I booked a room in this terrible hotel last year (Jan/2010), Awfull room, rude staff, even worse manger who threatend me that they will charge 2 nights if I cancel on the day. Worse attitude ever I have seen in any hotel (and I am a regular traveller) At the end I was so angry that I left the hotel immediatly and checked in the heavnly Atlantis Hotel for £300 per night (temproraly until I downgraded to the very beutfull, elegant and delightfull Westin Hotel). Habtoor did charge me the promised penatly but credit to Hotels.com they offered me a FULL refund after I explained the fiasco I experienced at the hotel

Reviews.Title: “This is a really nice hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Tom1986580405
Reviews.Content: I only stayed for a couple of days on my way back from Australia, but I really enjoyed my stay. There's alot of positives to this hotel, lovely room, a really nice pool and beach, several restaurants inside the hotel, a well kitted out gym. The only negatives I could think of were it's a bit out of the way, no where of great interest within a walking distance but there's plenty of taxis available, and alcoholic beverages were incredibly expensive, but it's the same story anywhere in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Alitravel17
Reviews.Content: Following the recent reviews on Trip Advisor, we were a little nervoius about our stay here. However we shouldn't have worried. We were welcomed, and advised our room was not yet available and were invited to go for lunch whilst the room was made ready. We were upgraded from B&B to HB free of charge, and then very unexpectantly to a suite from a three bedded family tower room. I h The suite was tremendous! I had e mailed the hotel earlier asking for a quiet room, and this was. ( It may have been that we were lucky to miss a disco night!) We had 2 great nights at the Habtoor, excellent staff attention in the restuarant, reception, concierge, house keeping, pool area etc, could not be faulted. Good choice of food in the main restuarant for lunch, dinner and at breakfast. Good choice of bars and restuarants throughout the site. Food and drinkis not cheap, but of good quality. Nowhere in Dubai is cheap! We really liked the division of areas e.g. pool area, grassy area with sun beds etc and the beach. There is still a lot of work going on around but nothing obtrusive and if you know that before you go then it shouldn't be a problem, everywhere in Dubai there is ongoing works. The only negative would be the lack of free Wi Fi in public areas which this day and age should be a must for a 5 star hotel. We enjoyed a trip on the Big Bus (catch a minibus from the Royal Meridien) for about £35 per person all day around the sights and sounds of Dubai, well worth it. They run shuttle buses to the main malls from the hotel, and The Walk is approx 15mins walk away with masses of restuarants and shops. Plenty of taxis available outside, and the nearest metro is only 15mins walk away if you want to get around by that. If travelling to Dubai you must take a trip up the Bur Kalifa fantastic views and great experience. All in all a great holiday, would recommend the Habtoor Grand as a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Only stay here if you are hard of hearing!”
Reviews.Author: MrsCox2010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is good but not great and certainly not 'grand'. Be wary of other reviews that state otherwise! It's very popular with the Russians that can be quite loud. The rooms are large and clean but the decor is a little dated. They offer a varied breakfast selection including pickled turnips! Obviously for the many Russian guests. The pool/garden areas are not well maintained and the pool/bar staff are not as attentive as one would expect in a 5 star hotel. What the hotel doesn't tell you is that 4 nights out of 7 there are 'parties' on the third floor outdoor terrace (in between the 2 towers). The music plays full blast until at least 2am, it was so loud it could have been in the room next door and we were on the 12th floor! Their beach facilities are disappointing and there are extensive building works on the beach and in the plot adjacent. In short, we'd recommend spending a little extra and staying at the Royal Meridian next door, it's beautiful with superb service.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel with an excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: Temitope186338
Reviews.Content: Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa is a hotel with an ecellent customer service. Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa has got the best pools, gym and beach. Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa is a 5 star hotel that has got a 7 star hotel facilities. Neat environment, nice staff with excellent cutomer service skills, beautiful and healthy foods. Looking forward to visiting again with not just my husband but with the whole family ! Mrs Temitope Akintunde. Btec Hospitality and Catering Teacher in London UK

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: azimtop
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel with very friendly staff, clean and very respectful. Excellent location. In my next visit to Dubai, Habtoor Grand will be surely my choice. My Special thanks to the Habtoor team that made my stay very comfortable. Azim

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel in an amazing location”
Reviews.Author: 77MU77
Reviews.Content: Just come back from our first trip to Dubai and we will definatley be staying at the Habtoor Grand again when we return. The hotel is in a brilliant location, is clean with very helpful staff. The hotel has everything you could ask for and more, including a beautiful beach and lovely swimming pool. There are always plenty of (cheap) taxis at reception and it is within 15 minutes of all the main attractions, as well as only a 5 minute walk from the marina. Thank you to all at the hotel and we look forward to staying with you again soon.

Reviews.Title: “The service could not be better with staff friendly and helpful.”
Reviews.Author: eddy32
Reviews.Content: The building work on the beach seemed fairly low key and did not spoil enjoyment of the beach. Explore all the restaurants at the hotel, the Salamar, and Bonsai were particularly good.Cabs are cheap and plentiful and this is a good location to explore other areas of Dubai. All in all a great holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable short stay”
Reviews.Author: wurzellttw-1307
Reviews.Content: We arrived about 8am and could not access rooms until 2pm. During the course of that waiting time our accommodation was upgraded to a suite and meals upgraded from bed and breakfast to half board. So we were well pleased. We found staff to be pleasant , food plenty of choice and rooms clean with daily renewed bathing products. We were not dfisturbed by any noises whatsover from night club or otherwise, Pool area was clean with attentive staff and comfy beds. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would recommend to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Rather dated & disappointing”
Reviews.Author: vacianaga
Reviews.Content: Family tower rooms are large, confortable for family of 4. Breakfast buffet very poor, caotic, full of noisy Russians. Pool side too busy and not cleaned often enough. All rather dated. Wouldn't return & wouldn't recommend to friends.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel definitely deserves grand in its name”
Reviews.Author: Julie8889
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed during one of the busiest periods - over the valentines day weekend, however the experience we had was incredibly efficient and outstanding. We arrived at Habtoor Grand at 9am, at reception we were greeted with fresh orange and watermelon juice and were told unfortunately they were unable to allocate us a room until 2pm - this was expected since that was the normal check-in time. At around 1pm we were allocated our room, on the 4th floor a tower room with sea view. It wasn't a high floor but the view we had was amazingly breathtaking. One window we had a view of the sea and the other was of the infinity pool. Our room was located near the Horizon bar, which at times had loud club music playing until 2am, it didn't bother us but for others it may have. Breakfast was served between 6:30am to 10:30am, as it was peak season we were smart enough to realise the later you go, the more likely you would end up waiting so we regularly ate at 8:30am. There was no queue and plenty of space. The food was a slight disappointment, the fruit was just watermelon at times and the range for the cooked breakfast was limited, however the range of bread and pastry were endless. The pool and beach was beautiful, at times it was busy but it was never impossible to find a sun lounger even at peak times. The pool bar staff were friendly and regularly checked to see if we required drinks or food. Even the lifeguards were friendly, acknowledging and greeting us all the time. On one day of my holiday I was taken ill, and once requesting to see a hotel nurse, the nurse arrived at my room within 20minutes. The hotel staff even wrote a get well card and left plenty of juice for my speedy recovery. The hotel staff were all incredibly friendly and helpful, always greeting us when we passed in corridors and offering assistance. The tours operator always gave us his honest advice on which tours were definitely worth going on, and would make the conscientious effort to catch-up with us afterwards to ensure we fully enjoyed ourselves. The service and comfort of the hotel made our experience the best holiday abroad so far, and we would not hesitate to go back. I am extremely thankful to all the hotel staff for making us feel so welcome and making our stay so luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RichardTracy
Reviews.Content: My wife took me to the Habtoor for a week for a surprise 50th birthday, we could not fault it at all, the staff were excellent as was the food.Having been in the cleaning industry for 20 years I am very critical of standards, however, I could not speak higher of the cleanliness of all areas.The only stumbling block we came across was the price of beers and wine (horrific) but this is the same throughout Dubai. I am not one to write chapters on hotels and resorts, all I will say is try it for yourself you will not be dissappointed

Reviews.Title: “A super hotel”
Reviews.Author: Skovmarken
Reviews.Content: Clean and very service friendly hotel. Everything ok . Super quality rooms. There can be a little noise from the disco outside.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olga071
Reviews.Content: We just got back from the short break, have to say my friend and i were disappointed with the stay. This is not a 5 *Hotel, i would say 3+. Few things to know: the main swimming pool is small with a lot of people around, on the beach they are building a Bar so we could not stay there as it was dusty and noisy. In the morning we had to queue up to be seated for breakfast. Restaurant simply is too small to accommodate all the guests . Furniture looks old and scratched .Food was 7 out 10. We got an upgrade to a sea view room, as the original one was overlooking the noisy Bar.Rooms are nice. Next door Le Meridian looks fantastic, if we knew we would stay there. We did nor feel welcomed , there is no atmosphere in that place.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay without any problems”
Reviews.Author: melstravels2011
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3am and were checked in quickly and upgraded to a suite with great views over the Palm and down towards The Burj Al Arab.We ordered drinks on room service that were delivered within minutes. If you have breakfast before 8am there is never a problem queueing and the chefs have time to cook you poached or soft boiled eggs to your liking. We ate at both the Grand Grill and the Salamar restaurants in each case the food was excellent.The food at the Underground Pub can't be faulted and the Polo Bar is a lovely bar to take a quiet drink. We were not troubled by any noise although because of the stormy weather we didn't know if the night club at the Horizon Pool was open during our stay. The hotel is kept spotlessly clean and we were always welcomed with a smile in whatever part of the hotel we went .We look forward to returning later on this year.

Reviews.Title: “Food & location excellent”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetters50s
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Habtoor for 6 nights and thoroughly enjoyed every minute. From check-in to check-out could not fault service in anyway. We were upgraded to half board which we were really pleased with. The food was really enjoyable. The only thing I can complain about was that at breakfast your drinks were included but at dinner you had to pay for water which was 15 dhms for a small bottle. After first night of having water we decided to do without. All the staff were very polite & helpful. The hotel is only a short walk to many restaurants & shops just by the beach area & on certain days there is a market . Yes the hotel is near some construction work but surely everyone knows that Dubai has still ongoing work to be done. This didn't bother us at all day or night. Tuesday night is ladies night at the Horizon bar & there is loud music but we still got to sleep with no problem. The alcohol is expensive but you know that before you travel so you either pay it or do without which is what we did. One thing that we really thought was a lovely was the turndown service every evening with a chocolate on the bed, such a nice touch. If we do decide to visit Dubai again we wouldn't hesitate to book this hotel. We celebrated our wedding anniversary & in our room was a bottle of wine with some fruit, such a nice thing to do. We did read Trip Advisor before we went & were wondering if we had booked the right hotel as many people had had bad experiences. But as soon as we arrived we knew it was the best decision we had made.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: jansinger1
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Feb. 6 to stay for 3 nights. The booked Tower Room in the 12th floor was nice and we enyoed the view. The next morning we had to QUE at the Breakfast restaurant FOR 15 MINUTES !!! Only excuse was: fully booked. In the restaurant I complained several times about the loud and nasty music. The restaurant manager defended it with customer requests but didnot answer the question WHO demanded it. Finally music was reduced. The food in the Breakfastrestaurant was average and badly organised, the Black Tea in was yucky old and you have to ask for fresh tea. After a massive complaint we were upgraded for breakfast to a quiet Clubrestaurant. We were NOT informed that EVERY TUESDAY is poolparty at the HORIZONT Pool - with extremely loud Tecnomusic (or similar). We left the hotel for a meeting and complained when we left. After the return at midnight we had to moove for the last hours of our stay to a suite to the road and opposite of constructin sites with nghtwork. Loud music at the "normal" pool kept us away from the poolbar and Italien Restaurant, roomkeys had technical problems, and always the EXCUSE - FULLY BOOKED. Positive was the Birthdayscake my wife received unexpectedly. In our opinion it is the WORST 5*Hotel WE´VE BEEN TO.

Reviews.Title: “most horrible 5* Experience ever: rude/racist staff at reception, expensive with no benefits, crowded, noisy at night”
Reviews.Author: ktaneja
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Dubai last week and stayed at Habtoor Grand for 3 nights between 31st Jan – 3rd Feb and had the most horrible 5* experience ever. Started from the check-in where I was treated with disrespect by the night shift staff. I would go to the extent of calling the staff racist as I saw him treating another couple who were in line before me with quite respect. Although while booking the room I made a reservation for tower room, I was provided with a room on 4th floor. I requested the staff to look for something on higher floors as I knew that 4th floor would be noisy, however my request was denied by an excuse of “hotel fully booked”. Not much to my surprise the room was bang opposite to the open club by the pool side called “HORIZON” which played loud music till 3 am. The room was small, dim, noisy with no balcony. In addition I was never asked about smoking or non-smoking and was given a smokers room where I’am a non-smoker. The lobby was crowded during day and night with drunk people all around. Room service was ok and the food was ok too. I would never go back to this hotel and recommend the readers to look for alternate options as Dubai Marina is filled with better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but...”
Reviews.Author: MysticShopper
Reviews.Content: I will only mention the VERY BAD things as the remaining was very good: 1. Internet is chargable. It is terrible than in 5* luxury hotel Internet is not free even at lobby. Come on guys it is 21st century now, Internet should be FREE. 2. Incase if you lunch or dinner is included in teh fee, you should still pay for the juice or even bottle of water. 3. Jacuzzi in tha main pool was not very clean Improve this to have more returning visitors...

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL BUT TERRIBLE NOISE AND LOTS OF DRUNKS!”
Reviews.Author: JONATHANMCA
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were impressed by the hotel surroundings. The room was fabulous and the service of the staff was very good. We were very disappointed when we went for a walk after dinner to find a number of people were intoxicated and using foul language just at the bottom of the stairs leading outside to the pool area. One drunk man cursed and swore at my wife to speak English. We are both from the UK but he must have assumed we were not! When we went to the bedroom we were not able to sleep until about 2 am due to the noise from the bar area outside (we were on the 7th floor!). In the morning, at breakfast, we met an Irish couple who were also having problems with the noise and the drunk people as well as the disoranisation at the breakfast when more than one couple were being shown to the same table. Nightmare and waste of money!

Reviews.Title: “I Like a party but.....”
Reviews.Author: pso007
Reviews.Content: Why don't they at least warn you it will be like trying to sleep in a nightclub until an unspecified late time? I asked 4 times and each time they said 'it will stop in ten minutes sir'. That, frankly, is a disgrace I just politely asked when the party would stop and I can get some sleep as I needed to be awake for work very early. This hotel cares more about making money from non-resident party-goers than than their won guests. When I went to reception at 1am to politely ask when the music stops a 'clubber' pushed me out of the way and started to shout at the receptionist, then a female friend of his decided to go behind reception and patronise me. I asked if she worked at the hotel and her boyfriend then tried to start a fight with me. The hotels response was to usher them through to the Horizon bar to carry on their party....while they continued to lie to me that the music would stop at 1am. I have had 4 hours sleep since I got to this hotel. If you want an honest respectful and relaxing stay DO NOT come here!

Reviews.Title: “Awful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: jeanadam
Reviews.Content: We were in Dubai for a few days just after New Year to take some family time. We only stayed 1 night at the Habtoor as we were so unhappy about everything. First, I don't remember having been in such a crowdy hotel! people everywhere hanging in the lobby in swim suits or even just outside groups of people smoking. The only night we stayed there was so noisy that we didn't sleep, we were put in a room next to which the staff was coming and going with trolleys all night long! Horrible! Then another surprise was Breakfast as we had to queue for 20 min before been assigned a table in a ugly, noisy huge hall, and dirty (food on the floor!), full of people who were pushing each other . After that, my husband went to the pool to get us some seats but everything was full! We decide not to stay there one more minute, we packed everything, paid the bill and got out of this mess, luckily enough at this time of the year to find another nice place where we had 4 perfect days in Dubai for the same budget! This hotel really looks like being in a low range Russian Tour Operator program!

Reviews.Title: “Proceed with caution - pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: ItalySap
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my spouse. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I believe they tried and handled unfortunate circumstances with class... but... We originally were put in room 0504 (or 504). I don't believe all of the rooms were like this. We were transferred to room 530 on the last night which made all the difference. In room 504, there were rather large stains on the sofa and chair plus the shower did not have a drain (or it was not working properly) so the water would flood the restroom floor. Foolishly, we put up with this and did not complain which is our fault. Until... the last night's stay was "Ladies Night" at the pool bar which was right outside our window. A deejay was BLARING music that was to continue until after midnight. This is when I called to complain to move to another room and they were very accomodating. My largest complaint was that the noise was not coming from an offsite club that they had no control over, they allow this party to go on disrupting the guests on that side of the hotel. I was surprised they allowed that to happen. The other complaint is the location seemed far away from the attractions however, cab rides aren't TOO expensive if you really wanted to stay there. The breakfast buffet was great that was included with the room. There was also a lunch charged to our room that was not us. When I complained, reception removed the charge immediately. Again, hate to give a bad review because they tried to be accomodating considering. Also, had we originally stayed in a different room, our take would have been different. So, just proceed with caution.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible hotel - not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: chris2222
Reviews.Content: As frequent travellers to Dubai, we decided to stay for 8 days at Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa, and had the worst experience we have had with a hotel ever. The service at the hotel is atrocious. Already at check-in we were treated with indifference. When I pointed out that this was not what I normally experienced at 5 star hotels, the check-in Manager commented: "we are not a 5 star hotel - but we have 5 star facilities". Is there really more to say? The hotel does have a nice pool and beach area with the staff in these areas being fully up to what you would expect in a hotel like this. The rest however: Rooms - 3-star standard and there is an open air night-club that plays EXTREMELY LOUD music until about 3 in the morning. This can be heard from all rooms as the club is located right in the middle of the hotel. Breakfast - massive crowds of people fighting to get fed and the staff has no chance of keeping up. Expect to stand in long lines and wait for looong periods of time before getting coffee or tea. All other services – expect to be treated like you are truly inconveniencing everyone there. If you have to stay in Dubai my honest recommendation to you is to do all to avoid the Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “ok. but!”
Reviews.Author: bat66
Reviews.Content: postiv: - nice garden, v good restaurants - tower rooms are nice, but they could need some more care - very good massage treatments but (see below) negativ: - very loud in the rooms, due to parties in horizon club - breakfast room is far to small, very hectic, not enough space, very loud, waiting time to get a seat of 20minutes - massage treatments, only one person availble, always fully booked - pool area very loud music - ATTENTION: at the moment constructions going on at the beach - this is nowhere mentioned on the hotel homepage - loud

Reviews.Title: “Arrogant attitude”
Reviews.Author: Tartam
Reviews.Content: It was our second time in Dubai after 5 years. Our first vacation at One and Only Royal Mirage was so great that our hopes were really high, but...Our sea view rooms were okay even though we didn't get connected rooms as requested, there was a corridor between the rooms. This was okay. What wasn't okay at all was the fact that there was a very loud party with live band just under our windows and we had to stay awake until 2.30 AM the first night because of that.
