We called the reception and complained, but the loud bass sounds just continued. Kids were miserable! The next morning we demanded new rooms and were given rooms without sea view from the resort. We accepted them even when they were old and in much worse condition than the newer tower rooms. We just had to get sleep, vacation without rest is a nightmare. The most depressing experience about the room change was the fact that the hotel asked us to sign a paper indicating that we don't have any claims for reimbursement, since the new rooms were cheaper, but we had asked for the change ourselves (!!!). We didn't sign that form even when it was asked for three times so the new rooms were now 100 dirhams cheaper per night as compared to the sea view rooms (being 2000 dirhams/night/room). The biggest disappointment however was the fact that the female hotel manager who gave orders to the person who negotiated the new price with us did not take any contact with us, unhappy customers, who have waited for this one week vacation for months. She just spoke with her employee and seemed annoyed with the fact that we had been complaining. New year's eve celebration included a lot of suffering as well. As a tourist it is almost impossible to leave the hotel at that date because of traffic and it is actually compulsory to buy the dinner package if you stay in the hotel. (Well, we should have joined the party at the nearby Le Royal Meridien that obviously had much nicer party, but we didn't know that). The dinner package was really expensive and even our 16 year old had to pay for the adult price including all the drinks even when he cannot drink alcohol at that age! We selected the Lebanese restaurant and the service was extremely slow, main course was cold and it arrived at 23.45 so in order to see the fire works at the beach we didn't have time for the cold food. The music was extremely loud and due to the loud speakers it was also of very lousy quality. There was another restaurant nearby and they had different music so we had to listen to both. Our 11 year old was really suffering, because we couldn't even hear each other over the table without shouting really loud. And then the fire works at the beach...we didn't get there in time, because there was only one admission point to the beach and the restaurant didn't give us the wristbands so that we could have enetered and we didn't have time to go back to get them. What a miserable new year's eve! At times our vacation was a lot of fun (f.ex. the massage therapist at the spa was really good!), but we will never ever go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time Lucky - Never again!!”
Reviews.Author: Boatboy01628
Reviews.Content: This is the 3rd time we have stayed at the Habtoor Grand and we are afraid that in the last 12months the hotel has changed its priorities vastley. We all go on Holiday to rest and relax. But when the DJ in the Horizon Pool bar area starts then the hotel does not sleep, well not at least before 3am. As you try to sleep the whole tower reverberates to the Boom Boom base sounds of the music. At one point the music was so loud we thought the DJ was actually in our room. This happens a min of 3 nights a week. When questioned we were informed by a senior manager that the hotels loyalties lay equally with residence and non paying members of the public who are offered free drinks to entice them in. It would appear that the Horizon Pool Bar/Disco is one of at least 3 franchises and therefore not controlled by the Hotel. And as a result very little could be done to resolve the situation. The Hotel owners Son is the franchisee.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation”
Reviews.Author: fyfnjkbq
Reviews.Content: Sorry for my bad English....I write from Moscow ( Russia). And I hope my review help yoy to choose the hotel in UAE. My family and I stood in Habtoor this november and we were satisfied with service, locatoin fnd feeding. Our ferst visit to this hotel was in 1995, when it named Metropolitan beach and now it become only better.We lived in family room in tower ( 15th flower) and the view from the windows was unexpected - real megapolis near the beach with white sand. In 2009 we stood in Al Qasr, wish prise is more bigger, but we didnt find big difference. The location of Habtoor near the the metro station gives its much comfortable. If the hotel will build one more pool which will situated closer to beach and some beach bar near sun beds on the beach and free WI-FI - it will be more excellent for thier guests. In rest it is beautifull! I will recomend this hotel to all my turists from Moscow, as i am the director of travel agency. And i hope that my clients will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “...take your ear plugs...but even they aren't enough”
Reviews.Author: Steve510
Reviews.Content: This is a good hotel with many facilities worthy of praising. The pool area and gardens running down to a private beach are excellent and it has a superb steak restaurant (the Grill) well worth the trip if you're not staying at the hotel. With the exception of the indifferent reception staff the service is overall is very good. It is expensive but there again Dubai is so don't go if you're on a budget. I have 2 main complaints/issues. On arrival the reception staff were indifferent and unwelcoming. I had booked a club room with all the free amenities but this was flatly denied and it took nearly 2 hours to get this resolved with the booking agent before they admitted I was correct. Mistakes happen but their attitude was unacceptable and let the whole hotel staff down who were attentive and pleasant. However, the biggest failing is the Horizon bar. This is common with other reviews and I would strongly recommend that you take heed. For 3 nights of my 6 night stay the noise from the outside nightclub (which is placed between the 2 towers for maximum disruption) was truly deafening. It was so loud that you couldn't hear your TV, ear plugs were ineffectual and this went on to 2am and beyond for 3 of the nights. Bear in mind I was on the 12th floor with double-glazed windows and maybe this will give you some idea of how loud this was. Complaints were ignored and frankly it ruined the holiday. Bear in mind the hotel website is wrong and states the bar is open to midnight. This is wrong, it is 2am every night. Some nights the music is low enough not to disturb but on theme nights it is beyond comprehension. Despite all its' plus points I would strongly recommend everyone avoids this hotel for this one reason.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely return - excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmel021
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner just returned from a week long stay in the habtoor hotel, dubai. The hotel was great, staff so friendly and willing to do anything to make your stay more enjoyable. The rooms were cleaned daily with a turn down service each night. The beach and pool were fab. Spa was excellent. Great choice for breakfast each morning. We didn't really spend much time in the bars in the hotel but the rooftop bar on level 3 was really lively. The underground bar wasn't realy our scene but at the same time it was nice to have drink there at the end of the night. Thanks a million to everyone in the hotel for making our stay so enjoyable!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, superb, can't fault this hotel”
Reviews.Author: jestereccles
Reviews.Content: Had a superb 5 night stay at the Habtoor, everything was 5* as hoped. The staff couldn't be more helpful, everything inside and outside was spotless. Would recommend to everyone, we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “4* plus but not quite 5*”
Reviews.Author: Gavinconn
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel in good location on the beach and near the Walk. Exceptionally clean hotel with great facilities - including superb gym, excellent spa and lovely outdoor pool. Our room (tower room with sea view on 6th floor) was comfortable - reasonable size, attractive decor and very clean (cleaned twice each day). Great view over the marina, sea and beach. Service was generally good with the majority of the staff being polite and helpful. Close to some of the other 5* beach hotels in case you want to try other restaurants and bars. We were half board and so went to the buffet restaurant most nights. Quality of food was good (but nothing special) with wide selection. There are other restaurants in the hotel and I would particularly recommend the Thai restaurant. Bars - we spent several nights at both the Horizon Lounge bar and Bartini. Drinks in Bartini are expensive but staff are very friendly and the cocktails are great! As mentioned in several of the reviews, the music from the Horizon bar is very loud and does go on till 2am most evenings. They had a party night on both our first and last evenings which had a live DJ and were attended predominantly by the rich locals - worth experiencing to get a sense of the brash millionaire's playground that is Dubai. Unless your room is very high up in the towers then you will definitely hear this music. This didn't bother my brother and I, but it is definitely worth bearing in mind if you want a quiet hotel. Overall I'd recommend this hotel - good location, clean, excellent facilities - but it lacks the wow factor of some of the other 5* hotels which are more stylish. Plus, if you want to guarantee a good night's sleep bear in mind my comment on the noise level!

Reviews.Title: “Well we certainly won't be going back”
Reviews.Author: Mawgroup
Reviews.Content: Having just landed back on the 18th Nov after a 9 night stay I can say with certainty that we will not be returning. The Habtoor is no way a 5 star hotel and if you compare it to the other hotels round it (which we did) then you realise it should be knocked down and re-built. All the previous comments regarding noise levels are true. We had a room on the 22nd floor and could still hear the music. If we went in one of the bars I would say perhaps 50% of the time we were made to feel like we were intruding so for 5 or six nights we went out and drank in other hotels nearby. It's only my opinion but I think the hotel is more interested in locals or Arabian people. As holidaying westerners we were given the cold shoulder. We experienced nothing like this in the other hotels. The food quality was excellent (but very similar every day) and the hotel location is great, but these are the only good things I can think of. The day after returning I received an e-mail from guest relations hoping I had had a good stay and inviting me to comment on Tripadvisor. I think they should be getting reviews back to them where someone can be put in charge of doing something about it. I see this as another sign that no one is really bothered. Walk in the Meridian next door and you get the wow factor.Walk back in the Habtoor and you feel disappointment. That's the difference. With the prices they charge, and the competition round it together with it's location the Habtoor needs to take a long hard look at itself. For the record this was our 4th time in Dubai and we love the place and we will certainly be going back but not to the Habtoor. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful and enjoyable stay.”
Reviews.Author: AmbiR
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews here before departing i must admit i was a bit worried as to what to expect. Having stayed at the Atlantis last year i worried as to how 'tired' this hotel really was. I travelled with my mum and two young children ( 1yr & 3yr) and stayed at Habtoor for 5 nights on half board basis. We stayed in a tower room which was spacious enough for the kids to run around in and thats with having a cot in the room. Two bottles of mineral water were daily placed into our room complimentry along with a fruit platter. The staff were all fantastic and attentive in every respect. The staff were extremely good with the kids especially Savio who we saw regularly at breakfast and dinner. All staff we came across were more than willing to help with bags, buggy etc. The hotel itself is comfortable and what makes it extra special is that you get the personal attention which you most definately don't get in bigger hotels such as the Atlantis. The kids were welcomed by staff in hallways, lounge, swimming pool area etc by their name which i thought was really nice. The beach is a little walk away but there are plenty of loungers along the way that you can rest upon if needed. I had a twin buggy and it could have been very tricky getting to the beach had the staff not been there to assist in carrying it up and down stairs for us. If you fancy a stroll to 'The Walk' its a 10mins walk from the hotel. In fact its probably less than that as thats how long it took us with a double buggy. The only negative point i would like to point out is that there is an open air 'club' that has music blasting into the early hours of the morning EVERY NIGHT!! This was a real nuisance and i really do think that the hotel should consider limiting this to a few nights a week as it caused us real disturbance. I has requested prior to us going to the hotel that we were put in a room that was not affected by this noise as we had 2 small kids with us. I am sure had we complained the hotel would have moved us ut we didn't want the hassel of wasting time moving to another room. Overall we had a lovely time at the hotel and thank habtoor staff for their hard work and great hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “A truly fantastic, once in a lifetime, experience”
Reviews.Author: nicksta2
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived back from Dubai, having spent 4 nights at the Habtoor Grand. The trip was a surprise from my Husband for my 40 Birthday - our first 'luxury' trip away since we had our children. Having looked at the reviews on Trip Advisor before we left, I was a little dubious about some of the negative comments - but each and every one has proved to be totally unfounded - we had a fabulous time. Arrived early at the hotel (7 am) and were told our room would not be ready until 2:00 pm. However, Concierge could not have been more helpful in taking in bags, providing somewhere for us to change. etc. We were able to use all the hotel facilities and were quite happy to crash out around pool until check in. On checking in, we were informed that we would be immediately upgraded from our bed and breakfast package to half board, which we could take as lunch or dinner in the buffet restaurant. Due to the high prices in Dubai - the Habtoor was on par with all the hotels we visited - this proved to be a Godsend. Over the 5 days we had breakfast, lunch and dinner in the buffet restaurant at some point and were not disappointed on any occasion. There was always a vast selection to choose from, always cooked well and plenty of it - there was certainly something to satisfy any palate. Having checked in our room, a tower room with sea view, was clean, well decorated and suited all our needs - we had to wrestle with the Concierge to stop him trying to unpack for us! All the staff within the hotel and grounds were very attentive throughout our stay - and perfectly happy to cater to our every whim. We had a bit of a mishap on the first night when on arriving back to our room we found the shower door had somehow smashed all over the bathroom. We called security and were immediately upgraded again and moved to a tower suite on the 23 floor - this room was something else again !!! Contrary to what i read on here before we went, the room was serviced 3 - yes 3 - times a day with water replaced whenever they came in. We received fruit, always had our bed turned down, chocolates left and curtains drawn and room thoroughly cleaned and tidied. I received cakes, balloons and cards in the room for my Birthday and another night they left us orange juice (it was Eid and no alcohol was being served), baklava and dates. The pool was fantastic - yes they did play Radio 1 but I personally like a bit of music round the pool and it wasnt intrusive. The beach area is to die for and all the bars and restaurants we visited within the hotel were friendly and inviting. Special mention to the bar man in the Underground Pub who kept us entertained with this 'can trick' and we have a special place in our hearts for the Horizon Bar - which is possibly the coolest bar we have ever been to! Congrats Habtoor for getting it so right - we had a whale of a time and hope to save enough pennies to come back one day!!!

Reviews.Title: “Unless you plan to party till late, do not stay on low floor facing the Horizon Lounge”
Reviews.Author: HkNoodleboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Habtoor Grand for 3 nights (11-13 Nov 2010). Ours was a Tower Room on the 4th floor in the shorter tower, and it overlooked the Horizon Lounge on the 3rd floor podium. Hence, we experienced the sleep-depriving, booming dance music that other TA contributors had written about, on the first two nights that we were there, a Thursday and Friday. The music ended only at around 2am. When we called to complain, we were quickly offered a room change, but we were in no mood to change rooms at 11pm and we could not be certain if any new room that they can offer us will offer a respite from the noise. I just cannot imagine how a self-respecting hotel management can turn a blind eye to such a blatant and inexcusable lapse in service. The offer of a room change was no mitigation at all. It's like being offered steak after being knowingly served bad fish. The music was loud and unless you were not planning to sleep before 2am, anyone would have found it disturbing. Having said that, the room and common areas of the hotel were clean and the staff polite and helpful. But I would strike off two out of the five stars that the hotel claims for the noise which no reputable hotel should inflict on its guests.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, lots of staff, no grumbles”
Reviews.Author: Isaac9990
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as a stop gap between Mauritius and Maldives. We stayed for 2 nights and did not do too much but this is what I can comment on. The hotel was lovely and reception area nice and big. We asked for an upgrade and we got it. The room was so nice even compared to Mauritius! We could see a habour out our room and also the expensice arch saped hotel - whch at night is not lit up??? It was very very hot! I wanted to cry one evening we walked out for grab food. You come out the hotel, turn right and follow the road and do another right - this leads you onto a promanarde. We went to a Mexican and the food was good. We ate buffet breakfast in the hotel which was also good. There is a free shutle bus which takes you to malls and picks you up. We enjoyed the emirates the best. It has an amazing aqaurim. We did not hold hands in public and I always covered up. I did not get any problems but then I was respectful. You will see alot of women completly covered so imagine how hot they are! We went to a back street market where yes we did get hassled but I also got a fake but leather jimmy cho, for about £45. There was an American ady in there and she spent about $1500 so I knew it was good quality! A hidden gem! We did not go down to the beach, only made it to the pool. Don't bother going in to cool down but for a bath! We paid £9 for two cans of coke at the pool! Overall very plensant

Reviews.Title: “Beach, swimming pool and spa”
Reviews.Author: SanderAukema
Reviews.Content: We stayed her three nights. The hotel has a unique combination of beach and swimming pool. You can choose for a resort room or a tower room. The resort rooms are ideal when you gave children who sleep during the day. Points of concern: little airfield besides the resort for parachuting, terrain isn't good accessible for rolling material like wheel chairs and buggies.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: baglanjeff
Reviews.Content: one of the best hotels we have stayed.staff were good room was very nice and food was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - But unable to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Byreman
Reviews.Content: The Habtoor is an exceptionally good hotel. The staff are great and overall its very good apart from one small but important feature. On the 3rd Floor there is an open air bar between the two towers. In the daytime its a great haven for a swim and a drink. On Tuesdays, Thursdays and Fridays they have very loud , high bass driven dance music, which starts about 9pm and carries on until 2.30am...... If you are unlucky enough to have a room facing the bar on either tower you simply can't get to sleep until 2.30am at the earliest. As a seasoned traveller, even with earplugs I just could not get to sleep. Fine if you want to party, but if you have to get up and work the next day, then its not great at all. Customer relations told me they get complaints about this every night they party and the owners won't do anything about it as it's a concession, not part of the hotel and it makes big bucks for the owners of the hotel. If you have kids they will hate it as the windows vibrate its so loud. After calling the duty manager he apologised but said he could do nothing abou the noise level. Customer relations offered me a buffet meal in compensation and some fruit....... But as the hotel was full they could not move us. If you do stay there I suggest you specify a room not facing the pool or find somewhere quieter if you need a good nigts sleep. We really liked the hotel, beach, various resteraunts and the staff were very good, but on a business trip you really do at some point need to sleep and when paying five star prices, you really don't want to be limited to 4 hours sleep a night. This happened 3 out of the 5 nights we stayed. Although I liked it, I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: Debs099
Reviews.Content: What can i say, this hotel has to one of the best we have stayed in. Great location on the beach. Rooms are so clean and serviced twice a day. The Underground Pub has fantastic staff including the manager David who made sure we were looked after for the whole of our stay. The Polo Bar the staff again treated us so well. Horizon Bar again nothing too much trouble. The pool area again so clean and staff very friendly. Will be returning in the new year.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly 5 Star but ...”
Reviews.Author: Lou2010037
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 6 night stay at the Habtoor Hotel and overall we had a great Holiday. The weather this time of year is perfect - 35C and sunny everyday and would highly recommend a holiday to Dubai at this time of year. However, we are still undecided if we would return to the Habtoor. The positives: Great facilities - 2 swimming pools (we particularly loved the horizon lounge and pool), tennis courts, gym, lovely private beach( amazing sunset), a great variety of water sports and excursions (would highly recommend the sunset desert Safari - considering how expensive things are in Dubai this was really cheap), 12 different restaurants and bars and an excellent buffet restaurant. We stayed half board and always enjoyed our meals their - with plenty of variety. With half board you can choose each day whether you have lunch or dinner which we thought was great. We also loved to have lunch at the beach bar - really comfy chairs and huge portions. We often would share. This also cut down costs. The service around the pool and in the restaurants was always very good. The rooms were very spacious and the beds are huge and incredibly comfy. We upgraded when we arrived to a tower sea view room and are so pleased we did - lovely views of the palm and atlantis in the distance. Ok the negatives: On the Tues and Thurs of our stay their was a ladies night and another themed night in the horizon lounge. We went along to the ladies night where I had 3 free glasses of champagne and had a great night. Its a great party atmosphere but the booming music and I mean booming goes on until 2am! So basically if your room is near that and most are you literally cant get any sleep. We got back to our room at 11:30 and it genuinely felt like we had music playing in our room. To cut a long story short we asked to change rooms which they happily did but when Thursday night came we had exactly the same experience and the new room wasn't anymore quieter. As a gesture of good will the hotel did refund the room upgrade for the nights we were inconvienienced but after feeling totally relaxed half way through the holiday I ended the holiday feeling shattered as had little sleep on our final night. If you like to sunbath somewhere quiet and peaceful then the main pool in the afternoon really wont be the place for you as again they play pumping music from the pool bar and when im on holiday in Dubai Radio 1 really isn't what I personally would choose to listen to. However, on a positive the beach, grass area and horizon pool are all lovely areas to sunbath and relax. And finally our last little gripe was that the fruit wasn't replaced daily in our room - it was a little hit and miss and our beds were not always turned down in the evening, Which are minor things but expected in a 5 star hotel. As you can see there are so many positives with this hotel and if you were able to get a room high up and away from the horizon lounge then I would prob recommend it as it is one of the more reasonably priced 5 star hotels on Jumeriah beach. If you want total luxury and dont mind paying a bit extra this probably isnt the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Stay inside the club zone”
Reviews.Author: arigatous
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the club room. + Great room with great view + Breakfast on the 25th floor + Personal consierge was really helpful - Balcony was a bit small - Sea could be closer (You can use that golf cars, though. They are free)

Reviews.Title: “How can anyone complain?”
Reviews.Author: nic0904
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Habtoor grand for 5 nights at the end of September with my partner, I was a little apprehensive as i had read some of the reviews and with this being our first holiday away i wanted it to be perfect!! On our arrival we had missed dinner due to arriving late, the receptionist was lovely and offered us Lunch on our last day. Check in was efficient and quick and we were shown to our beautiful Tower room on the 4th floor. Room was spacious and well decorated, the bathroom was outstanding! The view from the room was good although there is some building work going on but this is Dubai and due to the current recession over there bulding work seems to have stopped in a few places. This did not for one minute ruin our stay!!! Maid service was great!! as too was night time turn down service. Only one little note is that the mini bar within the room was a little limited.. There should be more selection. The pool was lovely, staff were great and food was really good. Pricey but expected as we knew food and drink within Dubai was quite expensive. There were numerous bars and resturants to choose from within the hotel all decorated to a high standard!! Staff were always on hand and service was exceptional!! Atlantis is a definate must if visiting Dubai.. The waterpark is amazing!!! and the Resturants are fantastic the service is outstanding!!! Desert safari is also a must we absolutely loved this tour..All in all we loved our trip to Dubai and would reccomend this hotel.. :)

Reviews.Title: “Could have stayed in the Conaught London for the same price !”
Reviews.Author: icefiresnow
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very expensive and the room noisey. Music and traffic interrupted. Have stayed here 3-4 times before because of beach. But that is now also very noisey because of heliport and airport next to it. Booked the room on my way back from Pakistan, then realised my client had a corporate rate. But hotel would not put me onto the corporate rate. (Client still picked up the bill) No fruit in the room either ! This was £1k for 3 nights. When the hotel has only 20% occupancey and most of them are Russian tourists, not paying this rate, then the hotel needs to look at price and demand. Breakfast and buffet food - just rubbish. Hotel should offer business deals for 2-3 days to capture stopover demand.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5*”
Reviews.Author: OZDUBIA
Reviews.Content: Staff friendly and helpful. Most public areas are good however pool area is a little bit shabby and childrens play area has no shade covering i.e. slide and swing type thing became red hot so my 23 month old couldn't use slide without burning her bot! - You try explaining that to a 23 month old! Food was good . Room a bit shabby and cot in room was a scruffy travel cot so not ideal. Overall served its purpose as 3 day stop over in way back from Oz, hotel is ok but definately wouldn't rate as 5*. One other tip - walking to marina is like strolling through a building site but I am sure it will be very nice when its finished ;- ) I'm ticking not to recommend however I guess it depends on if you get a bargain rate when booking its not bad!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel shame about late night music”
Reviews.Author: liam4330
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a relaxation holiday so we chose the Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa during the hotel met all our needs with is perfect private beach, pool, infinity pool and good service! Unfortunately 3 nights out of our 5 night stay we were kept awake by loud dance music. I don't find that sort of music offensive but being kept awake whilst having a relaxation holiday wasn't great!! If you stay here make sure you avoid the hotel taxis unless you haggle a price before travel! The hotel is perfectly located for the Walk at JBR and Dubai Marina Metro station is a bout a 10 min walk.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: n4smichael
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Habtoor Grand for 3 nights at the start of October 2010. We initially were allocated a resort room that backed on to a service laneway. This would have been problematic generally however with a 9-month old baby this was worse as noise prevented her from sleeping properly. The manager on duty (Johan) was fantastic. He immediately offered to change our rooms. The process took a bit longer than we would have hoped for however all in all the change of room was much better. With regards to the facilities, the hotel has nice well appointed rooms, a good mix of restaurants, great breakfasts, a really nice pool and very good service. The downsides are not many but include outdated bathrooms and the fact that there is a small airport directly adjacent where skydiving planes take off from time to time. This was annoying because of the noise and smell of jet fuel when at the beach.

Reviews.Title: “grand hotel”
Reviews.Author: boabAyrshire
Reviews.Content: stated at hotel on 1st october for 5 nights b&b,was a surprise for my wives 60th birthday when checking in we were given an upgrade to sea view with balcony and on last day hotel and staff had placed birthday cards,cake,and balloons in room for my wife which was a nice touch,hotel was excellant staff were helpfull and friendly,breakfast had great choice,also 10 mins from shops and resturants,also free shuttle bus frem hotel to malls,we would stay at this hotel again and recommend to anyone,building work going on in the area but you hardly heard it .good pool, and beach area was spotless,you were also supplied with beach towels.

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: FelixP3
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel with a nice dose of nightlife too!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: taylor23
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel in a club suite. The hotel staff were extreemly helpful and friendly and offered an excellent service. The Club lounge staff were very attentive and accomodating. The pool area and beach were clean and tidy with plenty of sun loungers. The facilities were first class, The only downside was that some of the guests were loud,rude and seemed to take up much of the staffs time and attention. I will definately return to this hotel for a sunny break.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Hotel in Top beach location”
Reviews.Author: harrissafety
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Habtoor for 2 nights whilst on business, the room was one of the best I have stayed in for many years This is a true 5 start hotel and I would recommend it it to anyone either on business or pleasure. PS: only paid Dh700 a night, but I would have happily paid double.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star for Dubai”
Reviews.Author: nuttynag
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Habtoor for 5 nights on a half board basis with my family during September. We were a little unsure of what to expect when we arrived as some of the reviews of the Habtoor had not been great. We arrived in Dubai early in the morning and were lucky enough to be able to check into our rooms early, however we were told that if we wanted any breakfast at the hotel we would need to pay for it. We stayed in the tower rooms which were a good size, comfortable and clean. We were provided with 2 small bottles of water every day and a fresh fruit platter. There had been previous reviews about the noise from the night club and I have to agree that you can here it when it is open as it is basically a tent on the 3rd floor of the hotel. The pool area is a little tired but had plenty of loungers. Staff around the pool friendly. Beach very quiet and clean. My only negative comment about this hotel would be the food. On the half board basis you are only entitled to eat in the main restaurant. There was plenty of choice at breakfast but the choice for the evening meal was pretty poor. The starters, mains and the desserts were mostly the same day after day but the quality was good. We ended up eating out a few times. The Habtoor is situated in a good location near the marina. I have visited Dubai several times before and I would not rate it as a 5 star hotel for Dubai. I would stay here again on room and breakfast if it was reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “NEARLY ....... BUT”
Reviews.Author: Emmajane78
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd dtay in Dubai and 1st at this hotel and don't get me wrong we had a fabulous hoiliday but the hotel was just a bit lacking although nothing serious to worry about, if you are booked you'll still have a great time, these are just points management need to think about. The rooms need a lick of paint, they are clean but not 5* standard, the reception staff need a customer care course (it doesn't cost a lot to say please, thank you and sorry!), the pool service needs to be more attentive (why do you have to ask all the time?) and the air conditioning is fierce (girls take a cardigan!). Good points are the Underground Pub, anyone wanting football matches and great service needs to go there it is superb. Just watch the prices - Bulmers £11.50 per bottle! Also the half board option was value for money, can't fault the food quality or choice. With all this is mind, this hotel lacks the wow factor therefore can only be 4 star not 5 star although it is significantly cheaper to stay than other hotels in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Convinient and Relaxed”
Reviews.Author: sabmaz
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, reasonably priced. I visited this hotel with my wife and three kids, we used the Family room and it was spaciouse enough to fit us all. I like the hotel and i think it has good value for money. On the negative side, we used the main hotel restuarant for an evening meal, and they guys were really slow. It took them more than one hour to bring in our food, although our oder was really simple (we dont eat heavy meat at night)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value %*+ Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bot the traveller 15
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 5 nights, booked on dinner, bed and breakfast basis. We decided to upgrade to a sea-view room in the towers from our booked garden room. We had a room with a balcony. The £40 (approx) upgrade price was worth every penny. We viewed the garden room first, and found it a bit dark. (Perhaps some thinning out of plants is required). We ate in the buffet restaurant for breakfast and dinner every day. Breakfast was good, and the dinner selection was both good and different every night of our stay. It would be a good idea if those on half-board basis were allowed an alloance against meals in the other restaurants, thus offering more choice and an opportunity to experience some of the 14 restaurants the hotel has. Overall, a very good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: angelaBelfast
Reviews.Content: We would reinforce all the positive reviews we read before travelling, as we had a very good experience at this hotel. All the staff were very friendly, from reception, housekeeping, pool staff and especially those at breakfast, they couldnt have been more helpful. Paticular thanks to Yohan, reception manager who was extemely helpful and very friendly. We would have no hesitation recommending this hotel and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent all round - worth a stay”
Reviews.Author: lightbulbsmcf
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Habtoor Grand for a few nights in in first week of September, overall this is an excellent hotel. Staff are very helpful, rooms are lovely - elegant, large and clean with very comfortable beds (we had a garden room next to the beach), pool is excellent - the upstairs infinity pool is very nice and quiet). We ate in the steak restaurant the first night - food was superb! and not overly expensive. Pool bar is on the pricey side, but what do you expect. Breakfast buffet is excellent, enormous range and you eat overlooking the Marina and Ocean. Check out was slightly slow, but this is common to all hotels I've stayed at. The hotel is right on the beach, fab location - alot of the building work has finished around the hotel so was very quiet whilst i was there. Watersports from the beach are quite reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “We can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: suesand
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel on a 3 night stopover on our way to the UK in June, after discovering it on a previous visit to Dubai when we were staying at another hotel. Every single aspect of the hotel was excellent - the "room" was more like a suite as it had 3 rooms, and the staff were wonderful. We plan to use this hotel on every Dubai stopover from now on, and can't wait to stay there again. The only thing that would have made the experience even better from our point of view, would be a shuttle service by golf card or similar (or at least paved walkway all the way) between the hotel and the water's edge. Absolutely love swimming in the sea there, but ouch, that very hot sand!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent plaqce to stay but bit expensive.”
Reviews.Author: japji
Reviews.Content: very nice and freindly staff, although expensive but good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “A helping hand....why the Habtoor Grand?”
Reviews.Author: MickeyKWinchester
Reviews.Content: Fantastic - is simply the word that sums up our stay at the Habtoor Grand. We arrived during the night, were met promptly with a cool drink and within minutes were taken to our room. We had opted for Tower Sea View room. The room was just as had been advertised, was spacious and airy (no problems with air conditioning as I had read in other reviews - A/C was easy to operate) however, although it appeared very clean, upon closer inspection, to the more OCD person (like me!) it could be labelled as looking a little tired. All staff were approachable and friendly and always more than willing to offer help and advice (even when the more ignorant holiday maker treated them as lesser human beings!! Horrendous I know, but true.) Breakfast was a feast and catered for all tastes. We were always seated promptly and food was always served to the highest standard. Although this hotel is slightly away from the centre of Dubai, taxi's are readily available outside the hotel and very reasonable. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone and we will certainly return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Dubai”
Reviews.Author: robwutangtech
Reviews.Content: Once I had arrived at the hotel - I was greeted by the friendly staff - although I arrived at 12 midday I managed to check in by 1220 - good as I was not meant to check in till 2pm I had a tower sea view room which was great, restaurants were ok but it Ramadan so some facilities were not available - I did have the most wonderful time in the Hush Tent - food was fantastic Facilities were fantastic One comment I would make is when you check in it would great to know what is around the hotel - where the beach is - that there are shops and restaurants on the marina parade - that there are free busses to the malls would be a help

Reviews.Title: “Good value good location very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Sashaboo2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Habtoor Grand on route to Hong Kong.Staff were very helpful, rooms clean a little tired looking but acceptable,rooftop pool a hidden gem fantastic views . Stayed on a b&b basis breakfast very good lots of choice drinks expensive like everywhere in Dubai but good atmosphere in the underground bar. It was my wife's 40th birthday they brought her a cake and card to the room nice touch I thought. I would definitely recommend this hotel .

Reviews.Title: “Our 3rd Trip to Habtoor Grand Resort”
Reviews.Author: deniseaston
Reviews.Content: This was our 3rd trip to the Habroor Grand, we were going to book the Atlantis - as our teenager was coming with us - we felt it would be more appropriate, however, on seeing the virtual tour she wanted the Habtoor. When we stayed in March - we were dissapointed, the hotel seemed a bit tatty, the umbrellas were old etc., the room wasn't great either, however, it seemed much improved. The staff especially around the pool bar are very friendly, as were they in the main restaurant. There was some confusion with our choice of room - I had been very specific about which rooms we wanted, however, this was put right by the Hotel staff. It was Ramadam during our stay - and the fesitivies for this were well thought out. The only negative is really the beach, although clean, the loungers are way up the beach, and they appear to be the same ones from our first trip there 3 years ago, and are showing signs of age - previously there was a regular 'drinks run' on the beach - this was sadly lacking during this trip - despite the weather being 48 degrees and a cold drink would have been very welcome. The food and service in both Lucianao's - Italian restaurant and Munchi - Thai restaurant were as good as you would find anywhere - staff were fantastic!! and food superb. All in all - a great stay - and I would have no hesitation on recommending the hotel to anyone - even when travelling with teenagers!

Reviews.Title: “Some Good Some Poor”
Reviews.Author: harleyfamilyGuernsey
Reviews.Content: We've been going to Dubai for 10 years & have stayed at many hotels along Jumeirah Beach. We've seen the construction work totally transform Dubai over this time but the last time we visted was in 2006 so it was a huge shock this time round to see just how much was still going on. There is a lot of work going on in the area of the hotel & it does take the edge off things when you are entering / leaving / looking out of some windows / walking along the beach so whilst this is not necessarily the hotel's fault, just be prepared for it. We booked somewhat last minute and had limited choice of hotels & given some of the comments on this site, we would have chosen elsewhere if we could have done - to summarise now, in relation to my stay I certainly recognise some of the positive and negative comments here. Firstly, our treatment on arrival was excellent - we arrived at about 0830 & the room was ( understandably) not ready but we were put on a priority list & they promised to get the room ready asap. In the meantime, the receptionist noticed that on our final day, we'd be leaving too early to have breakfast so "transferred" it to our arrival day. As such, by the time we'd gone through check in formalities & had breakfast & a little snooze on the couches in reception, our room was ready & we were in the pool by 11.30. The room was fine & I don't recognise any of the cleaning / decor / room standard issues mentioned in some reviews. Air con was set too high but a quick chat with reception & they adjusted it straight away. Only real criticism is (i) spare bed for my son was about as soft as granite and (ii) pillows almost disappear into nothing when you lay on them ( ask for more & they'll gladly oblige though) There are only about 10 rooms on each floor so the corridors are quiet. I've seen some comment about noise from the bars at night but I didn't hear a thing ( we were tower B, floor 16) The pool area is tatty & basic - the concrete it shot in many places, some of the slabs around the pool are loose and the loungers could do with a good scrub. Plenty of loungers around so no need compete with the Germans! A few irritating things (i) they seemed to be painting / varnishing something most days & there was a bit of an overpowering smell at times and (ii) whilst I enjoy music round the pool, they might want to consider that not everyone does - if they turned it down from level 10 then some people may be able to enjoy the pool area more. (iii) lifeguards have a job to do, no doubt about that but they are a little whistle happy for things tht really are no big deal Going towards the beach - it's a bit of a trek but no big deal. There are some nice gardens & grassed areas if you want to lay there. Big let down is the work they are doing - they are building sun shelters & all you can hear is a concrete mixer & power tools all day. The management should take heed of this & put themselves in the place of the customer as it really takes the edge off it. The building work outside the hotel is very noisy at times so be prepared to listen to machinery & general banging & crashing. Restaurants - in general these are expensive given their quality. Forget the evening buffet, its about £30 a head plus drinks and there is a limited ( and bizarre!) choice of hot main courses & unless you are a huge eater, you'll not get good value from it. They have a free kids menu ( as long as an adult has a main course) but our son is used to more sophisticated choices than chicken nuggets so they could think about re-vamping this. We used room service a lot ( why don't they extend the kids menu to this as well?) and went out to the malls ( etc.) to find a far far better choice. Breakfast is fine - it's a buffet with a reasonable choice to cater for most tastes. At some times it was a bit busy but nothing that bothered me ( and I'm an impatient so and so!). To summarise, whilst this place was OK & I had a good relaxing time, I wouldn't go back partly for reasons within the management's control & some outside their control. It looks like more substatial building work is about to start right next to it ( & I MEAN RIGHT NEXT TO IT!)& this would be nothing short of a nightmare!

Reviews.Title: “'' excellent''........................”
Reviews.Author: car_0_liner
Reviews.Content: we arrived early and the staff gave us our room without waiting at all, room was clean and exactly as described, our first visit to dubai and we are definitley going again, first class service/staff/food/ and to top it off the best weather we have ever had on holiday..........

Reviews.Title: “Poor guest relations”
Reviews.Author: Honesty66
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a romantic getaway for our anniversary night and i had specifically booked a tower room sea view facing for the purpose. Our room was not ready when we arrived but we were early so decided to have a bite in one of the restaurants. By the time we came back, check in took a long time. Every other guest on the counter was offered a welcome juice but not us and then we were given the key to a room without any explanation. Upon entering I realised it was land facing and a junior suite. I immediately called reception to enquire and they said that there was a shortage of sea facing rooms even though I had paid for one and had it confirmed on the reservation!!! No apology or explanation was given and the manager promised to move me into a sea facing one by the evening when someone might check out. However, I did not receive any call again and I was truly disappointed. If the view did not matter, I would have chosen a hotel in the city and probably paid half the price!! The one saving grace though was "Munchi" restaurant where the service and food was exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Five Star???????”
Reviews.Author: Pip000
Reviews.Content: We were on a 5 star luxury package holiday and were finishing off with 3 nights at the Habtoor Grand. The first room we were shown was a bit of a shock after the luxury of the other hotels we had been staying in. We were taken in a beach buggy to an annexe in the grounds and then taken up a flight og stairs and shown into a small, rather shabby room which smelt of cigarette smoke. We said that we couldn't stay in it so were told to go back to the reception. They told us that the hotel was full but they would see what they could do. They then gave us another room which was slighlty better than the first but was still in an annexe and was still not five star standard. When we complained again, the staff on reception were extremely rude and unhelpful. We eventaully demanded to speak to the manager and he upgraded us to a suite in the tower. This was lovely and was definitely five star. However, the experience was stressful and should not have happened. If you go make sure you are staying the the tower rooms and make sure you know exactly what you are getting. The grounds and pool are also becoming a bit shabby and are a little tired looking. Perhaps not the best choice of hotel in Dubai?

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: patchUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Habtoor for one week at the end of July, on check in we were upgraded to a Tower Family Suite, both rooms were spacious and airy and the bathroom was beautiful. The rooms were cleaned daily with an evening turn down service and the all of the staff that we encountered were polite and couldn't do enough to ensure you had the best possible stay. The staff at the Underground Pub were friendly and welcoming especially Karim and the bar manager Paul. The pool area was great as was the Horizon Pool. having stayed at other 5 start hotels in Dubai i would say that the Habtoor is probably one of the older ones but what it lacked in sparkle it more than made up for in personality and i wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. Thanks for a wonderful holiday.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel with lovely beach”
Reviews.Author: mehrdad48
Reviews.Content: it was my 6th trip to dubai but it was the best .we stayed at habtoor grand resort for three ht and we enjoyed of everythings We loved the Hotel ,We loved the pools and nigenviroment our room was in tower in 12th floor and it had very good view from garden and beach if you love sun ,shoping ,and you serch somewere to relaxation you find there,however we enjoyed there and i wish to be back there for another weekend

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC MEMORIES”
Reviews.Author: Sue44stokeOnTrent
Reviews.Content: Having read previous reviews I was a little worried having booked at this Hotel , however , I have now been and can confirm I had a fantastic time and the hotel was fabulous. Arrival and booking in was really quick , having done a night flite all I wanted was to unpack and relax, we were given drinks on arrival and we were checked into our room by 10.00am even though check in was 2.00pm. The food was amazing , again having read previous reviews I wasnt sure what to expect I went half board so I had breakfast with either lunch or dinner you could swap each day if required. Breakfast catered for everyone , there was even a pork station for people who wanted bacon and sausage, I was able to have a full english every day . Lots of juice , cereals , breads etc , fresh omelettes made to order there couldnt have been more variety. Lunch and dinner were very well put together again catering for all needs. Yes the drinks were expensive but everything else made up for this. The staff were the most polite to any Hotel I have been and they couldnt do enough to please , no one expected tips which I found strange as most countries the staff hang around waiting. I had room service at no extra charge at least three times and again the service was fantastic. The grounds to the hotel were spotless and again the waiter service outside was faultless. Taxis were readily available ( not expensive ) outside the hotel with the bell boys giving instruction as to where we wanted to go to avoid confusion. I would definitely recommend this hotel and can only presume that the people who were negative were just being picky. Having stopped in 5* myself in various countries this was indeed the best. I took my daughter to celebrate her 21st and she too had a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooms, Good Food, but expensive stay”
Reviews.Author: hbrb
Reviews.Content: Excellent rooms. Started off with a hiccup in that we didn't get our room till very late, but we were upgraded to a suite. We also encountered problems on the last night, as we were asked to move rooms, which was extremely annoying as we had to wait for the new room and couldn't go to the mall to do some last minute shopping, but the hotel did recompense us by putting us in the ambassador suite, which was a marvellous treat as we would never have afforded that type of room and it was nice to have spent one night, even if it was just the last night. The half-board restaurant was good, but disappointing in comparison to another hotel we have stayed at in Dubai previously - The quality of food and service was very good, but simply seemed the same every night. The other hotel I have compared to, had themed food nights and more choice of foods, which if the Habtoor provided or instead allowed its half board guests to use other restaurants on a subsidised basis, then that would have made Habtoor better in my comparison. The spa is pricey, but well worth it and I give it an excellent rating. Overall, I would certainly recommend the hotel and wouldn't say no to going back again, but wouldn't do half board.

Reviews.Title: “The best location for our trip to Dubai”
Reviews.Author: Zambizi2108
Reviews.Content: The welcome we receved at the Habtoor Hotel was excellent and check in process easy. We loved the Hotel and it was immaculate. We stayed in a family (tower) room and despite having teenage children this was large enough for us. We loved the pools. Food and drink was quite pricey (but Dubai is in general) however we enjoyed a fantastic quality steak at the steak restaurant. The staff at the hotel are friendly and no complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “5 STAR HOTEL AT REASONABLE PRICES”
Reviews.Author: kiatumti
Reviews.Content: 5 star hotel, family run, great staff, super food,good value, central,

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but Reception Staff quite unfriendly.”
Reviews.Author: aviateurx
Reviews.Content: Good Hotel and locale but the reception staff were frustratingly unfriendly. They are in the hospitality business but they can't even greet their guests with a smile and seemed unwilling to answer any questions. Check in was too long, I won't go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we wanted”
Reviews.Author: holidaytwo60
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from an 11 night stay at the Habtoor Grand and what an excellent time we have had. The hotel is beautiful and clean and the staff really helpful and friendly. We had a garden view room which actually overlooked the pool and beach,and it was spacious with a lovely balcony, and cleaned to a very high standard every day.As this was our 15th visit to the U A E we knew what to expect when it came to the price of food and drink, although to the first time visitor, £7-50 for a pint of lager must be a bit of a culture shock, but in the Underground pub in the hotel during happy hour (which actually lasts for two hours) the 20% discount on drinks does help, and the Carling lager is splendid. We dined in the pub most nights, and whilst this is a sports bar and can get a bit noisy, the food was superb. Lots of traditional English meals from great steaks to bangers and mash, all at a very good price. Some may complain about the prices in this hotel for beer and wine etc . but we visited other hotels in the vicinity i e The Hilton, Westin, and Royal Meridian which were more expensive.(although the Moods bar in the Sheraton) was cheaper but quite a way to walk. All in all this was alovely holiday at a great hotel and I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Saz77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Habtoor for 10 nights in Oct 2009 for your honeymoon. We found the hotel in an ideal location set on the beach, and only a 10 min walk from a new area that had been built with lots of different restuarants and shops, we found it very cheap to eat here and there was supermarkets as well to stock up on water for the room etc. The hotel was very nice, the rooms very comfy and quite largeand very clean the only downside was the price for drinks and food but you were given a complementry bottel off water after they had made up the room and again in the evening, it had a lovely pool used the gym once which was good but never used the spa. The hotel offers free transport to shopping malls but we hired a car it worked out about £25 for the day and saw all of Dubai, taxis are very cheap as well. We would definatly go back to this hotel if we ever went t back to Dubai you could not fault anything with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good - but very expensive!”
Reviews.Author: AWNotts
Reviews.Content: I have just come back from a 10 night stay at the Habtoor Grand. This was part holiday/part catching up with friends who live out in Dubai. Having read the reviews, I was a bit concerned about the cost of meals and drinks, both in the hotel and elsewhere, and I have to say, this is without doubt the most expensive place on earth. You do have to put things into some sort of perspective though. Given that we went during the oppresively hot months, we managed to get a 10 night stay (B&B) with flights for about £1,500 total. Which seemed very reasonable. So, you would think a few expensive drinks and meals is fair enough. Think again. Our exchange rate was about 5.1 Dirhams to the £1, which meant that.... Can of Coke from the mini-bar was an eyewatering £5, small can of beer from the mini-bar a staggering £9 and a small packet of crisps £5. Don't think that it gets any cheaper in the hotel's other bars and restaurants. These prices are more or less the same there to. If you want lunch at one of the bars/restaurants, you are looking at about £16 for a sandwich and chips. Don't even consider drinking wine - £35/£40 for a bottle of cheap wine. The hotel has free wifi, but if you don't have a laptop with you, the internet access next to the lobby is £10 per hour!!!!!! Now I fully expect the Manager to respond to this by saying that the prices are the same at other hotels, and you know what, he's right most of the other hotels are even more expensive. We went to the bar at the Westin and paid £11.50 for a pint!! I am sure that this is all due to the import taxes etc. but it did ruin our holiday because we were constantly arguing about what we should eat or drink. We were fortunate that our friends cooked for us on a few occassions, otherwise we would be bankrupt. Turning to the hotel itself, yeah its pretty smart, nice gym, nice restaurants etc. If you are the kind of people that have money to burn and what to stay somewhere nice then maybe try one or two other hotels along this strip. The Habtoor is certainly not one of the more impressive hotels. The Westin was absolutely stunning, but probably more expensive. The staff at Habtoor are ok, some really do go out of their way to help you, but the phrase "too many cooks spoil the broth" springs to mind. I have never been put through to so many departments and on hold so often just trying to order a cheese sandwich. When we arrived we were put in one of the cheap rooms overlooking the gardens. Plumbing problems in the bathroom meant that we needed to move rooms, which again "too many cooks" meant that we lost half a day sitting around waiting. Then, the air-con in our new room failed to work properly for the remainder of our stay. Although both the engineer and reception staff were quite forthright in telling me that I was wrong and that it was working. It never dropped below 26 degrees. If you like boutique hotels, then this is not the place for you. This is not a 'special' hotel. As a place, I can't really see the attraction to Dubai. The beach is dirty, littered and manmade. The shopping centres are impressive, but no cheaper than over here. I would however recommend the water park at the Atlantis Hotel. Lots of fun, albeit £50 a head to get in!! Thank God the taxis were fairly cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: iatto
Reviews.Content: Very short stay in a really good hotel. Beach view, spa and nice bars inside. Near Internet & Media City but with a holiday behavior..

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ras Al Khaimah, United Arab Emirates
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for mixing Business and Pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: timmy059
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. Had business partners from the USA and Denmark in the UAE for 3 days after 10 days all over the Middle East. Everyone could relax, business meetings went smoothly and it was all much easier in the setting of the Habtoor Grand. Having used the hotel personally for a relaxing weekend the atmosphere also allowed you to relax in a business environment and the room comforts allowed a superb peaceful night in extreme comfort. The service was excellent and my guests were allowed to hold the rooms for late check-out (due to their flight timings) which allowed the use of the excellent facilities (pool, gym, etc). Food was superb but the Grill needs a special mention for the quality and preperation of the steaks (which got a 10 out of 10) and believe me my guests are fussy!! However one of my guests liked it so much that all he saw of Dubai in 3 days was the drive from the Airport and back!! I personally live in the UAE and come to Dubai monthly for a weekend break. I only wish that every weekend could be spent in the Habtoor Grand

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Classy, Clean, Great service and Good Food”
Reviews.Author: Kirkwinger14
Reviews.Content: Went here for 5 days on first leg on our 3 week honeymoon. The Travel agent "Travelbag" recomended it and we were really pleased. Dubai has LOADS of hotels, it really is a minefield so I was happy to get some suggestions. The place is spotlessly clean, not mad busy and all the staff are very efficient. We went to the excellent spa and had a body scrub, which was a nice way to start the honeymoon. The pool staff look after you and hover around ( but discreetly) so you can call them over to your sun lounger and order food and drinks when ever you want and just sign it for it on the room. I felt a right lazy sod but it was great to get looked after. The Grill Restaraunt was superb, ( espcially when they sing happy birthday to anyone) the Lebanse Restaraunt was also good. Undergound bar was a good venue, ( but reminded us of home to much so wanted to avoid the typically English places.) Breakfast was good, plenty of choice,our room was a sea view tower room, nice and big, bathroom clean and they serviced the room twice a day, nice little touches like turning the bed sheets over at the top and leaving a chocolate by your pillow every night made it that little bit more special. I emailed them a few days before our arrival to tell them we were on honeymmon and on the second day they gave us a free bottle of wine and a nice cheese board with bread and grapes ( very much appreciated as wine is about 25 quid a bottle) I'm not sure if they offer it but dont take an All Inclusive option. Yes they have plenty of places to eat, but it's really easy to get a taxi and go to a different place every night. Make sure you get a copy of the Time Out Dubai magazine, we got one on the plane but they did have one in our room as well. It's a weekly mag that has loads of really useful info in. The main reason to get this is that the hundreds of Restaurants in Dubai will all advertise their offers on meal deals so well worth a look. Spoil yourself and go to the Burj Al Arab. yes eating a 3 course meal there is very expensive, but we went for the cheaper option of late afternoon Cockails. It cost us 185 dirims each( about 30 quid each) and we got 2 cocktails and a nice appertizer. They gave us a nice card with congratulations on your honeymmon and treated us like royalty. This is THE place to go in Dubai and when ever you see a programme or a magazine reveiwing Dubai, a photo of this iconic hotel always comes up. The experience was well worth 60quid. We also wanted to do some some sight seeing so did 2 trips 1. We went on a boat cruise round Dubai Creek at night which was good. Booked it with the holiday rep at the hotel, got pikced up and dropped off by car. Buffet food and soft drinks included this was about 40 quid each. 2. Went to the Dubai Museum and fort which gave a really good history of Dubai and also the plans for the future. It's all air conditioned, audio and visual exhibits and was very interesting. All in all the Grand Habtoor was excellent, we were very happy with it, I hope who ever reads this has as much fun as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Habtoor Grand - definitely a grand experience”
Reviews.Author: r18sso
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Habtoor grand as part of our honeymoon. On arrival our room was not ready so rather than keep us waiting, we were upgraded. We had a tower room with good views of the Palm. We were invited to the Executive lounge for breakfast for 2 of our 3 mornings - all the same food, but a little more private. Hotel facilities were plentiful. No need to bring beach towels, as all provided at the pool. Pool is huge for a hotel. It has a swim up bar that you can sign for drinks and meals to your room. Bars and resteraunts in the hotel are good. The Grill is excellent for a meal, and the Underground pub good for a drink and pub lunch. Ross & Leigh, Scotland

Reviews.Title: “super, smashing and wonderful”
Reviews.Author: ghazalion1
Reviews.Content: We have been visiting Dubai since 2004. We are a middle aged couple and enjoy a lively hotel, but also a quiet one. The Garden Room was excellent, like having one's own swimming pool, lounger and private entrance on hand. The breakfast display was excellent, (my wife and I work in the Hospitality trade in U.K)the hot part was well cooked and presented with great variety. The cold section again well displayed and good variety. Staff very attentive and so pro-active and empowered (oh how we struggle in the U.K. just to say "hello" to each guest) especially the Reception Duty Manager on the evening of our departure. Thank you Habtoor Grand it was the best so far, and we've been to some supposedly better hotels.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel - ignore bad reviews.....!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: helbellexx
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived home from our Honeymoon, and we spent 7 nights in the Habtoor Grand.... the breakfast buffet was just fantastic, as are all of the restaurants within the Hotel.... pool area is very clean and plenty of sunbeds.....staff couldn't have been more helpful and friendly and we had no delay in checking in on arrival (7am) . Our rooms were serviced excellently every day, twice a day! There is also a fantastic gym in this hotel..... could no recommend it enough...!!!

Reviews.Title: “BRILL NOTHING TO WORRY ABOUT”
Reviews.Author: ROWDAM
Reviews.Content: Had a great time here, nice and clean brill location, you don't have to spend loads on food we stayed Bed and Breakfast good choice, we went to supermarket to buy pop and stuff and put it in our mini fridge they didn't bat an eye lid. (supermarket 's on the walk) We took the metro to most places the metro is a 15 mins walk away across the Dubai Marina bridge it cost us around £10.00 each for the two weeks we stayed, and we went every where on it, all you need it to purchase the silver card then top up if needed, Food cheap in the Mall of Emirates we had Indian, Japanees etc all for around £6.00 each that includes our drinks. Staff in hotel very friendly, towels for the pool and beach are free, also free water everyday, all the normal stuff like shampoo etc in bathroom, clean bedding and towels everyday, We had a garden resort room and it looked over the pool. What more can you expect, READ ALL THE GOOD REPORTS NOT THE BAD, also book the trips from the hotel we went on the dune safari from the hotel good evening out. Could go on for ever about how good and nice it was, so don't worry if you have booked this hotel, i'm sure you will enjoy it as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money, good standard and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: travelCambridge
Reviews.Content: Staff were very friendly, breakfast had a good selection, great gym facilities - all modern, nice spa resort, the room was of a good size and everywhere was clean and tidy. Very good value for money hotel, there are many amazing 5*+ hotels in Dubai which may be even nicer, but to keep to a reasonable cost i would reccommend Habtoor Grand. Only downside is food and drinks in the hotel are expensive. Around £4 for a coke or £8 for a beer but is the same in all hotels so worth visiting the nearby beach walk area or taxi to Dubai Marina Mall as they are so cheap to use, just a few minutes drive away.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel! Excellent Location! Would definately go back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dolphin0077
Reviews.Content: Great hotel definately a 5*, private beach is 3-5 minute walk from hotel - very clean and stunning! On arrival we were checked in within 30 minutes and had a tower family room on 18th floor. Room extremley spacious and serviced to a 5* standard, housekeeping were fantastic - came in the morning and evening and we requested extra bottles of water which were no problem whatsoever. Music coming from 3rd floor bar was no problem at all, this was only on weekends and did not disturb us one bit! Stayed on bed and breakfast board which was great - so much choice (buffet style) and staff very friendly. Pool area is fantastic, very clean and staff everywhere happy to help. Prices of food/drink is quite expensive but its like that everywhere in Dubai. Location was amazing - 5 minute walk from "the walk" a long strip of cafes, restaurants, shops etc......even have a supermarket where you can buy bottled soft drinks, snacks etc for a much cheaper price! Overall, I thought this hotel was super and had the best time ever...............and please ignore all the negative reviews as these people have ridiculous expectations and should maybe stay at the 7* Burj al Arab Hotel!!! You cannot find a better location - takes 15-20 mins to all major attractions (Atlantis, Burj Khalifa, Dubai Mall and Mall of the Emirates) and taxis very cheap - all government owned and are on a meter! All staff extremely friendly and helpful..............GREAT HOTEL!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location for Beach Resort and Loads of Fun”
Reviews.Author: Guns304551
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in Jumeriah beach and funtastic location and crowd. Very good service and the rooms were big enough to accommodate extra bed. The swimming pools were nice (though the clorine levels could be checked) and the beach view is really good. Next to a small air strip, very nice to watch para diving in the morinings/afternoon. 10DHs taxi to Dubai Marina and Metro Station is ideal for travel to all over Dubai. There is no bus stop nearby, which means all the hotels including Le Meridien will not have public transport facility. All mall free service shuttle bus arrive and there is no problem to move.

Reviews.Title: “Good To Stay In ..”
Reviews.Author: Mansourx
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and the location very good also, the service better than expect but they have to load more car and laxurey .. the food cooked nicely next time I may stay long the price very Convincing ..

Reviews.Title: “pleasant hotel, beautiful beach”
Reviews.Author: ShahedaUk
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from Dubai. We stayed at Habtoor Grand for 4 nights. We really did our research before going on this holiday and wanted to pick a good hotel and good location on Jumeirah beach. I don't think we made a mistake. just like the name the hotel was grand. Like all of Dubai the hotel was spotless from early morning to late night. Litter was swept up before it hit the floor. People are cleaning all day long. We travelled with our 11month year old daughter. It was our first holiday with her and we were quite apprehensive about going to Dubai because of the hot weather and were worried if there would there be adequate facilities to cater for her. We had no problems what so ever. It was hot between 39-42 degrees during our stay but Dubai is more then well equipped to cater for the heat. The only place you feel the heat is when you are outside walking. Our daughter did not seem to mind the heat at all but we were careful not to stay out too long. We would call room service if we needed to heat up her baby food or sterilise her bottles in the microwave and they were more than happy to do this. We requested extra bottles of water and we were given them. Staff were always helpful. We were late getting up on our first morning and had missed breakfast however the restaurant manager allowed us to sit and have what was left which we thought was nice of him due to the little time in between the end of breakfast and the beginning of lunch service. The hotel provides you with robes, slippers, toothbrush, paste, cotton buds, cosmetic wipes, shaving cream, razors and plenty of towels of varied sizes. Rooms are cleans twice a day. There is a bar on the 3rd floor which does play music quite loud until about 2am. We stayed in a tower room on the 9th floor and could hear it quite loud but it did not effect our sleep because we did not sleep till 2am anyway. It did not effect our little ones sleep either. If you are a light sleeper is would most likely bother you.If we were any lower down in the tower it would have been too loud. We found the music was louder on Thursday night, maybe due to it being the weekend. There was building work near the hotel but it did not effect our stay. Some people have said that they have had to pay a deposit when checking in, we were not asked to do so. The receptionist did ask my husband for his credit card details but we said that we will pay as we go. That was accepted. I have read reviews on her which state that people were charged for items from the mini bar when they had not had anything from it. So we thought best not to give them a card to charge anything to. We did not used the mini bar as it was expensive just like anything you buy from hotel. We has 2 teas, 1 coffee, a scone and a slice of cheese cake at the hotel lobby and that cost us £25. There is a little mall called The Walk a 10min walk from the hotel where there are a few restaurants and a supermarket its much cheaper than eating at the hotel. Taxis are a good price similar to UK if not cheaper. You would pay a lot for a London cab. Some people have said that if the hotel gets a taxi for you it cost much more but that's not true. The Dubai taxis are the best, its the other private hire companies that charge more. There are 70,0000 Dubai taxis so you don't need a private hire company. one. The beach is beautiful and was not busy when we went. There are many water sports to do but are a bit expensive but thats Dubai especially if you are staying at Jumeirah. Arranging excursions yourself can save you between £10-£15 per person. I found out about some excursions in the Gulf Today newspaper available in the restaurant at breakfast which were cheaper then what the hotel was charging. There is a in house phone where you can call all Dubai landlines for free. The hotel is a good location, not far from many of the sites, Burj al Arab, burj dubai, various malls. Overall we really enjoyed our stay. Its a good hotel for young families. We would visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Introduction to UAE”
Reviews.Author: MissGGalway_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights during Ramadan in September. We found the hotel very tranquil and quiet, unlike other contributors. Maybe it was because of Ramadan, but there was no loud music or parties during out stay. We found the breakfast buffet more than adequate, and it catered to every taste. The items that were snapped up quickly were promptly replaced, we were seated quickly, and staff were on hand with tea or coffee, and to cater to our needs. We found the shuttle buses from the hotel to the shopping centres very helpful, but at time they could be very busy. Ok, there is a lot of building work going on around the hotel, but it does not affect your enjoyment of the amenities. The hotel is situated within walking distance of many other restaurants, and shops, which we frequented at night for a leisurely stroll. Yes, you did have to walk to the beach from the main hotel, but it did not bother us in the least, with the pool and the beach being away from the main building, you will not be disturbed if you are looking to have a sleep in. Rooms are large and clean, with a particularly spacious bathroom, and a lovely shower. We would return to this hotel. We found the staff very helpful, especially the bell-boys and concierge at the front of the hotel. They brought us to our room on the first night, and were especially helpful. Bottled water was replaced daily, or more often if they found the bottles to be used during the day. A turn-down service was included every night. We arrived late on the first night, and we ordered room service, which was excellent, prompt, and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “A 4* hotel trying to be 5*”
Reviews.Author: Wightwick1
Reviews.Content: We have been holidaying in Dubai since 2001. Previously we have always stayed next door at Le Royal Meridien (LRM). We have watched the marina area of Dubai grow before our very eyes and also seen the towers at the Habtoor being built. The reason we decided to stay at the Habtoor this year was because we felt that the service at LRM was not as good as in previous years. Yes, we understood that Dubai had suffered some financial blows like the other countries, but we didn’t expect the service to drop at the hotel (not when we were still paying similar rates to stay there as in previous years). In addition, with the credit crunch and low exchange rates, we thought LRM may have offered more “happy hours” and other special offers on food or beverages. We had looked around the Habtoor on previous visits to Dubai and we really enjoyed the Underground pub; they offered 20% off beverages, a good value menu and excellent atmosphere.
