On this basis, we decided to give the Habtoor a try! We arrived at the hotel early and were disappointed that we were not offered a complimentary fruit juice whilst we were checking in. Not important really, but it would have been a nice touch (this is after all a 5* hotel). Our room was ready early (11am) which was appreciated. We stayed on the 22nd floor in a tower room and were very impressed with the size, décor and facilities in the room. The bathroom was lovely with a walk in shower (at LRM, you only get a separate shower in the tower; club and standard room have over bath showers). We had a good view overlooking the grounds at LRM, the Gulf, the horizon pool and the marina. We had two complimentary 50cl bottles of Emirates spring water and the concierge said if we needed any more we should ring room service. Later that day we phoned for more water and we were told that we are only allowed two free bottles a day (at LRM you get about six bottles a day – the more you drink, the more you get). Part way through the holiday I noticed that our room was in the Grand Club. This means that guests can take advantage of the Club Lounge. We asked at reception if this was the case and we were told that we could use the lounge only once “to get a flavour of it”. We thought this was very odd; when our room has been upgraded at LRM we have also been able to have full use of the advantages that come with the upgraded room. Needless to say, we did not use the Club Lounge on principle. On our first evening we had a variety of complimentary fresh fruit in the room. This was a one off. We had to take fruit from the breakfast buffet for the rest of our stay (at LRM you get three pieces of “fruit of the day” each day). You should expect your room to be serviced twice each day; once in the morning (make the bed, tidy up, replenish tea/coffee etc) and then early evening (draw curtains, draw back bed, leave chocolates, replenish tea/coffee etc). This was very hit and miss. Our room was only serviced on five out of ten evenings. We complained to housekeeping the first time it happened, but the next evening the room was still not serviced. Again we complained. In the end we gave up; if the room had an evening service it was a bonus. The room was very noisy during the night. Six times we were awoken by loud music which went on until 2.15am. We think it may have come from the bar on the 25th floor, or the bar on the 3rd floor, or the tent by the horizon pool. Regardless of where it came from, it was very loud and even earplugs did not help. I would have hated to have stayed in a room on a lower floor. We first sunbathed at the horizon pool; on the third floor between the two towers. This was very quiet and pleasant with good views across the Gulf. For the remainder of the holiday we stayed by the main pool. Luckily the hotel was very quiet so the lack of parasols was not an issue. I would estimate that there was one parasol for every fifteen beds. You can sunbathe in the gardens, but there are even less parasols there. The main pool is part of the original Habtoor hotel (which consisted of the garden rooms and some of the restaurants). It is dated, but it is adequate. It was disappointing that the hotel did not bring round cold face towels – at LRM they bring them round twice a day in addition to cold water sprays and a small glass of flavoured slush (very welcome when temperatures are 45oC)! There is a pool bar and you can also order snacks. A 70cl bottle of English spring water is 25DHS and bar snacks range from 40DHS for a cheese sandwich to 65DHS for a chicken salad. A pint of lager is 38DHS and, if you’re feeling flush, you can buy half a bottle of Johnny Walker for 400DHS! These are normal prices for Dubai. Breakfast was very disappointing. It was served in Al Dhiyafa (the international restaurant). The tables were very close together and this gave it a “canteen effect”. You were not shown to your table; a waiter would hold his hand in the air to beckon you across the room – not very 5*! The buffet selection was poor, for example, the cheese platter had one type of cheese on it. The jams were served in large bowls (rather than small individual pots) as were the yoghurts. The worse thing was that no pork was served, so you could not have sausage or bacon with your cooked breakfast. They did serve veal bacon, beef or chicken sausages but they tasted awful. Pork was served in other restaurants in the hotel so I find it hard to understand why it wasn’t served in their “international” restaurant. They can’t say that they don’t serve pork for religious reasons because you can be sure that they served alcohol on an evening in Al Dhiyafa! The gem at the Habtoor is the Underground pub. The staff are very efficient and friendly. The menu is varied and value for money by Dubai standards. We also ate at the Thai, Italian and Lebanese. All restaurants were very good and very informal. Our friends have stayed in the Habtoor on numerous occasions and have always enjoyed their stays there. They last went in 2007. When we told them how the hotel is now, they were shocked and said that the standards have certainly dropped. What Dubai hotels must understand that is most people go to Dubai to experience the luxury and attention to detail one would expect from a 5* hotel. Standards are dropping yet prices aren’t. This needs to be addressed if Dubai wants to continue to be at the forefront of luxury holiday travel.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad..”
Reviews.Author: DavdH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weeks stay at the Habitoor.We are regular visitors to Dubai,must say this hotel was "nice" but not as" exceptional "as others we have stayed in.Bit confused why the need to put in tempory bar in the quiet area of the infinity pool ? especially as there were plenty of other places to drink and watch the footy.Though I found it quite amusing watching the workers trying to pin down the walls of the tent and errecting flags and curtains ! a bit "too many cooks spoil the broth guys !"However this did not spoil our stay. A special mention to the new manager of The Underground bar (David)..great geeza ! He always had a chat with us ,I watched as he interacted with almost everyone in the bar and was very friendly...a good asset to the Hotel.Only one real gripe...and it has been commented on several times on this forum...The cost of the drinks...I understand profit margins..taxes etc.....but come on managers ! maybe offset cost against soft drinks or food ? bogof ? Also dont put lemonade /water in the beer this happened to me in the Polo bar.. as at nearly £7 per pint that really is "taking the P...! "Would I stay in this hotel again? well as I said it was nice...probably go back to Jebel Ali next time though

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: belHanawel3amar
Reviews.Content: I particlarly loved the bathroom design, shower, room furniture, food was great, the World Cup coverage, staff friendliness, staff welcome chocolate, price, breakfast, and best of all, the VIEW AND THE BALCONY was awwwwesome :) However, I have small comments on the following: 1- I was given a higher price on the reception desk than the reservations call center. 2- I could heard the sound of the tv from the neighboring room, in my room 3- The AC was humid. The room had humidity when I first entered it, before i opened the balcony. 4- The tv was not very clear (fuzzy) Other than that, I reaaaaaaaaaaaally enjoyed my stay and would definately come back :)

Reviews.Title: “COULD BE BETTER”
Reviews.Author: DubaiLover_10
Reviews.Content: Reception could give a warm welcome to customers when they check-in. I was asked to pay 1,500 DHS as deposit for extras which I never paid in any of the hotels. When I complained about it they immediately had a solution that I cannot take any extras from the hotel without paying advance. Was annoyed and said yes. But they even did not allowed me to have telephone excess from the room. It was a hassel to go every now and to in-house telephone for making telephones. SPA is good but breakfast was not rich as other five star hotels. Not too many varieties and almost same things every day. Only 1-2 items chnaged everyday. Used hotel taxi just one time and he screw me up by charging more. He turned down the meter as soon as we arrived to place and before I could see the amount. The amount was for surely higher for the distance as check with hotel concerige and also with the shop I went. Possibly would not go to the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a smile . nothing too much trouble”
Reviews.Author: frankiefrost1956
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a sea view room, worth the extra as current building work still evident in the area although not intrusive - even builders in the street were polite! All staff went out of their way to be helpful. Cleanleness of the hotel - excellent. Stayed bed and breakfast - couldn't fault the food choices. First time to Dubai found the experience an enjoyable one although basics like meals out and drinking water were an expensive aspect of the trip.- would have apreciated information on where to go or promotion evenings in local hotels in the room to aid planning the evening out and entertainment. Saving up for a return trip at a less hot time of year -

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for younger people”
Reviews.Author: loobylooLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Habtoor with a girl friend in June 08 and again in June 10. It is a beautiful hotel, with plenty of glitzy features like everywhere in Dubai. In 2008 we had a garden suite (the booking was a mix up and we were upgraded) which was blissful. In 2010 we had a tower room which was also very nice but not the same sort of luxury and definitely missing somewhere to sit outside. The hotel has become much busier and noisier as it seems to have locals as members who come to use the facilities. This isnt a problem but be prepared on a Friday the pool gets packed and very noisy with young men showing off their wealth! The beach is lovely but we went at a very very hot time of year and the sea was 35 degrees so it was pretty hard going staying outside for long. The restaurants and pool bar were all very good - the grand grill in particular has amazing steaks and really friendly staff. In 2008 we had half board which meant we could have breakfast and lunch or dinner in the main buffet restaurant - I wouldnt particularly recommend this unless you get a good deal as the other restaurants are better. I would happily stay at the Habtoor again but be warned its not a peaceful retreat!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant holiday in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: WonderfulRetirement
Reviews.Content: Habtoor Grand was excellent, feared the worst after some reviews. Located with one of the best beaches in the world on one side and the new marina complex on the other. Taxis were cheap, free buses to Malls. Desert Adventures pick up and excursions excellent. There are better 5 star hotels, but not at that price. Drinks expensive, but that is Dubai and drinks in 5 star hotels are expensive. We had half board - choice of lunch or evening meal, both excellent, deserts especially. Staff very good, very polite and helpful. Beach resort is all new and at far end of Dubai from the old creek part. Leisure facilities at hotel second to none. Infinity pool wonderful. We never used the outdoor pool - beach and sea were too good. Beach and sea were very quiet. June is hot - 42C and amazing warm sea 32C. Was humid 67% on one day. Free bottles of water every day in hotel. Nearly all building work had fininshed - one apartment block nearby only, but not noisy. Room was on the Palm/Atlantis side - could see both and the Burj El Arab and that tall building, was quiet, and part of the new marina, and the parachutists in the afternoon were entertaining. One guest said there was no entertainment in the evening, they had just been to Las Vegas and the hotels there had shows on every night. Internet in the buisiness centre had to be paid for. Resturants in the hotel were used by local people and people from other hotels, that says something about them, nice to see the cars and visitors all dressed up arriving in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel where the customer comes first”
Reviews.Author: CED99
Reviews.Content: On our arrival at 12 noon, we discovered that the check in for rooms was not till 2 pm. We were very fortunate that the guest relations representative looked after us from our check in. The trip was a silver wedding anniversary celebration and we found that we were lucky enough to be upgraded from a garden room to a tower room. The room was lovely and was maintained to a very high standard throughout our stay of one week. We booked half board, which saved us a search for places to eat in the heat of the evening. The main restaurant runs a buffet service that offered superb choices of a high quality. The hotel fabric was of good quality, but was not brand new. Some aspects were in need of a facelift. The care and attention of all the staff was second to none. The cost of all drinks, including soft drinks, was exhorbitant. The Donovans from Essex

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not a match other five star hotels in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: LondonHelpful
Reviews.Content: We travel to Dubai at least twice a year and have done so for the last 15 years. We had booked to stay at the Movenpick which did not open as planned and found ourselves at the Habtoor Grand. We were given resort rooms which are definitely not as luxurious as the other hotels we have stayed. The standards of luxury very fairly average. The breakfast was also pretty poor compared to that offered by other five star hotels along Jumeirah Beach. There is a lack of variety and no attempt to cater to a range of tastes. All in all our stay here was like a 3 star - my benchmarks are the Jumeirah Beach, the Mina Sehayi, the Royal Meridien, the Hilton, the Sheraton. If you expect more don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Location”
Reviews.Author: TartanSeagull
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 3nites at the end of May as a stopover. We were a bit fearful after reading the reviews ............. but our fears were quickly dispelled. Check-in was quick and effeicent and as it was our honeymoon, we were upgraded to a Garden Suite and driven there by golf bugy! The room was massive, clean and had loads of nice touches. Breakfast was buffet style and the choice was brillant. Something for everyone. We had drinks in the Underground Bar, Polo Bar, Beach Bar and the Horizon. The Service in all of them was excellent. We only ate the once, in the Underground and the food was great .... I would definitly recommend the Vegy Platter. The Location is fantastic. Only 3 mins by foot to the "Walk" which has dozens of restaurants and shops. It is also only about a 12min walk to the Metro. We spent most of our time lounging in the Horizon Pool, nice and relaxed as families with kids stayed down by the Main Pool. Ok...... now for the gripes! ..... We were given a late check-out of 14:00 instead of the usual 12:00. But at 12:30 when I went to the room, the key-disc wouldnt work. Recetion quickly fixed this, but I got the impression this was a common occurance ..... maybe a wee spot of Staff Training needed? On the Friday morning, I asked the concierge about the Metro and I was told they come every few minutes ....... my wife and I wasted a 25min round trip walking there and back in 40 degree heat, as he didnt say it didnt open until 14:00 aaagggggggggghhhhhhhhhhhh! Whilst there is a booking service at the Hotel for trips, it would be a good idea to maybe have some leaflets displayed showing the route to the metro, times etc. Also some leaflets on the various museums in old Dubai. The price of drink is extortiant at £7 a pint, and whilst this can be justified by a high import license? ...... A can of coke costs 20p in the local shops, yet £4 in the Hotel?????? The Pool around the Horizon desperatly needs a make-over, the cushion covers have dryed in spills and the whole area needs repainted. The Room Manager - Osama - reads the reviews on Trip Advisor and the Hotel are listening! One of the common complaints is the noise at night from the Horzon Bar. 2 weeks ago, when we were there, they had started covering the area with a thick plastic tent thing to reduce the noise levels. ....... maybe in reaction to reviews on here? Overall I would agree with reviewers that this isnt a 5 star hotel but a very good 4 star hotel. It is exceptionally clean and the staff friendly and attentive. The Location is excellent and it has all the amenities you would ever need. I would defintly reccomend this Hotel to freinds.

Reviews.Title: “I must have stayed at another hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Angelaphilomena
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this hotel for the past few months, i was a bit hesitant about going there. All I can say is we had a tower sea view room that was light, airy and modern and could not fault it. The staff had people constantly cleaning day and night!! and i found the price i paid to be exceptional value for money. The drinks are expensive in the hotel as are all the hotels in Dubai, the food was lovely. So if you go on holiday to enjoy the country, meet the people, see the splendid sights and enjoy your stay you will have no problems at all. We can all find things to criticise about. One last tip, we went to the Dubai marina near spinneys supermarket and booked a speed boat (the yellow boat company) to take us around palm island and see the burj costs around forty pounds each, much cheaper than the hotel. Also phone the burj direct to book a visit and a meal, the hotel trips wanted to charge four times as much. glad I went so much to do and see.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel in dubai”
Reviews.Author: vickytonyphillips
Reviews.Content: stayed for 5 nights too long, very expensive, very noisy, they put us in a room over the night club and then tried to say the noise was not coming from their club, they did move us on the last night as the noise was so bad. My husband and I have travelled to Dubai for the past 12 years and have stayed at many of the hotels and we will not be going back to this hotel again. staff were not friendly at all, food and drink were much more expensive then other 5 star hotels in the area, breakfast was a free for all more like 3 star buffet, Swimming pool area crowded and the beach was a long walk from the main hotel

Reviews.Title: “Good for the price”
Reviews.Author: mturner66666
Reviews.Content: stayed for 6 nights 30 may to 6 jun in a club room. always worth the extra money in dubai due to the alcohol prices. club includes limo transfers , breakfast in seperate club lounge, high tea in the afternoon with food and soft drinks and happy hour 6 till 8pm all alcholic drinks included plus canapies . thanks to all the staff in the club lounge especially LEO. excellent service. The rooms were clean light and very spacious. we were upgraded to an ocean view suite with was twice the size with a seperate living room area. tv system and channels are outdated now for a 5 star hotel . non of the usually video on demand features you normally get. bathroom and shower were lovely. good selection of restaurants - thai, italian, japanese, steak grill and lebanese and well as the international restaurant. A large selection of bars - underground pub , polo lounge the white lounge ,pool bar, beach bar and the NOISY horizon bar near the infinity pool.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Break”
Reviews.Author: CliveGerrard
Reviews.Content: After a trip to the Indian sub-continent on business, my colleagues and I stopped off for a couple of days in Dubai. The Habtoor Grand was just what we needed, a hotel which is fairly formal but relaxing. The food was good without being spectacular. Unlike a previous submission (or possibly because of it) we had no problem getting an early breakfast in the room, despite an early check out, due to our flight time. There was a little confusion over whether it was already paid for, but it was soon rectified by the reception staff. Generally, the staff were courteous and helpful. In particular, 'Freddy and Sunil' at the 'Infinity Pool' who were chatty and welcoming without being overly intrusive. Their cheery manner, enhanced my experience and gave an insight into the facilities in the hotel, in general. We had a room by the pool, which was nicely furnished, although a few more 'westernised' tv channels would not have gone amiss. They were available in other areas of the hotel, but not in the rooms. But generally, the room was clean and adequately equipped. I enjoyed my short stay,and would certainly consider a return visit with my wife for a short vacation.

Reviews.Title: “great location, very busy!! infact too busy”
Reviews.Author: nayla2
Reviews.Content: Had a good stay. Service was good but slow. Main management service was awful. The slides in the pool were rubbish. No water on slides so really you don't slide you're practically having to pull your way down with alot of effort. The edges of the steps in the pool were very dangerous and sharp not at all suitable for kids. The tiling on the ground walking from hotel upto the pool very very slippery! Be very careful you keep away from all the furniture in the hotel as you will get charged for it. My son accidently broke a lamp in the lobby. Total accident as he went to sit on the sofa and it hit the side table and the lamp fell off. I was charged £200 for it even though we argued it was a total accident by a child who did not do this on purpose. Horrible, rude manager said "we will not let you leave the hotel if you do not pay for the breakage." Once again rude,arrogance on part of management. They charged us for mini-bar which was not touched. So yet another argument with mangement to prove something we had not used. Hotel charges you double for use of taxis if you ask them to book it for you. £10 per hour for internet usage So overall a bad experience

Reviews.Title: “great stay, dont know what people complain about”
Reviews.Author: geomilly
Reviews.Content: Looking at some of previous reviews we had some concerns after booking the holiday. We booked with heyes and jarvis and had excepional service from them. Picked up before customs at dubai and delivered to hotel by limo. Room allocated was over to the left of pool next to beach. Bit gloomy but functional. We paid an extra £25 per night in one of the towers overlooking the beach.Well worth it, comfotable, modern and clean. Yes everything is expensive apart from local taxis but this is Dubai and was expected. Pool area was slightly in need of tlc but better than what you get in spain etc. There is some metion of a noisy night club but there isnt one. There is a fantastic area on the third floor outside with music at night but after 10ish it is ok. As to unhelpful staff, we couldnt have wanted better service with smiles all round. I think that the way visitors treat staff goes a long way in getting a smile back!

Reviews.Title: “Great and good situated Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jgruters
Reviews.Content: The Grand Habtoor is very suitbable for families and younger couples. The rooms are beautiful with a big bathroom. Also the food is very variety. The situation is perfect with in the neigbourhood a walking boulevard with shops and teras, (no alcohol allowed outside the hotels)

Reviews.Title: “excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: sheefa
Reviews.Content: this is our second time here and we absolutly love it. the staff make you feel like your the most special person in the hotel,the food is superb, house keeping is very efficiant and extreamly pro. the beds and rooms are so comfortable to live in during the stay.the bathroom is nice and spacious, the service near the the pool is polite and helpful,no body judges you on where your from or how you look, like some hotels do. altogether we love the hotel and all it has to offer and will be defenatley coming again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonSallyJ
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a great four days at this hotel. Cannot fault it at all. Rooms gorgeous, service fab and everything you could possibly want. Even a specially made birthday cake for my friend's 40th birthday.

Reviews.Title: “Local mentality management”
Reviews.Author: W_J_007
Reviews.Content: Local mentality During my last visit to Dubai I thought it will great If I stayed near to the beach & the travel agent Alpha tours suggest for me to stay at Al-Habtoor grand hotel & he give me good rate including break fast . 1- I went to the hotel the chick in was very poor they side no room available, after 45 min they give me upgrade. 2- The hotel room & facility are good. 3- During check out they did not include the break fast & I show them the voucher but they stayed it is a mistake from the travel agent!!!! & since they already have my credit card & I have a critical time limit after spending 1 hour to till them this is not correct I become angry & pay whatever they say & left .

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jaddo
Reviews.Content: Always choose the right building with the highest floor not the left, because it has the BEST views of the palm jumeirah and Burj AL Arab and the WHOLE marina beach and sea... The hotel room was very calm and cool with a stunning beach feeling... the bathroom of the room was even better too!!! we had a balcony, it was quiet small but defenitly a plus because u can just stand there and stare at the palm...... though the only exception was the way the hotel lays out the beach benches which aren't quite attractive, and the hotel next to us seemed to have a longer beach!! overall the food is execellent all around instead of getting the old style card key when entering ur room, u get this cool casino ship looking key to enter the room!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service, wonderful restaurants - beautiful surroundings”
Reviews.Author: 2jagsmags
Reviews.Content: From Check in to Check out, the staff were efficient, polite, friendly and professional. The room was enormous and we walked out to the palmed area just before the beach. This hotel has at least five restaurants and the Japanese on the 25th floor, with a fabulous viewing gallery over The Palm is just unbelievable - YOU must eat here at least once. The garden buffet by the Thai Restaurant was exceptional value and absolutely wonderful food... risk here is eating far too much. Was not overly impressed with Dubai per se, but would recommend the Habtoor Grand for a luxury, restful holiday. Beware - Dubai is very expensive for food and drink - Beer £7 per small can ! Margaret from Haverhill

Reviews.Title: “Good Position but not ultimate luxury. OK but not great”
Reviews.Author: Travel4me999
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights on route to the Maldives. Our daughter lives in Dubai so we wanted to spend some time with her. We had a garden room and didn't see any rooms in the towers. The room was very large with two single beds pushed together. There was a seating area and fresh fruit with complimentary water. The bathroom was on the small side but clean. Shower was over the bath with a shower curtain(a bit of a pet hate of mine). Furnishings were traditional and along with the deco were a bit tired. A/C was very efficient. Garden pool area was crowded and lots of small children. Beach was a fair walk from the hotel. I agree with another review that it is a bit reminicent of Benidorm in the 1970's. Adults can use the 3rd floor sun terrace and infinity pool which is much nicer but the view of the ? dock /harbour airport is a little odd. We tried to take our daughter to both the beach and the pool area and were told in no uncertain terms that she would have to pay £ 20 to sit with us even if she didn't use the facilities. We were shocked, I know they have to keep out the general puplic but we were guests and this was our daughter. We had breakfast in the restaurant the first day and were not impressed. Then we received an invitation to the club lounge for breakfast the second day where the food was hotter and more acceptable. Dubai is very expensive - we went to the Meridian next door to the Habtoor on our last night to their fish restaurant - two courses each for three people and a bottle of wine was £260. The only places to drink alcohol are the hotel bars and they make the most of it. It feels strange to eat at a pavement cafe and not be able to order a bottle of wine. The Habtoor is well positioned for local eateries and the beach but is probably not the best hotel in the area for the money, so its worthwhile doing your research.Unless you are very wealthy you will need to take a mortgage if you want to really enjoy all that Dubai has to offer. One last thing we flew Emirates, the terminal building is stunning and I have to say the baggage hall was more impressive than our hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel shame about the price of drinks and water”
Reviews.Author: rod18
Reviews.Content: the hotel was wonderful room and bathroom were kept very clean and tidy fruit and bottled water left in the room everyday pool was lovely very good view out to the beach and sea all the staff were very polite and helpful the only down side was drinks were very expensive, nearly £5 for a half pint of lager we were half board and they were charging nearly £3 for a small bottle of water to have with the evening meal which we thought was very expensive seeing as you can buy the same water in britain for about 50p

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC HOLIDAY”
Reviews.Author: maya057
Reviews.Content: Before i booked this hotel i did read the negative views.However i felt they were a bit to farstreched.I had a 12 month old baby with me and these guys couldnt do enough for us.I felt like i was in paradise they were respectful courteous and always at hand.The club room we were in was fantastic with fresh fruit daily and arabian dates and backlava was given complimentary.Every evening our curtains were drawn by a porter with our beds prepared for us to sleep on the evening besides cleaning our bedroom daily.We were given towels twice daily.As we had a club stay here we had a private breakfast area in the lounge which was fantastic.The food and restaurants were delicious.We had our 12 month old child who was throwing a trantrum and a manager freed a waiter and entertained our daughter in the reastaurant walking around with here and amusing her. Further the hotel is immaculate and great pools and remarkable beach.reccomend it

Reviews.Title: “Away from Home to Poor Service ..”
Reviews.Author: armando419
Reviews.Content: The Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa needs immediate Top Management attention ... From the moment we checked in everything was wrong .. After traveling 26 hours we were given the wrong accommodations. We asked to speak to the Manager on Duty but he was no help at all, to the contrary he did not even want to listen to our problem. As Internet Access is a source of revenue for the Habtoor .. We were sent to the Business Center to purchase Access to the Internet ... The Cost USD12.00 for One Hour during a 24 hour period. This Access was only good to send one E-Mail as the Habtoor connection to the Internet was extremely slow .. Next time, I decided to buy more time but use the time at the Business Center location ... As the connection was the same, I was told I would be receiving 30 minutes free .. The connection was not any different. When we requested if we could print our return boarding passes we were told that we would be given 10 minutes and afterwards our credit card would be charged for " One Hour " of use ... The Habtoor is trying to generate revenue from any source available. As we could not print boarding passes we requested the Assistance from the Business Center to do something, her response was short and with a very negative attitude as we were bothering her. We asked to speak to the Manager on Duty ... With his help we were able to print our boarding passes. When we checked out our Bill had been charged for One Hour of Internet at USD12.00 and an additional charge at approximately USD24.00. We asked to take that charge out. It was not easy to have it done. In resume, the Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa should not be your selection if you are a Business Man ... Perhaps, if you are traveling with your family, children it may be a good choice as at your check-in, at breakfast, at the pool and in the hallway you will feel as if you are onboard a popular cruise line where everything that is offered has been done as a "massive production". You may also compare it to a popular timeshare ... The Habtoor wil charge you Top dollar for a poor connection to Internet. As far as, a quiet hotel the Habtoor is not ... You can hear the music and patrons from the Horizon Pool Bar through the late hours of the night. Next morning when you go to what is a quieter pool at the Habtoor, the garbage left from the prior night at the Horizon bar can be seen all over the floor and bar fountain. The Habtoor needs upper management attention. My recommendation, on your next trip to Dubai ... do your research .. There are many good and new hotels that will be pleased to have you and in need to have your business. In general, Dubai has great service and as a City it has a lot to offer.

Reviews.Title: “What more can I say !”
Reviews.Author: M6frank
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the different reviews on this hotel, I was a little concerned, but I had no need to be. A colleague at work had stayed there in Feb this year and had said how nice, clean and friendly it was, she was not wrong. I had emailed ahead and asked if we could have an early check in, being 5 mths pregnant and not wanting to hand around until 2pm. The girl on check in was only to happy to oblige, she suggested we went for breakfast and then the room would be ready. We had booked a tower view room and it was on the 8th floor, overlooking the infinity pool and pool bar. This concerned me a little as I had read the bar was open till late and had music / disco most evenings, this was not the case. The music was only played till midnight and from Tuesdays to Saturdays. It was not too loud and we slept easily. The room was super, huge, clean and had everything we needed including a rain forrest shower, which was super. The room was cleaned every day with fresh towels and toiletries if required, they even supplied mouth wash, which I had forgot to bring. The pool area is super clean, the loungers new and extra comfy, the pool bar is great, the food excellent, though we found a lunch shared meant there was no wastage, as the portions are huge. The beach bar was quiet a pleasure to spend a long lunch, watching the skydivers and the camels on the beach. The Italian rest by the pool was so good we went back and ate there on our last night, the food and service was second to none, the Filipino waitress was excellent, super friendly and very efficient, infact she needs a payrise and promotion............. The breakfast had enough choice to suit everybody and the staff were very attentive. We visited the Atlantis aquarium which we enjoyed, though being pregnant we did not go into the water park, but it did look fun, maybe next time ! The water fountains were my favourite visit, they are better than Vegas, sorry but they are, the shows are every half hour, we found a table at a great place, ordered some food and sat down to wait for the shows. Taxi's are not too expenisive if you do not use the hotel ones, slightly cheaper. All in all a excellent holiday at a super hotel, great weather and cannot wait to return. Not a bad word to say.

Reviews.Title: “A Chav-tastic Hotel if this is your thing!”
Reviews.Author: Donkeys-Travels
Reviews.Content: hmmm - where to start.......... We were moved to this hotel during the volcanic ash crisis to try and cut costs after we checked out of our hotel we stayed in for our holiday. We were booked in for 3 nights, but only stayed 1 night as it was so bad! It states it is a 5 star and to be honest on the internet the picture make it look like a nice place - but don't be fooled by this! It is like bates motel from the 1970's picked up from the Costa del Sol and dumped in Dubai! We were in a club room - which to be honest was no different from a normal room! the reception staff were rude and unhelpful at checkin- we asked them to move us to a different room as our bed sheets smelt of smoke and the room was like an igloo (the a/c was broken) but they would not move us! When we wanted to check out early too - they were rude and unhelpful! The food was terrible - we only had breakfast - but that was bad enough! how can a hotel get breakfast wrong? We took a walk around the hotel when we got there - the pool looked like it was good for kids - but the sun loungers were very close together. The beach is about a 7-10 minutes walk from your room and is not the nicest bit of beach - also they has plastic sun loungers that are about 2 cm away from each other and no parasols to be in the shade! So, all in all - we were glad to get out of this place after only one night. Don't stay here - it is awful! unless of course you like the costa del sol hotel style but want to glam it up in Dubai!

Reviews.Title: “Will go back again”
Reviews.Author: Ste56stbees
Reviews.Content: Everyone has their opinion and expectations and having viewed reviews before we went were a bit aprehensive but will go there again. 1. The staff bar none were superb - nothing was to much trouble and we were well looked after. 5*. More staff were needed around the main pool area though. 2. Yes the restaurant was sometimes busy at breakfast but only if you waited til the last minute. 4*/5* Got complimentary use of the club room after 3 days and that was a different world again - worth going for 5*. 3. Hotel in general, the reception, the room 922 and all the restaurants and bars were clean and not run down as some others have said. 5*. Well, except the beach bar which is in need of a refurbishment. 3*/4* ish. 4. The outdoor areas were immaculate too 5* until you get down towards the beach beds and bar area again some renewal of matresses needed but hey not bad anough not to be used 3*/4*. 5. The food in all areas was excellent - 5*. 6. Check in was good arrived at 08:00 and had the room before 11:00. All in all this hotel grows on you and we were very comfortable and content. The noise from the Horizon bar area was minimal and the couple of nights we turned in before midnight was not a disturbance at all. The Horizan bar and pool were something else. Again all the staff and Osama couldn't have done more for us to enjoy our stay. We were delayed because of the volcanic ash cloud and were moved to the Metropolian Hotel but that is another and not as good story...........

Reviews.Title: “Good stay in Dubai and Habtoor Grand”
Reviews.Author: Enjoysun12
Reviews.Content: Having booked this holiday in February, we read all the reviews and were quite worried what we had done as we have two small children travelling with us ( 4years and 7 months). On arrival at the hotel, we were made to wait one hour for our room which was not great after a 7 hour flight. We had booked a family room and once we got in, it was a stunning room on the 23rd floor. However, I had asked for a room away from the nightclub but we did not get one. As a result, we spent the first three nights up til 2am as the music was SO loud. To the credit of the hotel, they moved us after we told them about the noise. We got a suite and had a great sea view. Only problem with the room was that the shower did not work and they tried to fix it but no luck. But, we were very comfortable. Food - the food was excellent. We were on a half board package and I cannot recommend it enough. One night they provided a buffet seafood and you had a choice of a range of shell food including lobster. Very tasty. My four year old couldn't get enough of the desert table. It was very impressive. Service - Excellent and fast. We asked for quite a lot of items and got them within 10 minutes each time. Beach and swimming pool - A lot of fun and very enjoyable. Beach area is a bit of a walk but once you get there it is stunning. Camel rides are available and a must do. Water sports are very popular but expensive. Location - very good and convenient for everything. Downsides - Breakfast - tasty but very busy. Drinks - so expensive £7 for a beer and £10 for cocktails by the beach. Reception - i found to be poor and not helpful. Guest relations were much better.

Reviews.Title: “IGNORE ALL OTHER BAD REVIEW, EXCELLENT HOTEL!!”
Reviews.Author: Millyhol
Reviews.Content: I just want to say how wrong most of the other reviews for the Habtoor Grand were! It is a lovely hotel to stay in. Great accomodation the room was spacious with everything you require, bed so comfortable and cleaned and turned down service every day, staff very helpful, pool and beach area great! The breakfast was fab every morning. We will definately go back to this hotel as we had no problems at all. They even upgraded us to a sea view room. Great location also. Lovely Lovely Lovely

Reviews.Title: “nothing wrong with this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kirriereds
Reviews.Content: having read some of the negative reviews about this hotel all i can say is were they staying in the same hotel or what! my wife and i came to dubai to celebrate our silver wedding, from the moment we arrived till the day we left we could not fault this hotel in any way. the check in was good, staff excellent, garden room first class and going to breakfast was certainly not a problem. the guy who looks after the beds at the beach is worth his weight in gold. i must say our flight out of glasgow with emirates was excellent, thanks to all the crew for a great flight, the champagne was much appreciated. another nice touch was the free cheese platter and wine in our room for our anniversary. i must thank the person who warned about the taxi circus, only use marked taxis. within five minutes walk form the hotel is the famous beach walk, it is a must even if only to watch the parade of flashy cars, brilliant. plenty places to eat and shop. next time in dubai we will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we staye longer!”
Reviews.Author: loobyloo1802
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights on the return to the Uk after a week in the Malives, we was on the 16th floor room 1602, ha a great view to one side was just sky scrapers to the the other was the marina and on a good day you could see the Atlantis Hotel, looking down we was above the Infinity pool. The room was very large with a huge comfy bed and a huge shower it was great, and air con that worked, each day you get given 2 small bottles of water, we had 2 fruit baskets and a cheese plate over the 3 nights we stayed. The only slight issue we had was on the Tuesday there was a disco and our room was above it, we did ring reception and they offered to move our room to a upgraded room for the rest of our stay, but as it was 10.30 at night and the disco only whent on til midnight so we stayed put. They did even offer to send a bell boy up to pack all our things for us so we didn't have to do a thing! The shop in the hotel costs a fortune £27 for sun tan lotion! There is a Boots just round the corner on the main strip if you need and thing like that. Reception was very helpful to us, and also the guest service desk giving you info on anything you ask. Breakfast was very nice lot's to choose from, pool area was very busy but it was school holidays, the infinity pool was always very quiet tho, we walked own tot he beech but never went in the sea there was a lot of jelly fish which put us of. My husband used the gym an he said it had more equpiment than JJB gym in England, there is 4 tennis courts if you wish to play, also the spa, hair salon etc etc... On a whole Dubai is fantastic so much to do so wish we had stayed longer now, but wanting to return soon, i shall post some pics shortly, but please any questions please ask, at the end of the day you go to see/do things not to spend the whole time in your room, i looked at reviews on here when we was sat at the airport in the Maldvies waiting for our flight here, and i thought OMG! But we had a great stay life is what you make of it i guess, so why grumble about petty things!

Reviews.Title: “4th visit to Dubai and a seasoned traveler”
Reviews.Author: harryhedghog
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so bad I am writing my 1st review, paid to stay at a 5* hotel and put in a smelly 2*room in the grounds 110. stayed 1 hour, the room was dark and dank, the reception falling apart with could not careless staff, this Hotel is living on past reputation, check out the chiped and battered reception desk, the falling apart filling cabinets, the holes in the walls, the cirgarette burns on the furniture and the stunning black streaks of dirt on the lobby dome centre piece, change the management and spend some money, there are far better Hotels in Dubai!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent facilties great for kids”
Reviews.Author: harry-enfield
Reviews.Content: Please do not listen to the bad reviews this hotel is excelent, great for kids lots to do but great to relax lots of restuarants to chose from and a more laid back atmosphere that is hard to come by in Dubai. STAY HERE BELIEVE ME YOU WONT BE DISSAPOINTED.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but needs refreshing”
Reviews.Author: Paul050
Reviews.Content: On arrival the staff were very helpful and allowed us access to our room much earlier than advertised. The food was good although the breakfast restaurant became rather crowded and a little closer to Butlins than a 5 star hotel. The main hotel was very elegant and our Garden room could not be faulted for either its features or cleanliness. If there was one (slight) criticism it was that the pool area had started to look a little tired and in need of a fresh coat of paint and some new parasols. This was extended to the beach area where there were limited beds and even fewer serviceable parasols. All in all very nice just needs a bit more TLC.

Reviews.Title: “unacceptable”
Reviews.Author: omerlutfiii
Reviews.Content: Any staff that you asked sth says "I'm not responsible". Good hotel, lazy staff.. Be carefull

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not perfect.”
Reviews.Author: KISC
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Habtoor Grand on several occassions. Overall I like the hotel and location. The staff is helpful and overall I would rate food and beverage as very good. Bartini is a nice addition (however it was empty). As usual, the gym is excellent. Now the bad: 1. Do not expect to get sleep before 2AM in rooms overlooking the rooftop pool. The music and party destroy any chance of sleep. 2. The beach front furniture looks like it has hit by a hurricane. All the umbrellas were torn and the lounge cushions dirty. On a scale of 1-10; this is a 1. Too bad, a really nice beach. 3. Check-in / check-out continues to be problematic. Allow yourself 30 minutes for both activities. 4, Taxi's - know where you are going. Even with the doormans assistance, getting a cabbie that has any idea on how to get to the location that you seek is a 50-50 proposition. 5. The rooms, although spacious, are in need of freshening up. Particularly new carpet. It's a shame, a few relatively minor changes could make this a great resort; by nothing seems to change.

Reviews.Title: “Very much family orientated”
Reviews.Author: traveller1094
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights post cruise and would not recommend this hotel for couples, more for families as it was over run with children and very noisey. We had requested an early check in as we were disembarking a cruise ship at 9:30, when we arrived at the hotel the room was not ready however we only waited about an hour to check in, we were offered breakfast as we had an early departure on day 2 and would have missed breakfast that morning..Although classed as 5 star in my opinion this was more 4 star, we have stayed in far superior 5 star hotels in Dubai.The room we booked was a basic tower room which was adequate for the nights we stayed it did have sea views however if staying longer than 2 nights would probably recommend a balcony room..The room was clean but did smell of food and it looked a bit dated, nice bathroom with the usual little extras,,First impression of the hotel was not good either as a lot of building work was going on around the hotel, there was a lot of noise and we didn't like the location.. Until you try a hotel you don't know what it will be like and you learn from mistakes. We would not choose to book this hotel again..

Reviews.Title: “I would question the 5* rating”
Reviews.Author: PKTouring
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in other 5* hotels in Dubai this hotel does not match up to our previous experiences. The service in the bars in the hotel is indifferent and we were at one point accused of not having paid for our drinks. The tower suite we had was pleasant but not good value at £400 per night. The hotel is a bit tired in places.

Reviews.Title: “awful,loud,worn out.”
Reviews.Author: lanagogetter
Reviews.Content: we always stay at 5 * hotels,this was not a 5* one,all the furniture is worn out,no wireless internet,in fact you have to pay lots of money for cable internet service,the check in staff too rude,we were in room no,1021 the sofa bed was full of BUGS and COCKROACHES!!! our kids ran out of the room screaming,they moved us to the 2321 club room to shut us up,the breakfast is not good,the cakes tasted awful,the toaster either burned or threw the bread out of the machine!!! tables TOO close to each other,no tissues in the room,too far from the beach,had to walk under the scorching sun to get to the beach!! the staff left things in the room after cleaning the romm,too loud music from every-where till morning,the restaurants TOO expensive,no welcome drink.....I could go on and on forever,don't go there there are much better 5 * hotels with private beach in Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay & Great facilities”
Reviews.Author: Elyes B
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa for 5 nights last week ...Overall stay was good and no bad surprises at all and good value for money …Below you will find some bullet points summarizing our recent stay: -Hotel location: located at the end of Jumeirah beach but still close to JBR, Marina Mall, Ibn Batouta Mall ...Easy access to Sheikh Zayed Road from where you can reach Emirates Mall and other places -Hotel facilities: pool is good, a good choice of restaurants and food (Lebanese, Asian, Italian, snacks, etc), beach is ok but not as expected (a bit far from beach sitting area if you are a lazy person / Swimming perimeter is very slight). Didn't experience the Spa but looked ok. - Night entertainment: Underground Bar is nice ...Horizon Pool is really great, you have to go there and enjoy the music and the ambiance (We liked it pretty much) .. Service: very friendly and helpful stuff, however front office stuff might appear a bit rude (can't blame them, they are overloaded as Hotel seemed very busy) - Overall: it was a great stay, hassle-free and no bad surprises at all ...We took a Tower Room in the 10th Floor, space is ok for a couple ...The view was great (even without a balcony) ...The price was very reasonable ...Conclusion: Highly recommended ! Only 3 small negative points: -Room furniture not really: seemed outdated and not as expected from a 5* Hotel...A bit disappointing but it still a matter of taste ... - Room Service breakfast: it was really overpriced! Approx. 30 USD for a continental breakfast per person!!!!! - Check-out time: you need to provide them with the EXACT time of check-out, otherwise they will ring you every 5 minutes ….(It was very annoying!) Hints: -if you are sure you are going to Dubai, select "advance purchase" on their website, you can get a substantial discount -Hotel limousines only are allowed …I recommend you to rent a car at the airport if you are planning to visit around ... -Ask for rooms in the “Right side” Tower building XX24 or XX23, view is really great and no bad surprises (unless they switch the rooms numbers! :))

Reviews.Title: “Shocking!!!”
Reviews.Author: MuscatGunny
Reviews.Content: Where do I start ? yes I know Dubai is a building site but this hotel has it right on its door step and on all sides making access by foot or car at times difficult. Check in became a joke with myself and other poor soon to be guests, with only 2 staff on the desk dealing with check in and check out I waited over an hour to check in and the que in front of me was not large, each person took on average 15 minutes to check in or out, reception looked shabby with broken filing cabinets and a very tired appearance in general. The room was unbelievable it was on the ground floor and looked out onto a louvre screen housing a air conditioning plant the chair at the desk in the room had a broken leg which was hanging off and when I called housekeeping they sent a maintenance man to repair it which he did outside the room in the corridor !!! the constant noise from the service alley backing onto the room made for a disturbed nights sleep. Breakfast at 100 AED resembled a military mess deck with no room between tables and very ordinary food and coffee and tea slopped out at request, in between meetings I decided to escape my gloomy room and take coffee in the reception lounge after 15 minutes of trying to order coffee I gave up. Time to check out ! only 45 minutes this time O and watch out for the 100 AED internet charge its daily or part off not 24 hours so for an overnight stay it cost me 200 AED for internet access. Sorry I will not be returning to this very shabby and tired looking hotel, there are far better and cheaper hotels in Dubai. - Andy Andrews Muscat Oman

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, expensive food & drink, pool furniture poor”
Reviews.Author: DanCheshireUK
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at this very good resort hotel with super amenities. It was disapointing that the pool recliner wooden chairs and especially the umbrellas, which there were not enough of, were desparately in need of upgrading and took the "grand" out of "grand". The cost of drinks and food was extremely high however the standard of food at all the four hotel restaurants we tried was excellent. The Lebanese evening buffet was a highlight. D L Boon, Cheshire, England

Reviews.Title: “Good Room shame about the food/drink prices”
Reviews.Author: heloiseDevon
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Room worth upgrading to to DeLuxe on upper floors as noise from bars could be a problem. The room was serviced twice a day. Strangely during our stay a vacuum cleaner was left propped up in the corner outside our room odd in a 5star hotel. Think the cleaner should be encouraged to put it away. Breakfast food selection good but tables crammed together, one morning we were put into side room which had only one waiter and a senior waiter who's only role seemed to be to then fill up the room with families service was dreadful and even after we got up went to the main dining room to find a waiter we still waited ages for coffee. Beach furniture needs a makeover many sunshades broken but beach staff very helpful. The beach was lovely to walk along and we noticed other hotels offered better garden facilities. Beers cost £8 each!! and the prices in the Italian Restaurant were crippling for a plate of mushroom rissootto (rice & mushrooms) we were charged £14 each pizzas were £30, water was £4 a bottle. We were lucky as there was mimimal building going on so very little noise intrusion. from this. The staff were very pleasant and the pool was lovely but not sure we'd choose this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It was a pleasure staying at Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa!”
Reviews.Author: Zinaida11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Habtoor for 2 week in January/February 2010 with our 9 months old daughter. Our first trip abroad together, the three of us. We recommend the hotel if you go to Dubai with small children. The facilities are good (baby cot, fridge, water cooker available). The staff is also very helpful. The location is also perfect. Just a quick walk to The Walk! Three negative remarks are that the hotel rooms above the Horizon Lounge (Pool Deck Bar) do hear the music at night at Thursday and Friday (even when you are on 20th floor!). The second remark is that the quality of the food you order from roomservice is poor. Not at all value for money. Very expensive and poor quality! We also had to pay a lot of money for using Internet in our room. I think a 5-star hotel should have this for free in the rooms as a service. Habtoor staff, thank you for given us a pleasant stay in Dubai. Hope to visit Dubai again soon.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel has somewhat gone down on maintenance!”
Reviews.Author: Mabs01
Reviews.Content: i have been at habtoor grand four times i guess and i found the hotel maintenance has gone down from what it was! i like the hotel and the staf is extremely courteous and i even enjoy the food there. Being a gym admirer i think by far it has the best gym i have seen in many hotels across the world. definitely a place to stay at, provided the cleanliness is maintained.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutly Brilliant, people on here dont appreciate how good this hotel is”
Reviews.Author: LOVEDHABTOOR
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review as i had actaully NOT read the Tripadvisor website before booking this hotel, i simply looked on the website and was satified that this was the place to Stay with my mum and my son who is 4 on our first trip to Dubai. This is a 5star Hotel on Jumeirah Beach, wich is what we were looking for alongside other hotels, however this one came up as the cheaper deal for us, and as we are not super rich we went for it on a half board basis as it was £1200 cheaper than the rest in the vicinity. (more shopping money!) I then came across tripadvisor and read the reviews and became really worried about the Horizon Pool Disco Noise as mentioned in most reviews becuase i was travelling with my mum and my son, i did not want this to be unpleasant for them. I emailed the hotel right away and expressed my concern about the room and the noise, i was mailed back straight away and told that they would do everything they could to accomodate my request for a quiet room and exceed my expectations. fine, so i wait until we get there and to my surprise they had upgraded me, great!! it did take a while to alocate the room but i think thats because we arrived at 9:30 am and officially cheack in isnt until 2pm but we wanted to settle after a long flight, anyway after talkin to my contact Osama, who was such a nice man we were sorted with a beautiful tower sea acing room at 1pm. This room was on the 11th floor underneath the Horizon Pool (3rd floor) in the same tower (there are 2 towers) but i thought this is such a nice room, lets see what these reviews are actually talking about.. Well pleasantly suprised the disco DID NOT keep us up we were sound asleep and only ever heard the first half hour of the music, and yes it was on every night, however depending on what you expect from the hotel and the price you pay, you need to remember that this hotel does have the Bar on 3rd floor and plays open air music, I was really worried about it but actually it was never a problem to us, my mum never heard it and my son wouldnt even notice it ater a long day out, it was fine. Be realistic if you want and expect NO noise on this holiday then Pay £2000 more and stay somewhere else like the jumeirah Beach or the burj if you are lucky..,even then cant guarantee any noise!!!.. This hotel is ina fantastic position, right by shops and bars and has free shuttles to all the malls, even better, the staff are amazing especially Cathy and Savio in the restaurant, i mean i could not have asked for better hospitality and believe me i am Fussy and do expect good service, the place is CLEAN and rooms are cleaned Twice a day, what more can you ask for?.. free water is left everyday in the room and fruit and cakes, blimey this is somewhere you can put on weight!! they spoil you... We also went Half board highly reccomended as the food is delicious, so fresh and tasty, honestly you are spoilt for choice!! no bacon but who wants english breakfast in dubai?? I you have kids like myself they will be spoilt rotten, staff love them and there is a great pool and waterslide for then as well as the private beach. Yes there is building work all around,Dubai is Construction city!!! if you do not want to see it or hear it then dont come. here.. half the buildings still need to be completed.. and their building more... this hotel may sufer more from building noise than say the hotels in the middle of jumeirah beach but its hardly noticeable when you are having on playing on the beach or just relaxing but the pool with music. Peoples reviews on here are unfair to the hotel, i think they have been very unrealistic, at the end of the day as i said before, if you pay less for a 5 atar than another 5 star then what do you expect? this hotel done more than enough and more, exceeded my expectations and therefore we had a fantastic holiday and did not want to leave, we will be back Habtoor, this was the best trip we have had and we woulfd like to day Hi to Osama, (Cathy, Savio and Mohammed in the restaurant,) they work so hard and always have a smile on their face,thats what holidays are all about, making you feel comfortable and welcome and thats exactly wat this hotel done. Thank you so much for a fantastic stay xxxxxxxxxxx

Reviews.Title: “I will not do it again”
Reviews.Author: al3ana
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with colleagues (total= 4 people), our first request in the reservaion which was done before the arrival to the hotel was our rooms should be close to each other or at least to be at the same floor. And after waiting about 45 min. at the front desk as the rooms were not ready, the final result was really funny, each room was in different building, one room in the north tower, one in the south tower, one in the north resort and one in the south. It was really bad experience, Never do it again.

Reviews.Title: “A Real Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: CSPLeicester
Reviews.Content: As a first trip to Dubai, our stay in the Habtoor Grand just made the trip extra special. The hotel, grounds and service were first class. Our room was upgraded on arrival and on my birthday the room staff left a beautiful cake and card in my room. The roof terrace bar would be noisey at the weekend for guests who might have wanted an early night but other than that I loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Dont forget your hard hat !!”
Reviews.Author: weepeter1970
Reviews.Content: In the middle of a building site, new hotels on two sides and new road on the other, Cranes everywhere,hotel and staff great, but does not look like the brochure sky scrappers all around 2 and 3 times the size ,local taxi firms not allowed to wait outside,only there own private cars at twice the price !!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel i have ever stayed at”
Reviews.Author: rubyalice
Reviews.Content: From the time we arrived until we left we were made to feel we were the most important guests in the hotel. Our only complaint was we were not staying longer .Thank you to everyone there.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: julesd7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel during October half term and really loved it. We were very luckily upgraded to a one bed suite with fabulous views and it was wonderful. Breakfast was delicious with a wonderful selection to choose from. Rooms were well serviced with turn down service in the evening and chocolates on the pillow and lots of complimentary bottles of water. Pool outside was lovely, only thing was they could do with some new mattresses on the sunbeds as they are tired and dirty looking. Lovely water slides for the kids which my daughter loved. Hotel is on the beach which is very clean with warm sea, and camel rides on the beach! We did a city tour arranged by the hotel which was excellent, also desert safari which was superb and worth every penny! We went to Ski Dubai in the Emirates Mall and that was such fun, well recommended. We had tea at the Burj which was expensive but very decadent and memorable. This hotel is in a great position as you can walk to a lovely line of shops with lots of restaurants, and it is so safe. Would love to go again!!

Reviews.Title: “A very good experience”
Reviews.Author: jsjan1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Habtoor for two nights before a cruise, had a very good room with an extremely good view of Palm Island and the Atantis, room was very clean and very comfortable. The weather was not too good so the bar outside was not open so therefore the nights were very quiet as I had read reviews about noise from the Horizen bar. The service and helpfulness of the staff was excellent as was the food. The only thing that felt could be improved is that on checking in or out, I think it would work better if they had a desk to check in and a desk to check out as it was a bit chaotic. Having said that we would definately stay there again if we returned to Dubai.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding service and lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Delilah68
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Habtoor hotel for February half term and experienced the best service from hotel staff in years. Every single member of staff throughout the hotel was helpful, friendly, attentive but not intrusive and delightful. The hotel has wonderful facilities, we hardly wanted to leave to go sightseeing. Fantastic gym, good pool and spa. The club rooms were lovely and this gave us access to the club lounge which provided a complimentary,stunning high tea every day. The hotel is situated very close to a great area for cafes, restaurants and shops for evening walks. We will definitely be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely child friendly, comfortable hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: katieren
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our 4 children (8, 8, 2 and 7 months.) The hotel gave us 2 cots and two extra beds for the older kids all free of charge. There was plenty of space in the room for us all. It was pricey but cheaper than other beach front hotels. The "Club" status allowed us to have breakfast in the club lounge which was excellent. They also laid on a fabulous afternoon tea (with chocolate fountain which the children loved) and evening drinks and canapes. The pool was great for us all and there were three lifeguards on duty throughout the day. The staff all went out of their way to be helpful. The restaurants were equally child friendly. We would particularly recommend the Lebanese. We acknowledge other people's comments about the rooms not being 5 star standard and the front desk staff being unhelpful. Yes, maybe. But, the room was clean and very comfortable and ideal for our requirements. The outdoor staff more than made up for front desk staff.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable,good location but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: dublinsun79
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times and keep returning ever year. It is not as fancy as some others but has a great location on the beach ,near the marina and beside the jumeriah beach residence. The steak house and the thai restaurants are lovely, stay clear of eating in the english pub, horrid food. Overall, lovely stay, good value for money, nice staff. Book a tower room, certainly not a resort room and maybe a garden view room, there dark but nice and at the pool!!

Reviews.Title: “May have been Grand one day but, not now. however very grande prices.”
Reviews.Author: yakyak2010
Reviews.Content: Having read reviews a week before the trip, we considered changing the hotel - wish we had. Arrived at 8a.m. and we had the wrong room offered at 2pm and eventually room with sea view and balcony at 5pm. Queue while booking in grew very quickly and it took about 45 minutes to book in to be told 2pm. We should have paid a little more and stayed elsewhere. It almost seemed that they were running the hotel down. Expect to stay alongside a building site because you drive through it. In months to come there will be massive building work carried out alongside on the promenade development - I would not advise anyone to stay there then. Do not use their limousines unless you have extra spending money to give away - I am still waiting to see whether they charge me for a transfer that we did not have - the bell boy took our room number before we asked for a city taxi. Booking in took forever, room was average - not a five star rating. We waited by the pool for our room to be ready and were unpleasantly surprised when spending £6 for a glass of fresh orange juice. Standard of food was OK (not 5 star) but, not amazing. All prices are double what you would expect to pay. Did however, have a very nice meal in the Thai restaurant. Head North to the Walk for excellent evening meals at half the price. Pool very warm and pleasant. General staff were extremely helpful and pleasant. It does appear that the hotel are out to make a lot of money while they still have the chance. Do not swim off the beach - many unpleasant floaters, including condoms.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste you money”
Reviews.Author: overa
Reviews.Content: At the airport we booked into Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa for a 3 night stay. 5* hotel, I very much doubt it, more like a 2* if you are lucky. We were taken to the room and did not even go inside - it was facing the garbagecans and would never ever see daylight. According to the representative at the airport we had booked a room with a view ! Fortunately we have been around a bit and were able to get another room - but the price was way above what we had been told. They charged us apx $ 1.000 for 3 nights and absolutely no service was rendered. The only Internet-option they had was $ 20 per hour wether you used it or not. We thought they would grant us 5 minutes as a courtesy for the inconviniency they had caused us, but they just looked at us and obviously did not understand what we talking about. And the noise from the bar kept us awake til 3 in the morning - what a 5-star ! ! ! No, I will certainly not be using this hotel EVER again and will NEVER recommend to any friend of mine. Poor, poor, poor and very disappointing ! ! !

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel :)”
Reviews.Author: Jax64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on a half board basis in November last year for my 50th birthday. We really enjoyed our stay, it was our first holiday to Dubai. The hotel was fantastic, our room was spacious with fantastic views of the beach, pool and infinity pool. We really could not fault the room. The hotel and grounds were excellent, plenty of places to eat and drink although we only ate in the main restaurant so can not comment on the food in the others. There was a wide variety of food which was excellent. I am a pool person and don't normally go in the sea but I have to say other than the infinity pool on the 3rd floor I only went in the sea, the beach was clean with plenty of sun loungers. The hotel is in a great location, clean and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Would not hesitate to go back there again, which we hope to do in the future.

Reviews.Title: “tired, run down, poor, unhabitable,never use again EVER!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: babycass
Reviews.Content: I recently was booked into Habtoor Grand Resort & Spa for a 2 night stay. 5* hotel, I very much doubt it, more like a 2* if your lucky. I walked into the hotel was taken to my room had one look at it and walked straight back out. What a disgrace!!!! The hotel is very tired looking, the cleanliness of the hotel was what I would describe as unhabitable. I payed £500.00 for the two nights stay for three people just to walk in and walk straight back out. I will certainly not be using this hotel EVER again and will NEVER recommend to any friend of mine. Poor, poor, poor and very disappointing!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the money”
Reviews.Author: CoopersEngland
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from five night stay and cannot praise the hotel enough.The staff could not do enough for us wherever we were in the hotel.We stayed half board which made the stay very reasonable more so by dining in the Al Dhiyafa resturant every night where the choice and quality of food was amazing. One very pleasing and surprising presentation to my wife was a birthday card and cake delivered to our room.We would have no hesitation in either recommending or staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Carefull when they call you a "TAXI"”
Reviews.Author: fish2000
Reviews.Content: The hotel gardens, swiming pool and play ground for kids is 5*. However I was disappointed when I learnt that this hotel takes payment from a private hire company, in return the hotel guests are offered this company as taxi. The only difference is that their meters charge you double official Licenced Dubai Taxis. If you stay at this hotel ask for a Taxi that says taxi on the car, let them know you dont want a "Limousine". ( they call theis standard basic korean/Japanies cars "Limousine"). I feel that this hotel is charging 5* rates and they should not need to cheat their guests by making money through the private hire comapany.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Ehsan A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Habtoor for one night and day with wife and kid. No majore complaints. Best part of the hotel is the pool (both adult and child), the child pool has an amazing waterslide, the private beach and very close to the "walk". Clean facilities, 5 minute walk to the "Jumeirah Beach Walk" which is full of shops, restaurants, cafe's. We ate at the walk as it is much cheaper. Very nice rooms, LOVE the bathrooms! It's also relatively better priced than the other 5 star resorst on the beach, but I have never seen those other resorts so I don't know how they compare.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dora48
Reviews.Content: On arriving in the early hours of the morning, my Mum and I were checked in and shown to our room efficiently and by very polite and well mannered staff. Throughout our entire stay at the hotel the manners of bell boys, room service staff, waiters, receptionists could not be faulted. Our room was very clean and spacious, it was on the 4th floor and overlooked the Horizon bar and pool on the floor below. In the distance you could see Atlantis, infact it was a lovely room with a lovely view. That was until night time when the Horizon bar and pool became an open air night club. It was impossible to sleep until the music finished in the early hours of the morning. However we were assured it wasn't open every night, just Tuesday and weekends. We were only staying 3 nights, so it wasn't a problem, we would be away before the weekend. Unfortunately, staff higher up the ladder seemed to have the chip on their shoulder. This was first realized on the day after our arrival Mum suffered from severe sickess and diarrhoreoa. She was too poorly to get out of bed so I went to breakfast on my own. Before leaving the restaurant I asked the waiter attending my table if I could take a couple of slices of melon to the room for my Mum as she was unwell. I was told "certainly". As I walked out of the restaurant I was stopped and frankly humiliated in front of a very busy restaurant by a maitre de (maybe) and told I could not take food from restaurant. I explained my Mum was poorly. He told me I had to order breakfast from the in room menu. I didn't want breakfast I only wanted a couple of slices of melon. He spoke to another man in a black jacket (another maitre de maybe) who was standing a few tables away and told him I was taking food from the restaurant and it wasn't allowed. By this time I had actually started to cry, mainly from embarrassment. The other man came over, again I explained that Mum was poorly in bed and I only wanted to take a couple of slices of melon, he said no problem and put them in a small container for me. Later that day Mum was admitted to hospital suffering from severe dehydration caused from a virus of some kind. On my arrival back from the hotel, I found a basket of fruit and a get well card in the room from room service staff and bell boys. This was a wonderful kind gesture. Reception also phoned to ask after Mum and assured me if I needed anything to just ask, she also offered me to be driven to the hospital in a courtessy car as and when required. Also a very nice gesture. We were due to check out the next day but arranged with travel agent to extend our stay for another 3 nights while Mum was in hospital. I requested to change rooms so it wouldn't be as noisy for Mum when she got out. I was told there was a room on 23rd floor, still overlooking Horizon but assured it was quiet. It was NOT!!! I asked to move room again and even offered to pay for an upgrade to move from a tower room to sea view. I was told that was impossible. Mum was discharged from hospital. I went to collect her in hotel car but was charged for it. On querying this at reception they knew nothing about the offer of a courtessy car. There was also a very expensive hair extension of Mums that strangely just disappeared. I accidently left it in our previous room, on speaking to a manager I asked him to check the room to which he replied there were guests in the room. He assured me no room is let out to guests until it is thoroughly checked. I asked him to check with his staff to which he replied (very patronisingly) I should check our luggage. I told him I was not happy with his attitude and he told me to go to the police. Very disappointing attitude from the staff, especially under such horrible circumstances with Mum being in hospital. We checked out immediately and went next door to Le Royal Meridien for yhe remainder of our time in Dubai - if only we had booked in there first. 1st class all round.

Reviews.Title: “.”
Reviews.Author: MarieO79
Reviews.Content: A good hotel at the beach. Love the Horizon pool and bar, lovely view =) Good staff and good room on 15th floor

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service from all the staff, in particular the ones at the guest relations desk”
Reviews.Author: yogiEngland
Reviews.Content: we spent 4 nights at the hotel on our way back from Tanzania.Stayed in a sea view room in one of the towers.The staff that we encontered in all the different places were very polite and helpful.The ones at the Guest relations desk were exceptionally helpful and very informative. about local attractions as well as how to access them A big thank you to all.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning..”
Reviews.Author: johnnyboyzante
Reviews.Content: This hotel was situated right on the beach at the Jumeirah resort, The staff are just incredible. Getting around was very reasonable using the plated taxis rather than the hotel private taxis. This hotel is used by celebs i bumped into Andy Cole ex Man Utd and England striker by the pool.We did quite a few trips but would recommend the Dubai Mall Fountain. It is right next to the tallest building in the world and if you like shopping it is i would say the pick of all the malls. The fountain is just amazing. Also the Atlantis Hotel offers the chance to go in the pool with the dolphins and waterpark it was an amazing experience.Dubai is beautiful and fly with Emirates unbelievable place holiday all round.
